name: AZENTIVE, LLC Edit
elevator_pitch: AZENTIVE is a majority woman-owned company that integrates wellness, sustainability and emerging technologies based on biomimicry approaches for healthy profits, people, planet and plants. Through the ALife Engine -- our flagship fusion lighting technology -- AZENTIVE brings the only true sunlight indoors, replicating the exact ratios of photons of the sun’s electromagnetic spectrum (UVB to Far IR). AZENTIVE is currently focused on using this fusion sunlight technology in indoor agronomy.
description: AZENTIVE is led by Dr. Kat A. Donnelly (MIT PhD) with experience founding three startups, leading large-scale projects (30+ years, budgets to $60M), and bootstrapping Empower Efficiency revenue to $7M over 2 years. Sundarajan Mutialu, co-CEO, has yet more experience leading startups, developing and deploying technological inventions, and running companies. Our team boasts extensive experience with plant science, sustainability/efficiency, wellness, materials engineering, behavioral and social science, engineering systems, R&D, manufacturing, entrepreneurship, and more. We have also developed a robust sales pipeline of customers, slowly building up our production, as well as our sales, marketing, and plant science capabilities. It is AZENTIVE's current mission to deliver the cleanest and most nutrient dense food, while substantially reducing the energy and environmental impacts of indoor agronomy.
technology_description: The ALife Engine is a fusion lighting technology that creates plasma at a high rate extremely efficiently. Plasma is the fourth state of matter and is also the same matter found on the surface of the sun. The ALife Engine technology creates plasma by exciting ions with a magnetic field and changing the state from solid to liquid to vapor to plasma in a vacuum-sealed quartz crystal bulb. As a result, the system creates sunlight at tremendous density, far exceeding typical LEDs that require huge numbers of light emitting sources to achieve the same amount of light -- but only a fraction of the sun’s electromagnetic spectrum. The bulbs have no electrodes to wear out, enabling an almost endless lifetime. The ALife Engine also creates very little heat compared to any other indoor grow lighting technology, making it the most efficient indoor grow light on the market. The ALife Engine offers significant potential to scale up nutrient-dense food production in volume-efficient areas, allowing for local food production. It is the only light source besides the sun that produces radiant flux to deliver the electromagnetic sun spectrum that is necessary for all life on earth. The quality of the light produced is uniform and spans the electromagnetic spectrum -- from 285 nanometers (nm) to 1650 nm and beyond. Providing true sunlight improves the health, respiration, growth rate, nutrient density, and yield of food crops. In addition, all system inputs required for plant production are reduced, including the time to harvest, as well as electrical load, nutrients, supplemental CO2, volume requirements (one 1100-Watt light covers a minimum of 1000 cubic feet for light hungry crops and substantially more for low light plants), etc. True sunlight also allows for biodynamic growing, even indoors. This enables the use of organic living soil built up through compost beds and teaming with beneficial microbes, fungi, and bacteria additives. This living growing medium along with the ALife Engine supports the plant, and allows it to express its complete range of nutrients that are coded in the plant’s genetics just like outdoors. No other indoor growing system enables growth like mother nature. Growing comparisons of food and other crops grows against LED, Metal Halide, High Pressure Sodium, and Ceramic Metal Halide growing lamps have shown that the ALife Engine offers: 1) Substantial decrease in electricity (W) and power (Amps) requirements; 2) Substantial increase in root mass, plant yield, and nutrient density; 3) Decrease in input requirements; 4) Decrease in vegetative growth time; and 5) Increase in respiration rates to improve the ability to uptake CO2. Induction, diode, and electrode growing lighting sources provide inadequate radiant flux for indoor growing, causing high lighting and cooling loads, lower nutrient densities, limited crops that survive indoors, and short technology and spectra lifetimes. The lighting sources are technologically constrained and require suboptimal tradeoffs in spectral range or uniformity. The ALife Engine has the potential to displace Solid State Lighting (SSL) systems, specifically LEDs, as the state of the art for low-energy, high-productivity growth of nutrient-dense plants. The existing body of research on light quality and photomorphogenesis has shown the importance of the bioavailability of light throughout the electromagnetic spectrum for both plant growth and nutrient development. Though variations in photosynthetic efficiency exist, all frequencies of sunlight are used by the plant for development. In particular, Ultraviolet B and A (UVA/UVB), blue, green, red, infrared (IR), and far IR all play key roles, with a combined impact that is much greater than the sum of the individual parts. The technology is in commercial and production use in North America and Europe, as well as around the world as the preeminent solar simulator for R&D and quality control of production solar cells and arrays. Numerous plant-based installations have been deployed in North America and Europe with a steadily growing customer base. The AZENTIVE team is also in various phases of exploration for the numerous other market applications for sunlight, especially in the health and wellness arenas.

name: BAKMAN TECHNOLOGIES, LLC Edit
elevator_pitch: Bakman Technologies is a leader in Terahertz (THz) technology. We develop, manufacture and sell THz instruments and components worldwide. We are currently developing a UAV mounted THz spectrometer capable of performing point detection of air pollutants and other gases of atmospheric importance. We have over thirty patents related to THz technology.
description: Bakman Technologies manufactures the world’s only portable, turn-key, frequency domain THZ spectrometers. We also manufacture the only two-channel THz spectrometer that is capable of simultaneously measuring the transmitted and reflected THz power from a sample. Both of these systems are integrated into a chassis that weighs only 2.5 kg. We also manufacture and package our own photomixers using telecom accepted practices. The photomixers are so robust that they are capable of repeated use at temperatures as low as 4.5 Kelvin. The electronics, lasers, photomixers, chassis, firmware and software were all designed specifically for our line of products. The custom design has enabled us to make our spectrometers practical and cost effective. Furthermore, the systems were designed to be adaptable and capable of easy integration into existing equipment for OEM applications. The spectrometers are sold worldwide and have been used for multiple applications including: explosives characterization, material characterization, fuel and oil analysis and bio-sensing. Customers recognize that unlike time domain systems, which rely upon expensive mode-locked lasers, photomixing systems only require two semiconductor lasers and are therefore extremely scalable. This means our technology is the most viable choice for researchers developing applications for large markets.

name: BEACON BIOSIGNALS Edit
elevator_pitch: We aspire to become the world’s computational neurologist. Our mission is to make EEG accessible and actionable using AI and hardware to guide drug development and improve patient outcomes.
description: Catalia Health brings together artificial intelligence, psychology, and medicine to deliver lasting change. They create effective patient engagement and generate unique data of value to customers. The cloud-based platform delivers unique conversations to patients to help address their ongoing healthcare issues in an effective way. These messages are delivered through mobile apps, a web interface, and the uniquely engaging (and patented) interactive robotic coach. Customers are healthcare companies who are searching for effective behavior change solutions, including pharmaceutical manufacturers and distributors, home health agencies, and healthcare providers.
technology_description: Beacon Biosignals is developing a scalable brain-monitoring software platform with integrated machine learning analytics. Our platform ingests standard clinical EEG data to facilitate faster review with automated analysis, labelling and report generation. Algorithms based on our published research are trained on the largest known clinical EEG datasets in order to automatically obtain quantitative sleep staging, sleep spindle feature analysis, seizure detection with ictal pattern sub-classification, interictal spike detection, and our BrainAge biomarker. Our analytics enable objective understanding of EEG features correlating with drug dosing, toxicity, and efficacy. This further enables retrospective and prospective development of companion diagnostic algorithms to identify optimal patient cohorts and track disease progression, even in small cohorts. Alongside our platform we are developing a rapidly-deployable wireless EEG, the SpotLite. Our sensor wirelessly transmits EEG and other real-time physiological information to the cloud. This technology lowers the threshold to enable all patients and participants in clinical trials to have personalized neurological diagnostics in trial-meaningful timeframes and benefit from our algorithms.

name: BEFORE HEALTH INTELLIGENCE LTD Edit
elevator_pitch: Before Health Intelligence develops and utilizes proprietary AI-technologies to identify early warning signs of critical events with high accuracy for individuals at risk. Our algorithms process intensive longitudinal data from commercially-available wearable devices such as smart watches produced by apple, Garmin, Samsung and other companies to learn the health state of a patient and predict when and how changes of the state may occur.
description: Before Health Intelligence provides cutting-edge AI-technologies to identify early warning signs of critical events for patients at risk. Our algorithms process clinically-relevant time-series obtained from commercially-available wearable devices such as smart watches produced by apple, Garmin, Samsung and other companies to characterize the health state of a patient and predict when and how critical changes of the state may occur. According to the World Health Organization, ischaemic cardiovascular disease is responsible for 16% of the world’s total deaths (8.9 million deaths in 2019). Moreover, it is the disease with the largest increase (~29%) in deaths since 2000. Approximately every 40 seconds, someone in the United States will have a myocardial infarction. On average in 2019, someone died of stroke every 3 minutes 30 seconds. There are numerous factors such as advanced age, obesity, high-blood pressure, smoking etc. known to significantly increase the risk of acute ischaemic events. Given standardized scoring systems, clinicians are capable of indicating a higher probability of such events within a time-window of a few years. Yet current medical approaches cannot further refine the timing of the infarcts. These events remain, in nearly all cases, sudden and unanticipated. An accurate, temporally refined early warning system with a prediction range of a few days will therefore allow clinicians to therapeutically intervene and observe patients at risk in anticipation of such events and thus, significantly reduce their probability and the associated fatality. Such warning systems require continuous recordings of vital data, however the majority of medical devices providing such data are not appropriate and feasible for long-term patient monitoring. Making use of data collected by wearable, widely-used smart watches, our AI-based technologies provide clinicians with the urgently needed warning systems. It further will enable health-care providers and insurance companies to assess risks in a more accurate, quantitative manner. It is however noteworthy that the capabilities of our technologies are not limited to cardiovascular diseases and can be extended to neurological and psychiatric disorders. Our approach has been validated by a set of preclinical studies, generously funded by European funding agencies such as the Horizon2020 program, and published in peer-reviewed, high-impact journals.
technology_description: We collect high-resolution physiological and behavioral time-series from each patient and use machine learning algorithms and methods from statistical mechanics to characterize the disease dynamics. Similar approaches have been successfully applied in academic research to characterize ecological state transitions and diagnostics of psychiatric diseases. In contrast, our company develops and utilizes these technologies to identify early warning signs in an application-oriented manner. In other words, our goal is not only to characterize the current state of the disease but to credibly predict the probability of critical events within narrow time-frames. Our technology benefits significantly from the ease of use and comfort of smart-watches on the market, in comparison to traditional medical devices, to collect the data.

name: BEVEL Edit
elevator_pitch: Bevel Software offers an AI-powered solution for legacy code maintenance. By automating documentation, extracting business logic, and generating visual code diagrams, Bevel reduces legacy assessment phases by up to 70%, minimizing reliance on subject matter experts. Its deterministic analysis ensures accurate, hallucination-free outputs, facilitating efficient code comprehension and modernization.
description: Legacy codebases often lack proper documentation, making maintenance and modernization challenging. Enterprises and consultants face prolonged discovery phases, increased costs, and dependency on scarce experts. Bevel addresses this by providing automated, accurate documentation and insights into complex code structures, streamlining the understanding and updating of legacy systems.
technology_description: Bevel uses a proprietary static analysis engine to build a precise knowledge graph (KG) from legacy codebases, capable of scaling across millions of lines of code. It captures implicit logic, brittle conventions, and cross-cutting dependencies typical of legacy systems. Unlike traditional tools, it grounds AI generated content on deterministic outputs, eliminating potential hallucinations. The platform supports multiple languages, including COBOL, Kotlin, and TypeScript, and integrates seamlessly with IDEs like VS Code. Operating entirely locally, Bevel ensures enterprise-grade security, with no code leaving the user's environment. We allow users to share this over git, critical for integrating with the workflows of our users.

name: BILAYER THERAPEUTICS, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: Bilayer Therapeutics seeks to develop bile acids as first-in-class therapies to treat diseases of the colon such as motility disorder and metabolic disorder (obesity, diabetes) using a novel, unique and patent-protected colonic delivery technology invented in Dr. Langer's lab at MIT. We have raised $3.6 million in seed funding and are seeking to raise a Series A of $14M to open our first two INDs and to then conduct our initial clinical program for both indications.
description: Bilayer Therapeutics seeks to develop bile acids as first-in-class therapies to treat diseases of the colon using a unique and proprietary colonic delivery technology. In its portfolio, first is BL-010, a therapy for chronic constipation as beachhead indication followed by BL-050, an orally available drug for metabolic disorders such as obesity and diabetes. The approach is based on bilayer tablet technology invented in Dr. Langer’s lab and patented by MIT. The active ingredients, two bile acids called chenodeoxycholate and ursodeoxycholate, work through a receptor in the colon called TGR5 and increase intrinsic GLP-1 levels, a mechanism similar to approved, injectable GLP-1 receptor agonists for diabetes and obesity such as Ozempic and Wegovy. We have raised $3.6 million in seed funding already and are seeking to raise a Series A of $14M to open our first two INDs and to then conduct our initial clinical program for both indications.
technology_description: Bile acids are naturally occurring compounds made in the liver, aid in the digestion of fats, and act as hormonal signaling agents by binding to the receptor TGR5 in the colon. They play a role in a number of diseases of the colon including motility disorder (constipation), metabolic disorder (diabetes, obesity), and others. They exert their effects variously by increasing the production of incretins such as GLP-1, by managing fluid inflow into the colon, and by increasing the colon's motility. The development of bile acids for these indications faced several hurdles including the need to deliver them locally to the colon, to deliver them with patent protection so products cannot be copied, and the cost to develop them into a prescription drug. Bilayer has overcome these hurdles by developing a novel, unique, and patent-protected bilayer tablet technology that delivers bile acids locally to the colon; by creating a patent portfolio protecting platform, product candidates, and compositions of matter; and by lowering the cost of development by using the capital efficient 505(b)(2) development path.

name: BIOBOT ANALYTICS Edit

Biobot’s technology leverages urban studies, computational biology, engineering, data analytics, and design towards a first application to generate a new type of data on the opiod epidemic. Current methods of quantifying are reactive -- a count of the number of overdoses and emergency responses. Biobot is pioneering the move to a proactive model of measuring opiod consumption while people are still alive.
description: Biobot Analytics provides cities with data on the opioid epidemic: the biggest public health crisis in the United States. Biobot Analytics measures the consumption of various opioids so governments can evaluate public health programming and redistribute resources -- currently at billions of dollars in the United States -- accordingly. With this, Biobot is building the first comprehensive opioid consumption dataset.
technology_description: Biobot Analytics is a wastewater epidemiology company that is transforming wastewater infrastructure into public health observatories. Its wastewater monitoring technology analyzes urine and stool samples to create a health database that is independent from hospital reporting systems, free from societal biases affecting who can and can’t seek care, and most importantly, rapidly adaptable to new and emerging public health threats.

name: BIODEVEK Edit
elevator_pitch: BioDevek is a medical device company, focusing on the development of advanced surgical sealants. Through rigorous large animal preclinical models, our innovative products have demonstrated superior performance and safety compared to existing market offerings. Our sealants' simplicity in delivery makes them an ideal choice for the rising trend in minimally invasive procedures. Presently, we are in the process of our Series A fundraising round, which will pave the way for obtaining 510(k) approval
description: BioDevek has created a series of smart materials — materials whose physical forces sense and titrate surface chemistry and adhesive force to the local environment — to prevent complications associate with internal surgeries. In the same way that pharmacology can be tuned to individualized to create personalized medicine, these materials can personalize their tssue:material interactions to each individual, individual target and individual disease/altered state. As such, the force of adhesion of a specific formulation to the lung, colon, heart, bone etc. will be titrated to idealized adhesive force required. The company has leveraged a decade of academic and scholarly development in the Edelman and Artzi Laboratories at MIT and has a number of issued patents (licensed to BioDevek) and publications in highest impact materials science journals. Moreover, we have worked in parallel on different programs partnering with strategic partners such as Ethicon and Boston Scientific, targeting indications covering cardiovascular sealing and endoscopic polyp resection. These joint development programs have been most successful in defining the application space and allowing Biodevek to generate its own intellectual property. We completed a comprehensive set of studies of the biomaterial platform including biocompatibility following FDA recommendations and both acute and chronic large animal preclinical models to demonstrate the efficacy of our hydrogel solutions. The most immediately applicable and exciting application is infusion of the gelling adhesive through and endoscope to cover wounds left in mucosal surface at the time of e.g. polyp excision. We are poised to initiate scale-up manufacturing of our sprayable formulation for endoscopic application following polyp resection — a procedure that exponentially grows in numbers for early screening of colon cancer. We have completed a series of animal studies in pigs showing that our formulation prevents complications and provides with a pro-healing microenvironment.
technology_description: We have created an adhesive sprayable liquid bandage that can be delivered using standard endoscopes, and creates a thin but strong layer on top of the wound that protects and reinforces the wall integrity while minimized the risk of bleeding. Our material displays similar properties to the underlaying tissue, the intrinsic features of the polymers used, can modulate the wound microenvironment limiting inflammation while accelerating wound healing without the need of any drug. We have demonstrated the biocompatibility of our technology in vivo models and its efficacy in pig studies, where the group treated with BioDevek’s material displayed no bleeding or perforation over 2 weeks. We have brought the attention of several strategic partners working in the field of endoscopy and they have validated our solution in their models with excellent results.

name: BIOMIXING Edit
elevator_pitch: BioMixing has developed a new agitator/aeration system (patented) for bioreactors that uses aeronautics and fluid dynamics concepts to reduce processing times by 50% and shear stress with great client satisfaction. At the industrial scale, the better mixing allows a reduction in energy consumption. Our product offering includes the whole bioreactor with our Biomixing system inside or just the agitator/aerator system to retrofit existing bioreactors. Additionally, we can make simulations (CFD)
description: 1. The first problem is with regard time: many biological reactions are slow & this limits the production capacity. 2. The second problem is product quality. If the culture is not well mixed, in some parts of the bioreactor the culture conditions is non-optimal leading to nonhomogeneous culture. Obviously, this can be solved by using a more intense agitation, but this could damage the culture (producing shear stress). 3. When working at large scales, the energy consumption of bioreactors can represent a significant cost. 4. Finally, culture growth has to be done in several steps (the so called scaling process) which, again, limits the production capacity. Biotech companies (large pharmas, CMOs, CROs, food biotech...) can have these problems.
technology_description: Our technology is based on aeronautics and fluid dynamics concepts and implies a different geometry and different combination of aeration and agitation systems and baffles. It is the combination of geometry, number and position of all these three elements what provides the key to success. Our product offerings include a number of bioreactor agitation/aeration systems of different sizes that are optimized for specific types of cultures and different customer needs. These systems can be incorporated in new bioreactors or used to retrofit existing bioreactors. Additionally, we can make simulations (CFD) that can help in the scaling process.

name: BIOSENS8 Edit
elevator_pitch: BioSens8 is engineering novel wearables to enable health ownership. Due to a lack of sensing parts, products akin to the continuous glucose monitor (CGM) are missing. BioSens8's platform identifies sensing parts in just 3-6 months, not decades, to address this problem. Instead of taking 60 years to build the CGM, our team can engineer similar monitors in less than 3. A multiplexed wearable for hormones, neurotransmitters, organ health markers, and drug use will give unprecedented insight into ou
description: Currently, there are 7.7 million females in the US ages 15-44 with fertility issues. 40% of these women have ovulatory dysfunctions as the primary reason for being unable to become pregnant. Fortunately, serum progesterone and estrogen levels can predict and confirm ovulation with very high specificity. However, there are currently no at-home, quantitative, and blood-based hormone monitors which allow women to assess their ovulatory and menstrual health. There are existing ways for women to measure their hormone levels which inadequately satisfy this need. For instance, during IVF, women schedule venous blood draws with clinics hospitals. These require inconvenient and time consuming in-person visits, aren’t always covered by insurance, are painful, slow to return results, and have expensive operating costs for clinics in skilled personnel, niche instrumentation, and space to operate. Hormone monitoring during IVF remains a huge pain point for both patients and clinics for these reasons.
technology_description: BioSens8 is commercializing the first and only continuous, at-home, quantitative, affordable, sensitive, and blood-based hormone monitor. Similar in look and feel to a continuous glucose monitor (CGM), this technology will address current unmet needs in the IVF hormone testing market to start. Our monitor measures from interstitial fluid, a blood-based fluid, giving both physicians and customers confidence in the accuracy. Our quantitative output removes the ambiguity, frustration, and confusion of reading qualitative test results. Furthermore, our test is 10x more sensitive than the competition allowing the user to map their entire menstrual cycle. Finally because it is portable and easy to use, women can use the product at home saving them >12-18 hours of traveling per IVF cycle and fertility clinic owners >$5000/month in real estate costs, $100,000 in instrument costs, and $200,000/year in payroll costs.

name: BLACK MESA Edit
elevator_pitch: We're a late-seed stage company with a pilot product in the marketplace that helps biomanufacturing orgs accelerate their QA processes, extract useful process data from paper records, provide greater process assurance and integrity, and facilitate better transparency with product sponsors. Importantly, we do all this while avoiding the costly and lengthy adoption of an electronic batch record system, which frankly never makes financial sense for many organizations.
description: Much of modern manufacturing, especially biomanufacturing, relies on paper manufacturing batch records. Along with this comes an important but cumbersome manual QA process that adds to batch processing time and delays batch clearance. Black Mesa's product greatly speeds up this QA process while also adding robust tamper protection and process transparency. Additionally, the product extracts important process data from those paper manufacturing records, making previously unavailable data accessible for search and analytics.
technology_description: In addition to AI models that extract data from written production records, infer process parameters from existing instructions, and identify errors and omissions, Black Mesa also uses cryptographic techniques to provide a level of assurance not before available to paper-based processes.

name: BLOOMER HEALTHTECH Edit
elevator_pitch: Medical-grade sensors, integrated into the bra as washable, flexible circuits, monitor heart activity and communicate to a smartphone application via Bluetooth. The app transforms the information into a format that is accessible to the patient and her doctor, allowing convenient, long-term monitoring. Bloomer Tech will first market the bras for women who have already had one cardiac episode, and support them with technology tools as they undergo life changes.
description: Bloomer Tech is building washable, flexible circuits that integrate seamlessly into clothing and capture body metrics through sensors. Meaningful data is collected, analyzed and made accessible to users, doctors and medical professionals for personalized healthcare. The first product integrates into women's brassieres and learns about the cardiovascular and respiratory systems. Cardiovascular diseases (CVDs) are currently a major cause of death worldwide and it is alarming that even though more women than men have died of CVDs since 1984, women continue to be under diagnosed. With a world class, diverse team, our vision at Bloomer Tech is to be at the forefront of solving major global health issues by empowering people with technology, providing impactful data and experiences that reduce health risks. Contributing to longer, happier and healthier lives. The team connected by personal stories which are our motivation to tackle the cardiovascular disease problems. We are inspired by Amelia Bloomer's legacy, she is a women's rights advocate from the 1800s who transformed the way we wear clothes, as corsets from her time were really damaging women's health. People often do not know what is happening in their bodies until it is too late. Majority of fatalities occur because they are not informed in a timely manner and the experts we turn to are not fully equipped to change this reality. It is a well know fact that Doctors need key information about their patients and at times find it very difficult to know what is happening in a person’s body in a day to day setting. We see this every as 52% of our global population struggle with cardiovascular disease and more with ailments that are threats to their lives. The first circuits are being embedded into women’s bras and will informs users in an easy to read way about their Electrocardiogram, pulse rate, lung sounds, accelerometer, respiratory breathing and heart rhythm. The app will inform people on key metrics used to tackle cardiovascular disease and provide interactive tools to help women improve their health at the start. the information gathered can be given to doctors at the users’ choice to help doctors better help patients. Although cardiovascular diseases lead to more deaths than any other disease combined (malaria, cancer, aids, infectious disease)– the tools to gather information and helps patients are not properly utilized over a long period of time. Even with medical patches, wearable’s, and implantable loops in circulation which has grown the market exponentially to over $80bill, even people with serious heart ailments do not use them consistently. After about 2/3months most people do away with these devices. People with cardiovascular disease and health enthusiasts need a tool that allows them to know what is happening over a consistent period of time, and also empowers them to works towards tackling these diseases and improving health. The founding team has an expert with a background in Hardware, circuits, and electronics. An expert with a background in Robotics, Mechatronics and sensors. A user design expert covering graphics, social media, app and user interfaces, a medical doctor with background in running NGO’s, sharing content and teaching on the topic. We also have business person with background in capital markets, banking, and running elderly and mental care homes. However, the true key strength is the nature of the formation of the founding team and our working culture. We are friends and care about each other, and because four of the founding members are women, we are uniquely able to understand the needs of the user market as we are consumer of the products we advocate. We all met at Singularity University and came together because of our unique desire and passion to make a social impact and tackle some of humanities grand challenges.

name: BLUE DOT MOTORWORKS Edit
elevator_pitch: Blue Dot Motorworks is addressing the elephant in the room when it comes to decarbonizing road transportation: no matter how fast we transition new vehicle manufacturing to EVs, the existing fleet won't turn over fast enough to align with climate targets. Something has to be done with the billions of conventional cars that will be on the road for the next three-plus decades, and our universal plug-in hybrid retrofit kits represent a paradigm shift in cost-effectiveness and scalability. By achieving a price point that delivers a return on investment in just a few years and an installation process that can utilize third parties, we will bring electrification retrofits into the mainstream. We have demonstrated the feasibility, practicality, and usability of our technology with road-going prototypes, have had our first patent issued, and have generated 360 pages of patent material around greening existing vehicles. We aim to do nothing less than make a significant dent in global carbon emissions while unlocking an untapped, multi-trillion dollar market.
description: Even if conventional vehicle production were completely phased out by 2028, the resulting vehicle emissions would consume over 300% of the remaining 1.5 C carbon budget. To close that gap through new EV production, we would have to double the size of the automotive industry. That additional production would cost 38 trillion dollars, which is about 12X the relative spending of the Apollo moon program. We’d have to scrap 11 trillion dollars-worth of perfectly good cars, more wealth than the US lost in the 2008 financial crisis. We’d have to increase battery production 700% faster than current projections, and install 3 million additional chargers, representing 99 years of installation at the 2019 rate. We would incur 18 gigatonnes of carbon emissions from the manufacturing of additional vehicles, with each one taking over six years of driving to break even from the embodied carbon, at least 75% of the time we have to achieve the first halving of emissions. From the customer perspective, EVs remain financially out of reach for the majority of the population, and charging infrastructure is not mature enough in many parts of the world to support mass EV ownership.
technology_description: The Narwhal and the Humpback, from Blue Dot Motorworks, can together convert almost any light-duty vehicle into a plug-in hybrid. Their ground-breaking, vehicle-agnostic designs can be mass produced at the largest of scales to achieve the lowest possible price point. The simple and consistent installation process is easy to train, enabling the use of third parties. Each system includes a safe and cobalt-free battery pack, an electric motor that drives the rear wheels of the vehicle, a charger, a user interface, and optional electric accessories, such as a power steering pump. The Narwhal’s motor is installed in the middle of the driveshaft of vehicles that have a solid rear axle, and can be utilized as a generator to supply electricity for external applications. The Humpback drives the rear wheels from the outside and incorporates quick-couplings for quick and easy removal.

name: BOSTON MATERIALS Edit
elevator_pitch: Boston Materials’ mission is to proliferate composites in transportation & energy sectors to enable drastic weight reduction and significantly reduce the global carbon footprint. We are accomplishing our mission with Supercomp™ Carbon Fiber technology – a Boston Materials exclusive. Supercomp products solves the high cost, performance limitations, and complex manufacturing of lightweight composites. Over $4M in venture funding and $1M in federal funding has enabled Boston Materials to s
description: Boston Materials is a cutting-edge material science company that is leading the development of the next generation of composites with higher performance and functionality. From lighter aircraft and stronger wind turbine blades to extended range EVs and safer bicycles, we develop the materials that take the next generation of applications from concept to reality.
technology_description: Boston Materials compounds lightweight composite materials using recycled and low-cost carbon fiber by leveraging a proprietary roll-to-roll coating process. In this process, the recycled fiber, in the form of micron-sized milled carbon fiber (not nanofiber or nanotubes), is coated onto various substrates and continuous fiber reinforcements. During the coating process, the milled carbon fibers are vertically oriented to create novel composite materials with highly-differentiated Z-axis performance. This process is entirely water based and does not use hazardous materials, solvents, or energy intensive processes. The use of recycled and low-cost milled carbon fiber also reduces the overall cost of lightweight composites by up to 25%. This technology has been demonstrated at pilot scale in 2019 and a high-volume production line will be brought online in August 2020 to fill customer orders. Boston Materials has commercialized several products in the form of dry fiber reinforcements, composite materials with thermoset and thermoplastic polymers, and non-woven layers.
contact: anvesh@bomaterials.com, startupexchange-admin@mit.edu, startupexchange@mit.edu

name: BOSTON METAL (FORMERLY BOSTON ELECTROMETALLURGICAL CORPORATION) Edit
elevator_pitch: Boston Metal is an innovative climate technology company with a mission to decarbonize steel. The company is transforming how metals are made with its patented Molten Oxide Electrolysis (MOE), a tonnage metals technology platform powered by electricity, which will provide the industry with a scalable, cost-effective and green solution for the production of steel and high-value metals from a variety of iron ore grades and feedstocks.
description: Roughly two billion tons of steel are produced every year, accounting for approximately 10% of global carbon emissions. Meanwhile, major steel consumers in the automotive, construction and technology sectors are demanding green steel solutions, and many steelmakers have committed to reaching net-zero by 2050. Boston Metal is the only company with a simple, direct, cost-competitive and scalable approach to decarbonizing steelmaking and transforming the way metals are made. Once its groundbreaking steel decarbonization technology becomes commercially available in 2026, steel producers will be able to cost-effectively achieve net-zero Scope 1 and 2 emissions to meet the growing global demand for green steel.
technology_description: Boston Metal is commercializing a revolutionary one-step process for decarbonizing steel production using clean electricity. The company’s patented Molten Oxide Electrolysis (MOE) technology platform works with all iron ore grades to create high-quality liquid metal, providing a more efficient, lower cost and environmentally sustainable solution across the steel industry. MOE eliminates several steps in the traditional steelmaking process and does not require coke production, iron ore sintering and pelletizing, blast furnace reduction or basic oxygen furnace refinement. No carbon dioxide or other harmful byproducts are generated, just oxygen. Furthermore, MOE does not require process water, hazardous chemicals or precious-metal catalysts. In addition to steel decarbonization, Boston Metal’s MOE technology is being used to recover value from mining waste. This process reduces the financial and environmental liabilities of slag, a natural byproduct of smelting ores and recycled metals, and instead creates new revenue streams from it.

name: BRAIN POWER, LLC Edit
elevator_pitch: One in 40 children has autism and the 140,000 schools in America have budgets and federal+state mandates to meet their needs. Yet schools struggle to teach them and avoid litigation, teachers often burn out, and students often languish in social / emotional skills: 80% of them end up unemployed, and without a partner. We sell schools a wearable platform and SaaS solution with game-like apps that teach social skills like eye contact. Validated by years of clinical trials, it sells well to schools
description: Brain Power is a fast-growing and award-winning neurotechnology startup in Kendall Square founder by an MIT alum in 2013. We serve a demonstrated and deeply important need that falls in an open space between the healthcare system and the educational system. Namely, we serve people on the autism spectrum, and those who educate and support them. Brain Power sells a wearable computer system with game-like apps that allow people on the spectrum to earn points and rewards for prosocial behaviors. For instance, in one game they look through the heads-up device at another person and see an emoji digitally depicted on either side of her/his face. They choose one by a quick head tilt and get feedback from the game and from the person as to whether it was the correct emotion. This and a collection of other games have been validated via several years of published clinical studies, which have shown that short, daily sessions are enough to improve crucial social-emotional skills.

name: C16 BIOSCIENCES Edit
elevator_pitch: Palm oil is the most widely used vegetable oil in the world; it makes up a massive $60B industry and is found in 50% of the consumer goods on supermarket shelves. Unfortunately, its production comes at the expense of rainforests primarily in Southeast Asia. At C16, instead of using large scale plantations to extract oil, we brew oil in yeast. By leveraging microbiology, we can produce an oil that matches the profile of palm oil, is cheaper than the standard, and doesn't destroy the planet.
description: C16 was founded with the goal of allowing companies that use palm oil to switch to a sustainably produced alternative that competes on cost and does not compromise quality. We are based at Greentown Labs in Somerville, where we are equipped with standard microbiology instrumentation and equipment in their wet lab as well as 150 sq. ft. of prototyping space to carry out scaled-up bioprocesses. We were a part of the S18 batch at Ycombinator, after which we secured our seed round fundraise thru a number of VCs and angels. We are currently set up at the 50L fermentation scale (200L over the next 3 months) and generating samples to test our ingredient with prospective customers. The first target market is in cosmetics, where less stringent regulatory and pricing hurdles will make it easier for us to get our ingredient into products in the next 18 months.

name: CACHE DNA Edit
elevator_pitch: The precipitous drop in the cost of synthesizing and sequencing nucleic acids has spurred the "genomics revolution." Human genomic DNA is sequenced at scale through direct-to-consumer kits, offering insight into our genetic heritage and the likelihood of developing certain diseases. As sequencing becomes commoditized, the cost bottleneck is now other parts of the value chain (interpretation/reporting, data management, sample preparation, storage, etc.).
description: Current biological storage and access does not scale: Customer testimonials reveal 3 common pain points 1. Everyone wants to keep their samples “just in case.” 2. Too expensive to store, too expensive to sequence. 3. Because of how nascent this industry is, most labs still “DIY.” We make storing nucleic acids scalable, sustainable, and standardized. We manage biostorage infrastructure, compliance, and logistics so experts can focus on downstream applications in a way that is cheaper and easier.
technology_description: In select application areas with multi-billion-dollar markets, nucleic acids play a central and mission-critical role in developing products and services. The impervious encapsulation reduces the storage footprint of nucleic acids by at least 1000-fold compared to conventional tube-based storage, thus providing a scalable and low-cost solution for the storage and access of nucleic acids.
mit_connection: MIT-licensed technology | MIT faculty as founder | The co-founders include James Banal, Michael Becich, and Mark Bathe. James and Mark are co-inventors on DNA data storage and access capabilities, which originated from their research efforts while James was a postdoctoral scholar in Mark’s lab at MIT.

They're also lightweight, travel-friendly and just as appropriate for a business meeting as they are for happy hour or brunch. Bags are made from 100% genuine Italian leather with a pebbled finish. Each bag is expertly handcrafted to look and feel soft and supple, structured yet lightweight, and durable and water-resistant. We’ve also invested heavily in a top quality micro-suede lining that most other brands deem too expensive to use. For us, a top-quality product begins with exceptional ingredients. elevator_pitch: Cap_able is dedicated to safeguarding privacy in an increasingly surveilled world. We create AI-driven solutions that disrupt facial recognition and other detection technologies, protecting identities across various surfaces, including textiles, vehicles, and other physical assets. By combining cutting-edge technology with high-quality Italian design, we offer innovative, functional, and stylish products for the fashion, security, and defense sectors. Our mission is to empower individuals and organizations to protect their privacy without compromising aesthetics or practicality.
description: Cap_able is a pioneering company dedicated to safeguarding privacy in an increasingly surveilled world. We develop AI-driven adversarial textiles and covers that disrupt facial recognition and other detection technologies, protecting the identities of individuals and assets without the need to cover their faces. By integrating cutting-edge machine learning algorithms with high-quality Italian design, our products offer a seamless blend of style, functionality, and security. Cap_able’s innovative solutions are designed for various sectors, including fashion, automotive, security, and defense, empowering individuals and organizations to protect their privacy without compromising aesthetics or practicality. Our mission is to lead the market in accurate tracking.
technology_description: Cap_able’s technology is embedded into various surfaces, including knitted and woven jacquard fabrics, ensuring a perfect fit without compromising effectiveness. Tested on YOLO and other real-time object detection systems, these surfaces cause the software to misidentify wearers as other categories rather than humans. Cap_able also develops machine learning algorithms to generate these disruptive patterns, effective across various models and environments, including those using thermal cameras and infrared sensors. Designed for practical use, these textiles and covers combine style with security, offering a seamless blend of functionality and privacy protection in the fashion, automotive, security, and defense sectors.

name: CAPITAL PULSE Edit
elevator_pitch: Medical insurance claims receivables are often the largest asset a medical provider has, but unlike in the rest of the US economy, they are not easily financeable. This is because lenders have difficulty valuing the claims, largely due to lack of data availability and idiosyncratic medical risk. Capital Pulse helps handicap this risk for financial institutions by ingesting, anonymizing and modeling claims' likelihood of denial, eventual payment amount, and timing. In doing so, we help unlock valuable working capital for healthcare providers and improve returns and lower risk for capital providers. With healthcare spending at over seventeen percent of the U.S. GDP and growing, medical claims receivables have the potential to be the next trillion-dollar asset class. With significant interest from some of the largest players in both healthcare and finance, Capital Pulse’s purpose-built claim valuation infrastructure is at the forefront of this coming wave.
description: Many healthcare providers have difficulty accessing working capital. In fact, nearly 700 hospitals in the US operate with less than 10 days' cash-on-hand. When providers are faced with cash shortages, oftentimes their only option is to cut back on much-needed services. By unlocking the value of their pending insurance claims, Capital Pulse gives healthcare providers the flexibility to focus on what they do best - providing services to their communities.
technology_description: The Capital Pulse platform integrates advances in EHRs (data availability), cryptography (anonymization and validation), AI/ML (modeling), and payment systems (servicing). We are a HIPAA / SOC-2 compliant cloud-based (AWS) platform and leverage postgresql, python, and R.

name: CAPRA BIOSCIENCES Edit
elevator_pitch: Capra Biosciences uses their proprietary biofilm reactors to make hydrophobic chemicals such as lubricants, fuels, and polymers sustainably and cost effectively. Rather than using refined sugars, our organism and reactor are able to convert waste carbon into new products. Our technology operates continuously with a smaller footprint than traditional bioreactors and follows different scaling rules reducing the risks and costs associated with bringing new products from the benchtop to large scale production.
description: Today the sustainable chemicals are often more expensive than petroleum based alternatives and the majority of bio-based chemicals rely on refined sugars or vegetable oils as carbon sources, which can burden the already taxed food supply chain. Technologies that are able to produce cost-competitive chemicals from complex waste feedstocks are needed to enable a truly sustainable chemical industry.
technology_description: Biology provides a route to precisely controlled multi-step synthesis at ambient temperature and pressure within a single cell. However, biology typically operates solely in the aqueous phase. Our bioreactor design combines the benefits of biosynthesis with a water-, energy-, and time-saving extraction step to produce complex hydrophobic products in a more environmentally-friendly and cost-effective fashion. Each of our bioreactor cartridges (large column in figure) can produce up to 300 grams of product a day, while using only about 3 L of water. Using synthetic biology, we can engineer our platform organism to produce molecules that are functionally tailored to meet customer needs - for example new kinds of lubricants that meet or exceed the wear performance, and thermal and oxidative stability of today’s petroleum-based lubricants while also being wholly renewable and cost competitive.
mit_connection: MIT alumni as founder | Co-founder (Andrew Magyar) is a PhD alum of course 3

name: CAPSEN ROBOTICS LLC Edit
elevator_pitch: CapSen Robotics’ mission is to give robots the spatial intelligence they need to assist humans with all forms of manual labor. The company’s first product, CapSen PiC, uses MIT-researched 3D vision algorithms and proprietary motion planning algorithms to eliminate the physically demanding and extremely repetitive task of bin picking, an annual opportunity of $1B in the U.S. alone.
description: At CapSen Robotics, the goal is to provide robots with a comprehensive understanding of the physical world. We provide state-of-the-art 3D vision software for superior object detection, tracking, and scanning in unstructured, cluttered environments. The software, leveraging new research from MIT, works with both textured and untextured objects, with applications to bin picking, warehouse automation, gaming, augmented reality, occupational therapy, and many other domains. Detecting and tracking known, rigid objects with an RGB-D sensor relies on being able to align 3D object models with an observed scene. At CapSen Robotics, we have developed new 3D alignment algorithms that work better in clutter and with a wider range of objects than standard methods like Iterative Closest Point or keypoint matching. Algorithms use the quaternion Bingham distribution to encode the orientation information of sparse, 3D feature sets. This allows them to combine the alignment information from small sets of otherwise ambiguous features to achieve robust alignments in scenes with clutter and occlusions, and for objects that lack unique visual or geometric features.
mit_connection: MIT-licensed technology | MIT alumni as founder | Co-Founder Jared Glover, 2014 Ph.D, EECS, MIT

name: CARTESIAN SYSTEMS Edit
elevator_pitch: Cartesian Systems is an MIT spin-off focused on mapping the physical world at an unprecedented scale and precision using IoT. Our team of MIT faculty and recent alums invented award-winning, patented sensor fusion technologies to massively track assets and operations indoors. We are building a platform that uses these technologies to transform physical traceability and optimize retail, supply chain, manufacturing, and robotics operations.
description: Inventory and asset management is a massive challenge for retailers and logistics operators. One of the biggest problems they face is indoor traceability, i.e., knowing where items are inside their buildings. This problem is particularly challenging for retailers, whose business relies on product availability for shoppers both online and in-store. Unfortunately, existing solutions are either too costly or highly inefficient, and they incur significant management overhead. Cartesian's product seamlessly maps all indoor inventory assets using pervasive IoT and novel sensor fusion technologies. Our product creates a digital twin of indoor spaces to provide full visibility into both assets and operations. The twin consists of high-resolution maps of all item locations, which allows tracking and searching for inventory and assets. These capabilities will boost labor efficiency, optimize operations and space usage, increase customer sale convergence, reduce shrinkage, and deliver new customer insights and operational analytics.
technology_description: Our venture is backed by a portfolio of 12 issued and pending patents on wireless sensing, asset tracking, and sensor fusion inventions. Our product leverages the most pervasive IoT technology - 3-cent RFID tags - which have been attached to over 30 billion manufactured products. Using a combination of wireless signal processing, computer vision, and AI-based sensor fusion algorithms, our product can locate tagged items with centimeter-scale precision. At the core of the product is the first technology that can measure time-of-flight on off-the-shelf RFID tags. The technology was featured for its ability to locate RFIDs at an “unprecedented scale” by RFID Journal. It was also named as one of the 100 "Ways MIT is Making the World Better", as one of the top "AI Trends to Watch" by The Wall Street Journal.

name: CATALOG Edit
elevator_pitch: DNA is a natural information storage medium that offers extreme stability and information density. We are developing a platform technology that will make it economically viable to encode information on to DNA molecules.
description: The idea of storing information using DNA has been around for a while. It’s just that the cost of DNA synthesis has been a bottle neck. What CATALOG is building can be thought of as a printing press with movable typefaces. Instead of having to synthesize billions of different molecules, we are creating the necessary diversity by moving around the typefaces in different combinations. The world will generate 160 zettabytes of data in 2025. That’s more bytes than there are stars in the observable universe. Conventional storage media like flash-drives and hard-drives do not have the longevity, data density, or cost efficiency to meet the global demand. DNA is the digital storage medium selected by nature that has been perfected over 3 billion years of evolution. It can store millions of times more data in the same volume as conventional solutions, can last for thousands of years, and gives you the ability to physically own your data – even massive amounts of it.
technology_description: We are examples of DNA-based computers. Not only do we store lots of data in DNA, our cells access and compute it in massively parallel ways. By enabling the storage of previously impossible amounts of data in DNA, CATALOG has taken a huge step in harnessing DNA-based computation.
contact: 56 Roland Street, Suite 208, Boston, MA, 02129 • hyunjun@catalogdna.com, startupexchange-admin@mit.edu, startupexchange@mit.edu

name: CELERO SYSTEMS, INC Edit
elevator_pitch: What if a patient could take a pill but only get the medicine when needed? Celero Systems has developed a novel ingestible drug delivery platform that monitors a patient’s physiology and releases medication as needed. While there are many potential applications for this platform, the first clinical indication is to protect patients prescribed high dose opioids that are at risk of accidental overdose. Those patients are often co-prescribed naloxone but since most victims die alone without anyone present to deliver the medication, there is an important need for a better life-saving solution. The Celero Systems product will address the needs of 9M Americans currently prescribed high dose opioids and at greatest risk of accidental overdose. This is currently a +$300M/yr business for nasal naloxone and Celero is uniquely positioned to rapidly grow the market with a better product that has favorable reimbursement and existing pharmacy channels for distribution.

name: CELLCHORUS Edit
elevator_pitch: CellChorus® is the leader in performing high‑throughput, dynamic analysis of individual cell behavior and function over time to improve the performance and manufacturing of cell‑based products. The genesis of cells as living drugs requires the development of technologies that can profile massive numbers of cells at single-cell resolution. Advances in physical and information sciences have driven significant advances in single-cell analysis in recent years, although these are constrained by modalities that evaluate cells at a single point in time—and are destructive to cells. To advance the next generation of cell‑based products, we require the ability to profile cells with real-time monitoring of individual cell‑to‑cell interactions in a variety of environmental conditions and at scale—and then retrieve viable cells for downstream analysis.
description: The mission at PathAI is to transform, accelerate and improve cancer diagnosis and cancer care by integrating pathology machine learning / artificial intelligence (AI) with traditional pathology methods in both research and clinical labs. By leveraging recent advances in computational processing power and AI, the conventional methods of pathology are disrupted and improved, leading to meaningful improvements in medicine and patient outcomes. PathAI's revolutionary approach provides the highest level of standardization, accuracy and precision in pathology available today, delivering solutions to researchers and empowering pathologists with decision support tools.
technology_description: CellChorus places individual therapeutic and cancer cells in each of thousands of manufactured nanowells. We apply Time‑lapse Imaging Microscopy in Nanowell Grids (TIMING™) with neural network-based analysis to identify, track, and characterize the behaviors of the cells. CellChorus can evaluate cell‑to‑cell interactions over time with its proprietary algorithms—for example, in immuno-oncology CellChorus evaluates whether and how individual T cells, NK cells and other cell types move, activate, kill, and survive in a variety of environmental conditions (metabolites, nutrients, suppressants, etc.). The TIMING platform allows CellChorus and its customers to identify and retrieve cells of interest from thousands of nanowells to perform additional profiling such as single‑cell RNA sequencing and protein expression. This unique platform provides a comprehensive understanding of cellular function, state and phenotype to improve the efficacy and manufacturing of cell-based products.
contact: TIMING@cellchorus.com, startupexchange-admin@mit.edu, startupexchange@mit.edu
keywords: Life sciencesSingle cell analysisCell therapyImmunotherapyArtificial intelligence

name: CELLINO BIOTECH, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: Cellino uses the latest advances in image-based machine learning to take actionable steps on cells undergoing differentiation. The hardware/software platform is the first to manufacture human-like tissues with high functionality and structure for the tissue replacement industry. The first area of focus is the manufacturing of transplantable retinal pigment epithelial cells to restore sight in patients suffering from vision loss.
description: Cellino has built the first platform that enables precise control over iPS cell fate in their natural environment. Their proprietary delivery technology, NanoLaze, delivers synthetic biology tools to control the sequence of genes being turned on and off inside a cell. This offers precise, “digital” control over cell fate. The technology steers iPS cells to a target cell state, creating any mature cell at will. Need healthy neurons? Or kidney cells? Whatever the cell type, Cellino’s platform has the potential to create them. Cellino’s platform is 10x faster at writing programs to make functionally mature cells that are critical for clinical therapies. That means that more cell types can be created, more successfully, at a speed that makes them useful for dozens of shots on goal for cell therapies. It is a technology that will help us heal ourselves, faster. Cellino intentionally design mixed populations of cells to improve tissue interconnectivity and engraftment.
technology_description: Cellino is engineering human-like cells and tissues for replacement therapies.

name: CENTAUR LABS Edit
elevator_pitch: We label medical data for companies building AI
description: Patients and healthcare companies often trust a single physician’s advice, even though physicians disagree with each other at alarming rates. This disagreement, proven in numerous studies, is pervasive across clinical areas. As AI plays an increasingly large role in healthcare, the consequences for bad quality inputs grow. How do you train an AI model when you lack confidence in the underlying data? Misdiagnoses and errors in medical decisions—from AI and humans alike—cost lives. Centaur accurately labels medical data by intelligently combining opinions from experts with medical knowledge and specialized training. Our approach is built on four pillars: (1) Focus exclusively on medical data -- We have a deep understanding of niche tasks, data formats, security constraints, and regulatory hurdles. Brain with gears (2) On-demand global skilled network -- Tens of thousands of medical students and professionals compete against each other to label medical cases for our customers. On our labeling mobile app, DiagnosUs, we collect over a million opinions every day. (3) Performance-based compensation incentivizes the best work -- We make the labeling experience competitive to constantly measure accuracy and incentivize effort from labelers. (4) Collective intelligence drives improved accuracy -- We intelligently aggregate opinions to create labels that beat the accuracy of individual board-certified doctors.
technology_description: We leverage a network of medical students a professionals to label medical data accurately, affordably, and at scale
mit_connection: MIT alumni as founder | founder and CEO Erik Duhaime is an MIT PhD graduate. Multiple employees also are alums
contact: 883 Boylston Street, Suite 200, Boston, MA, 02116 • erik@centaurlabs.com, startupexchange-admin@mit.edu, startupexchange@mit.edu

description: Globally, 2.6Bn people lack safe toilet access, and 1Bn defecate openly. Chronic under-investment into sanitation infrastructure means people in many poor and vulnerable communities live with their sewage. With no toilets or pipes, there is no way to flush. change:WATER Labs is developing a low-cost, compact, waterless toilet for non-sewered households and communities. name: CHARM INC / BEYOND CORAL FOUNDATION Edit
elevator_pitch: CHARM is a coral farming robot. CHARM combines scientific research with computer automation to reduce costs, save time, and grow resilient coral reefs that can survive the future ocean conditions. CHARM is designed to grow coral at economies of scale and remains affordable for island-nations and developing countries.
description: A new method and apparatus for coral husbandry called CHARM has been invented with the ambition to grow coral at economies of scale. It does so by combining machine automation with science based methods to create industrious repeatability. ​CHARM’s machine vision, robotic end effectors, artificial intelligence, deep learning capabilities, and easy-to-use interface will help manage the vast number of coral polyps and reef species in a nursery of the future. ​Each year, a coral polyp will attempt to birth a coral baby. Coral babies can be grown in nurseries and in great quantities. Through sexual reproduction, two different coral species may hybridize, which can bring a positive increase in natural genetic diversity. If they are reared successfully, coral can be selectively bred for higher survival rates in the warmer ocean temperatures of the future. This is very good news! Corals can also asexually reproduce. Through a surgical process called, micro-fragmentation, a coral colony will rapidly repair its damaged tissue when cut. Coral polyps multiply across the wound, like clones, at an increased rate due to the immediate stress.
technology_description: Research shows it takes 4,000 hours to clean and maintain 10,000 coral fragments-- equal to 3 people working full-time for 1 year. To save our reefs, we estimate that 100,000 corals will need to be planted everyday. That is a lot of labor! The average cost to grow 1 coral is $27. Currently, staff labor accounts for 50% of annualized costs at coral nurseries. Most nurseries are understaffed and rely on volunteer labor to tediously clean away algae from around coral. To minimize nursery expenses and maximize coral health, CHARM aims to automate the repetitive tasks in coral farming such as cleaning, feeding, assembling, and cataloguing. For example, a user selects a program sequence from the online portal to clean baby corals. When prompted, the CNC machine carriage switches to the corresponding tool--in this case, a soft bristle brush--and begins to clean away algae automatically until completion. The software and onboard camera can detect corals and clean them safely on a regular basis. To serve its principal objective, CHARM is designed to help restore coral reefs around the world. The design uses commercially available parts to integrate into existing industry methods. This innovation is affordable and accessible for global communities who are interested in coral farming. WHY CHARM? Aquaculture for coral offers considerable promise for restoring reefs and preserving biodiversity. Asexual reproduction accelerates coral growth up to 50 times its natural state. Corals can hybridize, which also increases natural genetic resilience. CHARM is intended to yield healthier and higher volumes of coral, reduce handling stress to coral, minimize exposure to pathogenic factors, increase growth rates, and improve cataloguing techniques. CHARM WILL: - Clean coral with a rotary agitator - Cultivate coral with a nozzle - Catalog coral with an inspection instrument - Utilize interchangeable tool tips IMPACT - Designed for scalability - Composed of commercially available parts VALUE PROPOSITION - Saves time, reduces cost, and increases coral - Relieves coral farmers and scientists by automating labor EASY TO LEARN - Online application available - User interface with simple drag-and-drop platform INTELLECTUAL MERIT - Environmental technology meets robotic coral farming - Patent-pending, invented by engineer trained by NASA & MIT

name: CLICKMEDIX (FORMERLY CLICKDIAGNOSTICS, INC.) Edit

description: ClickMedix provides a patent pending eHealth software-as-a-service (SaaS) platform that enables medical specialists and health organizations to rapidly deploy customized eHealth solutions to serve 4-10x more patients. The platform has been used in 15 countries, with clients including Harvard, Medtronic, and pharmacy chains. The mission of ClickMedix (formerly ClickDiagnostics, Inc.) is to bring affordable and quality health services to under-served populations by connecting patients to doctors through mobile technologies and community-based health providers to achieve continuous heathcare delivery to patients. ClickMedix is a global mobile health (mHealth) social enterprise founded by faculty and students from Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), Harvard and Carnegie Mellon University to address the following global healthcare challenges: (1) Lack of access: Patients cannot easily reach doctors. (2) Lack of funds: Patients cannot afford the high cost of healthcare, and governments/NGOs are unable to subsidize under-served populations entirely (3) Lack of medical resources: Most countries face severe shortages of trained healthcare professionals, especially medical specialists, to perform adequate diagnosis and quality treatment in rural areas. The mission is to bring affordable and quality health services to under-served communities, by enabling the creation of proactive and self-sustaining health systems driven by mobile technologies, community-level entrepreneurship, and value-based partnerships. ClickMexis is a world-class medical professionals, public health practitioners, technologists, development activists, entrepreneurs, and business strategists to bring new dimensions to addressing these challenges using mobile phones. As mobile phone coverage extends to all corners of the world, mobile-phone based health services are becoming increasingly ubiquitous for connecting different layers of the public health infrastructure, enabling real-time collection of health data and remote diagnosis of patients by medical experts. The innovative mobile health (mHealth) platform connects health service providers, reduces cost of service delivery, and optimally utilizes tiers of existing health system for patient care. A community health-worker or a clinic nurse with a Click-enabled mobile phone is able to act as the primary agent for service delivery, as she is connected to the mHealth platform and the entire health system. The mHealth platform is comprised of modules for: (*) Medical services (primary care triage, risk-screening and tele-consultation), (*) Patient management (electronic medical record, referral service and emergency response), (*) Administrations and planning (mobile accounting, remote monitoring, real-time data collection), and (*) Purchasing (mPayment) and financing (micro-insurance) of healthcare services Prior to incorporation of ClickMedix, LLC., we have been operating as Click Diagnostics since May 2008, and have been implementing mobile-phone based tele-consultation services in Africa, South Asia, and the Americas, enabling patients to access quality medical treatment in areas where there is little or no access to doctors. At the same time, we have been working with health organizations, governments, NGOs, research institutions, mobile operators, medical associations, and health products companies to build a self-sustaining health infrastructure powered by mobile technologies. ClickMedix as a new corporate entity will focus on commercial offering of successfully piloted mobile health services.

name: COCOPIE.AI Edit
elevator_pitch: CoCoPIE.ai optimizes next-generation large AI models – including Generative AI -- from cloud to edge, significantly reducing model sizes, accelerating training and inference speeds, cutting computing cost, while preserving model accuracies. Jointly developed by three leading universities, CoCoPIE's full-stack optimization technology is a game changer, reducing large AI’s computing cost by up to 50 times in the cloud and accelerating their inference time up to 50 times on devices. CoCo
description: Next-generation AI holds the potential to create trillions of dollars of economic value annually. However, these AI models have been growing exponentially larger and prohibitively costly to compute. The costs associated with their training and inference are expected to surge 250-fold in just five years, reaching a staggering $80 billion in 2028. Moreover, deploying next-gen large AI models directly on edge devices is not feasible as these devices are resource constrained, blocking next-gen edge-AI use cases in smartphones, AR/VR, automobiles, cameras, and robotics. CoCoPIE.ai's groundbreaking AI optimization technology offers the ideal solution. Jointly developed by three research labs from three leading universities, the technology optimizes classic and next-gen AI models holistically throughout their workflow from model compression, model compilation, to runtime, eliminating silos present in fragmented tool chains. This unique full-stack optimization technology harnesses tremendous synergy created from compression-compilation codesign, significantly reducing model sizes, accelerating training and inference speeds, maximizing energy efficiency, and preserving model accuracies, all at a fraction of the original computing cost. The results have been truly game- changing, reducing Gen-AI’s computing cost by up to 50 times in the cloud and accelerates their inference time up to 50 times on device. This award-winning technology has set many industry records, featured in over 30 top-tier academic publications and 10 pending patents. CoCoPIE.ai productized this technology through Optimized-AI-Model-as-a-Service and Optimization- Platform-as-a-Service. It covers a wide spectrum of classic and generative AI models, such as YoLo, Activity Recognition, Super Resolution, GPT, Stable Diffusion, Llama, and more. CoCoPIE’s products have been deployed and are generating ARR revenue. CoCoPIE.ai's clientele includes large mobile OEMs, streaming media companies, AI chipset vendors, gaming software companies, and other major tech firms.
technology_description: While all existing technologies attempt to optimize a particular layer of the AI stack, whether it be compression, quantization, compilation, or hardware acceleration, CoCoPIE pioneered the holistic full stack optimization technology of Compression-Compilation-Codesign, based on joint research by three leading universities. Compression and compilation are the two key steps in fitting a deep learning model on a hardware for efficient executions. Model compression is a common technique for reducing the size and improving the speed of deep learning models. Compilation is a process of mapping the high-level operations in deep learning to the low-level instructions that the underlying hardware supports. The principle of compression-compilation co-design is to design the two components for AI in a hand-in-hand manner to fully exploit the synergy between these two processes. The CoCoPIE framework is a breakthrough delivering an average of 10x speed up over state-of-the-art solutions, holding numerous records in speed and efficiency.

name: CODOMAX Edit
elevator_pitch: Codomax is an omics-driven biomanufacturing startup company that spun-out from MIT and the University at Albany. Our mission is to drive the cost-effective, scalable, and high-yielding production of nature-identical recombinant proteins that contribute to improved global health and nutrition. Our vision is for the sustainable production of therapeutics & alternative foods that are accessible & affordable to all populations for the betterment of global health & nutrition.
description: Biomanufacturers face challenges in efficiently producing biologics & cellular agriculture proteins at scale & affordable costs. Protein production is hampered by the difficult-to-express nature of these proteins, and challenges in retaining protein functionality and proper folding, assembly, & secretion from the cell. The unpredictable & poorly understood biological code for producing foreign proteins leads to compromises on product quality (glycosylation, purification, etc) to achieve protein expression. These challenges are not exclusive to recombinant proteins but also affect mRNA therapeutics. In particular, tissue-specific expression of therapeutic mRNAs in their target tissues remains a challenge that dampens efficacy. Cracking this biological code is vital for enabling sustainable & cost-effective protein production.
technology_description: We discovered that cells respond to stress & changing environmental conditions by reprogramming their biology for producing proteins. Stress includes over-expression of foreign proteins in host cells, as well as changes in production vessels & scale. The stress response is unique to the cell line, target protein, & production scale, and cannot be predicted solely using AI. We developed a platform technology (Epi-MAX platform) that leverages stress-induced cellular reprogramming to re-engineer cells & their genes for boosted protein production. Our platform uses omics tools to measure the cell’s stress response and a proprietary software platform to re-program the cell for boosted protein production. Unlike traditional codon optimization and strain engineering approaches, the Epi-MAX platform is based on real-time biology and is customized to each unique protein expression system, requiring systems-level measurements of the system's stress response to guide cell and gene engineering.
