name: COMBINED THERAPEUTICS INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: Combined Therapeutics Inc. (CTx) is a privately held biotechnology company developing the next generation of high-value mRNA vaccines to protect everyone, including vulnerable populations, from global infectious diseases as well as to treat cancer.
description: Combined Therapeutics (CTx) is a unique and proprietary mRNA platform, with an increased safety profile due to controlled biodistribution and high specificity, is built around Multi Organ Protective (MOPCTx) binding miRNA sequences combined with therapeutic mRNAs, allowing the targeting of therapeutic protein expression in specific tissues while reducing off-target effects to protect key vital organs such as the heart, liver, and kidneys. Initial focus is on developing vaccines and vaccine adjuvants for infectious diseases and oncology indications, with plans to initiate clinical development in 2024.
technology_description: Combined Therapeutics’ platform, MOPCTx, is comprised of a modified mRNA encapsulated in a lipid nanoparticle. The UTR region of the mRNA is modified to contain miRNA binding sequences. Due to the differential expression of miRNA in different cells and tissues in the body, our platform, as an example for vaccine applications, can be targeted to express the antigen preferentially at the site of injection, while protecting key vital organs such as the heart, liver, and kidneys. Cytokines are endogenous signaling proteins that are part of the immune system. They provide the cells with instructions that are integral in helping the body respond to an infection and launch an appropriate immune response. For example, IL-12 is a cytokine secreted by antigen presenting cells that allows for the recruitment, activation, and proliferation of specific immune cells, making IL-12 a key factor in successfully mounting an adaptive immune response during vaccination. Combined Tx’s approach is to co-administer IL-12 mRNA with an antigen, to improve the vaccine response, otherwise known as molecular adjuvantation.

name: COMMON SENSE MACHINES, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: Common Sense Machines is building artificial intelligence that learns to translate the world into a 3D simulation. 3D simulations have great value; we use 3D models to create photorealistic images of products at a fraction of the cost of studio photography, develop diverse assets for game and augmented realities, use CAD to prototype and print new parts, or create synthetic worlds to test and train machine learning systems. 3D models solve these problems but they are expensive and slow to build
description: The platform, Real-to-Sim-to-Real, leverages the flexibility of human-like learning and the speed and precision of machines to enable one-shot 3D perception and manipulation of everyday objects. At scale, machines with common sense will accelerate goals and improve lives.
technology_description: Common Sense Machine is developing human-level Real-to-Sim, a platform for translating visual sensor data into editable 3D models. As input our machine learning system takes in photos & videos of real world everyday objects, products, and spaces. We process these inputs using a large scale neural-symbolic AI system that combines 3D computer vision and geometric inductive biases with data driven deep learning. The outputs of our system are highly accurate but most important they are also editable by designers. Unlike alternatives such as photogrammetry which produce uneditable dense point clouds, our technology speeds up the design process yielding high-throughput high-quality model creation without compromising quality. We combine these models with a flexible rendering pipeline to create photorealistic configurable renders of everyday products, furniture, cars and other ecommerce and AR-ready digital assets and imagery.

name: COMMONWEALTH FUSION SYSTEMS (CFS) Edit
elevator_pitch: The fastest path to clean, limitless fusion energy in time to make a difference. Energy use is a fundamental enabler for improved quality of life worldwide, yet historically it has come at an extreme cost to the environment. Commonwealth Fusion Systems (CFS) is combining proven physics backed by decades of government-funded fusion research with a revolutionary superconducting magnet technology to accelerate the path to commercial fusion energy.
description: Development of this carbon-free, combustion-free source of energy is now on a faster track toward realization, thanks to a collaboration between MIT and a new private company, Commonwealth Fusion Systems. CFS will join with MIT to carry out rapid, staged research leading to a new generation of fusion experiments and power plants based on advances in high-temperature superconductors -- work made possible by decades of federal government funding for basic research. Once the superconducting electromagnets are developed by researchers at MIT and CFS -- expected to occur within three years — MIT and CFS will design and build a compact and powerful fusion experiment, called SPARC, using those magnets. The experiment will be used for what is expected to be a final round of research enabling design of the world’s first commercial power-producing fusion plants. SPARC is designed to produce about 100 MW of heat. While it will not turn that heat into electricity, it will produce, in pulses of about 10 seconds, as much power as is used by a small city. That output would be more than twice the power used to heat the plasma, achieving the ultimate technical milestone: positive net energy from fusion. This demonstration would establish that a new power plant of about twice SPARC’s diameter, capable of producing commercially viable net power output, could go ahead toward final design and construction. Such a plant would become the world’s first true fusion power plant, with a capacity of 200 MW of electricity, comparable to that of most modern commercial electric power plants. At that point, its implementation could proceed rapidly and with little risk, and such power plants could be demonstrated within 15 years, say Whyte, Greenwald, and Hartwig.

name: COMPUTING TOGETHER Edit
elevator_pitch: Despite the increasing accessibility to computing resources, computer-aided applications remain a solo experience. Deeply integrating social networking and computing would have dramatic effects on different accounts, including enhanced productivity, accelerated scientific discovery and less overall computing, with clear environmental benefits. Computing Together aims to fill this gap, by providing a software that encompasses distributed cloud-computing, protocols for integrating diverse apps into a unified pipeline and network-based caching capabilities.
description: Founded in 2012, Akselos designs digital twins of the world’s most complex systems. Their next-generation simulation technology helps guard critical infrastructure by creating a virtual replica of an asset in its current environment, right down to the smallest detail, allowing operators to monitor a system’s condition in real-time, as well as predict what will happen in the future. Akselos has developed into a well-established company and continues to grow internationally, working with clients across industries, including off-shore structural engineering, mining, and port infrastructure, to help protect and maintain the large-scale assets that are so central to our lives.
technology_description: The main product of Computing Together is Computo. An early demo (focusing on interactive presentations) can be found here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H9y8gWnABMA In brief, Computo is a web of user-generated web apps (referred to as units) that are connected via variables. Each unit is a node in a graph and can be deployed and shared with the community. This is a clear departure from the well-known Jupyter notebook, where units are serially executed and not individually sharable. The graph-based unit organization together with the visual appeal of web apps, makes Computo also a powerful tool for interactive presentations, where codes, computing and rendering happen in the same place. Computo is complemented with Elba, an in-house distributed computing software that allows to seamlessly run code snippets on remote servers. Abstracting away the backend device, Elba facilitates the integration of heterogeneous systems into unified streams. Furthermore, Elba also offers disk-caching at the workflow level, i.e. calculations are performed only when they are really needed with immediate benefits to productivity and environment.
mit_connection: MIT staff as founder | I am a research scientist at MIT and founder of Computing Together

name: CONCERTO BIOSCIENCES, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: Concerto Biosciences leverages our unmatched understanding of microbial ecology to power microbial product discovery. Targeting the microbiome has been hailed as a promising strategy to safely and sustainably improve human health, crop yield, and consumer experience. However, reliably designing products that accomplish these goals remains elusive, largely because humanity struggles to generate the massive wet-lab datasets necessary to model microbial ecosystems. Concerto unlocks such datasets using kChip, which physically constructs and evaluates millions of miniature, defined microbial cocultures. We have generated the first microbial interaction datasets large enough to enable machine learning on microbial ecosystems. Our resulting insights have already yielded three product candidates: (1) clinical-stage live biotherapeutic product (LBP), Ensemble No.2 (ENS-002), for atopic dermatitis, (2) pre-clinical stage microbial byproduct for skin health, and (3) discovery-stage LBP, ENS-003, for recurrent vulvovaginal candidiasis. Concerto advances its products and platform through partnerships that span therapeutics, cosmetics, agriculture, and food science.
description: Targeting the microbiome has been hailed as a promising strategy to safely and sustainably improve human health, crop yield, and consumer experience. However, reliably designing products that accomplish these goals remains elusive. Companies looking to incorporate microbiome modulation approaches into their product or therapeutic pipelines lack the tools to succeed. Concerto solves this problem by (1) discovering and developing assets (up to proof of concept) and licensing these assets to large companies for co-development, and (2) partnering with companies in co-discovery efforts. Our internal pipeline contains products that solve problems in skin health (both Rx and cosmetic) and women’s health, two areas where companies are looking for safe, effective, and differentiated assets to enhance their product portfolios. Because the capabilities of the microbiome span a wide variety of industries, the problem of microbial product discovery is encountered by companies in industries as diverse as cosmetics, therapeutics, food science, agriculture, and consumer goods.
technology_description: Concerto’s platform is built on kChip, a microwell array platform that randomly assembles nanoliter microbial cultures into millions of microbial cocultures. Using fluorescence microscopy, the microbial contents of each microwell are identified, and the behavior of each coculture is evaluated over time using a phenotypic readout. With many millions of data points analyzed, we have developed machine learning models that reliably nominate novel, functional combinations of microbes. We use our resulting unmatched understanding of microbial ecology to design and develop three main categories of product candidates: (1) prebiotics: nutrients that selectively enhance the growth of beneficial microbes, (2) live biotherapeutic products (LBPs) or “ensembles”: combinations of microbes that work in concert to perform beneficial functions, and (3) postbiotics: microbial byproducts that benefit host health.
mit_connection: MIT-licensed technology | MIT alumni as founder | Concerto Biosciences was founded on kChip technology developed in Prof. Paul Blainey's laboratory at the Broad Institute and the Biological Engineering Department at MIT. We licensed the kChip technology from the Broad Institute and MIT via the Broad Institute Technology Licensing Office. Prof. Paul Blainey is on Concerto's Scientific Advisory Board and is an equity holder in the company. Concerto's lab space is at The Engine accelerator.

name: CONSUMER PHYSICS, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: CP's is SCiO the world's first handheld molecular sensor (Near-Infrared Spectrometer), that is 10-50X smaller and cheaper than anything available on the market. SCiO connects via Bluetooth to a smartphone with dedicated apps, and the apps connect to the SCiO-cloud using the data link. The molecular fingerprint (spectrum) is scanned using SCiO, sent to the cloud for analysis, and the results are displayed on the smartphone in real time. Use cases include food, pharma, agriculture, and more!
description: Consumer Physics’ mission is to empower consumers and businesses to learn about the makeup of materials anytime, anywhere by using SCiO - the world’s smallest most affordable near infrared (NIR) spectrometer. The SCiO sensor pairs with SCiO smartphone apps and connects to a cloud-based database of material fingerprints. Consumer Physics offers businesses and 3rd party developers a platform that enables them to design their own molecular sensing models and mobile applications for personal and commercial use. The SCiO DevKit includes the SCiO Lab development platform and Mobile SDK and access to professional support from Consumer Physics experts. Consumers can use SCiO to scan fruit, vegetables, dairy food, meat, fish, medications, their own body to measure total body fat, and much more within seconds. The SCiO app also includes a DIY applet that allows anyone to scan any materials of their choosing and analyze the difference between their molecular identities. Businesses can use the SCiO DevKit to improve processes and reduce costs in many industries, including manufacturing, food, agriculture, farming, retail, commodities pharma, automotive, plastics, oil and gas, petrochemicals, machinery, cosmetics, gemology, and more. Gone are the days that only labs or skilled professionals use spectrometers. Field deployment of NIR spectrometers has arrived! The possibilities for real-time material analysis are endless Consumer Physics has won numerous awards including OSA (The Optical Society) 2016, The World Economic Forum Technology Pioneers Award 2015, the United Nation’s Netexplo Award 2015, The CES Innovation Honoree 2016, and many more. SCiO has regularly appeared in Top Products to Watch lists on Forbes, CNN, and Fortune, and has been covered numerous times by the media on television, in print, and online

name: COPERNIC CATALYSTS Edit
elevator_pitch: Copernic Catalysts is transforming the way e-fuels and bulk chemicals are made, starting with low-carbon ammonia. One percent (1%) of global carbon emissions comes from the 180 million tons of ammonia produced every year for fertilizer (85%) and chemical (15%) production. Looking forward, low-carbon ammonia is a leading candidate for a next-generation shipping fuel, and it is also one of the most efficient vectors for shipping green hydrogen that can be used for power production. Existing Haber-
description: Today, low-carbon ammonia production is still too expensive for widespread adoption for current uses (fertilizer/chemicals) or future applications (hydrogen transport/marine fuels). Copernic will reduce the cost of low-carbon ammonia production with a novel catalyst that is a drop-in replacement for existing catalysts, eliminating the need for costly engineering redesigns or asset replacements. Going forward, Copernic will target cost reductions for other sustainable e-fuels and bulk chemical processes using its in-silico catalyst discovery platform.
technology_description: Copernic’s in-silico catalyst discovery platform utilizes both physical (DFT) and informatics modeling to screen and rank improved catalysts for sustainable e-fuel and bulk chemical production. Candidates ranked highly in the computational screening process are then subject to high-throughput experimental testing at Copernic’s lab at The Engine. Copernic will be optimizing and formulating catalyst products, scaling them up, and then building a pilot-scale plants to prove-out the economics of its catalyst for potential customers. Copernic’s first product will be a novel thermochemical ammonia synthesis catalyst that will function at lower temperatures and pressures, thereby reducing the production costs for low-carbon ammonia. It will share the same form factor as existing Haber Bosch catalysts, and therefore will be largely a drop-in replacement for existing products. The Engine is one of Copernic Catalysts's lead investors.

technology_description: CubicPV’s perovskite tandem technology will offer more than 30% greater efficiency than the highest efficiency conventional modules. Our efficiency results stand up to commercial realities, no cherry picking, no lab tricks.

name: CULTUREX Edit
elevator_pitch: Organizational culture is very important— a Wharton study found strong culture is associated with a 20% increase in market capitalization over 5 years. But culture is difficult to measure. Traditional employee surveys have several limitations, and capturing the employee voice using standard natural language processing tools yields clunky results that are difficult to act on. CultureX has developed a state of the art technology platform for understanding and acting on the employee voice
description: Accion is developing advanced technologies for the new space industry. We are striving to become a leader in high-quality, affordable propulsion technologies that enable increased access to space. The propulsion systems are some of the first that can turn affordable satellites into capable ones. Accion will reinvest their knowledge and resources into bringing the latest advances from other industries to aerospace, and will work to lower barriers to entry through decreased development cycles and costs for propulsion and other subsystems.
technology_description: Over the course of five years, CultureX has developed a natural language processing platform where every component—from the autocorrect to the lemmatization to the exclusion terms—are tailor made for the specific use case of employee feedback. The platform is trained on millions of real employee comments under the heavy supervision of subject matter experts. Each of the tens of thousands of ‘terms’ in CultureX’s platform are human supervised for accuracy by subject matter experts familiar with the topics, which are selected on the basis of evidence-based research conducted at MIT, Harvard, Stanford, and other leading institutions. As a result, CultureX’s platform has very high accuracy and very high recall, picking up on idiosyncratic jargon and slang. It works in over 100 languages. CultureX’s platform powers the MIT SMR / Glassdoor Culture 500, a large, interactive MIT study of culture incorporating over 1.4 million employee reviews.

name: DATACEBO, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: Developers around the world are blocked from making progress because they cannot easily use data. This can be due to privacy concerns, regulatory issues or data bias. DataCebo aims to break down these barriers through synthetic data. Synthetic data is generated using machine learning, which maintains the format and mathematical properties of the original. It can be used whenever real data is not readily available. DataCebo allows enterprises to create, deploy and maintain synthetic data fo
description: Although billions of gigabytes of data are produced every day, there are still huge gaps in what companies are actually able to use. Privacy concerns, regulatory issues and data bias can all keep developers from using data. This impedes progress in finance, health care and other domains. Good synthetic data can fill these gaps. DataCebo uses machine learning to analyze data and create fully synthetic datasets that mimic the original. Although the synthetic data is entirely machine generated, it maintains the original format and mathematical properties. This makes synthetic data versatile. It can completely replace the existing data in a workflow, or it can supplement the data to enhance its utility. DataCebo has a thriving open source ecosystem, the SDV. Already, our users have successfully used the SDV to augment datasets, test applications, remove bias and more.
technology_description: DataCebo provides a full, end-to-end workflow for generating and using synthetic data for enterprise applications. The core technology is available in our open source ecosystem, the SDV. This includes 5+ proprietary machine learning models suited for different use cases. For example, one model allows us to perform ML on connected, multi-table datasets while also providing control to the end user. We offer additional capabilities to support the end-to-end synthetic data workflow, including data processing, data anonymization and novel metrics for evaluation. With over 600K downloads, open source allows us to thoroughly validate our AI. On top of the core technology, DataCebo offers an enterprise grade product for adopting synthetic data as a viable solution for improving access, accelerating data driven projects. Customers receive premium AI features along with integrations for successfully deploying and maintaining synthetic data in a large organization.

name: DE-ICE Edit
elevator_pitch: De-Ice has developed the first ever on-time, fully electric de-icing solution for the aerospace industry. The device entirely eliminates all chemicals and de-icing delays, and is 100 times more energy efficient than any incumbent solution.
description: De-Ice has a scalable platform technology that will first be launched in the aerospace industry. The beachhead market within this segment is comprised of air charterer companies in the United States. This market is a $400 million market and was selected based on the relatively lighter regulation, the emphasis placed on avoiding delays, and the flexibility of company budgets and purchasing decisions. The first follow-on market is commercial airliners, a $2.6 billion segment. Next, we plan to move on to European ($1.6 billion) and Asian ($1.3 billion) commercial airline markets. Finally, we will tackle other verticals including wind turbines, cars, and driveways. Every year, the airline industry devotes billions of dollars and considerable manpower to de-ice airplanes. To make matters worse, they employ a slow and harmful chemical treatment. De-Ice has created a novel technology that uses electric systems in lieu of these harmful chemicals. Our product will be manufactured directly onto airplanes, completely eliminating chemicals from the de-icing process. Additionally, our method entirely eliminates the manual labor associated with the process, and removes the ice in a fraction of the time and cost. The target business model consists of a one-time up-front installation fee, for retrofitting airplanes with our de-icing system. We will be responsible for developing and maintaining the technology, however we will outsource the actual manufacturing to a specialized third party. The beachhead market for our technology is comprised of U.S.-based private charterer companies which operate via a fractional ownership model, (i.e., individuals can purchase “time shares” in private jets from private charterer companies which own the jets). This market is a $400 million market and was selected based on the relatively lighter regulation, the emphasis placed on avoiding delays, and the flexibility of company budgets and purchasing decisions. The first follow-on market is U.S. corporate fleets ($120 million) where companies such as Microsoft own their own private jets. Finally, we will target U.S. commercial airliners, a $6.8 billion market.

name: DEEPCURE INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: DeepCure, founded by researchers from the MIT Media Lab, develops disruptive Artificial Intelligence technology to revolutionize pharmaceutical development. DeepCure is transforming the field of small-molecule drug discovery, by delivering better drugs in a faster and cheaper way.
description: DeepCure develops disruptive Artificial Intelligence technology to revolutionize pharmaceutical development. The pharma industry is undoubtedly one of the world's largest, with worldwide revenues topping one trillion US dollars. However, its effectiveness is in question, as the exponentially increasing cost of drug discovery and development has resulted in fewer new drugs reaching patients at a much higher price. At the origin of this problem, lies our inability to exhaustively search the astronomical drug-like molecules space for an efficacious drug to a disease-related biological target. To enable future development and reverse the decaying trend, we need a paradigm shift in the form of efficient exploration methods. DeepCure's AI algorithms analyze a trillion drug candidates from the proprietary virtual library and accurately point out the most promising ones while accounting for the dynamic nature of the target and optimizing the required ADMET properties. DeepCure's AI helps identify novel optimization steps that would escape the eyes of even the most experienced medicinal chemist. These steps improve the success rates of drug candidates in subsequent development stages while reducing time and cost. Innovative generative modeling and reinforcement learning methods enable a breakthrough in CADD - Rational Machine Design, a combination of the rational intuition of human chemists with the abstraction abilities and compute power of Artificial Intelligence.
technology_description: The experienced scientists and engineers optimize all phases of drug-discovery, including early hit identification, hit-to-lead, lead optimization, patent strategy, and preparation for IND filing, yielding shorter timelines to develop the highest-quality drug candidates. DeepCure is using AI-driven drug discovery to ensure better molecules and faster cures. The mission is to discover, develop and deliver to patients novel, small molecule drugs that were previously undruggable or undiscovered until our technology came along.
mit_connection: MIT faculty as founder | MIT alumni as founder | Prof. Joseph Jacobson from the MIT Media Lab is a co-founder and board member. Kfir Schreiber and Thrasyvoulos Karydis are co-founder and alumni of the Media Lab.
contact: 351 Beacon Street, Apt. 5, Boston, MA, 02116 • kfir@deepcure.ai, startupexchange-admin@mit.edu, startupexchange@mit.edu, thrakar9@alum.mit.edu
keywords: Artificial Intelligence, Deep Learning, Drug discovery, drug development, Biotechnology, Generative Drug Design, AI Driven Lead Optimization, Lead Discovery, Computational Chemistry, Beyond State-of-Art Machine Learning

name: DEEPVERSE Edit
elevator_pitch: Let's face it, materials development can be a nightmare. It can be infuriating to find the right formulation, extremely costly to test the process parameters and by the time you find that you would have lost time, money, and caused a lot of unnecessary pollution. Well, there’s a solution, DeepVerse.tech. We are an awesome little company, backed by interdisciplinary team from MIT and Cambridge, to utilize existing experimental data along with computer simulation, machine learning, and lab aut
description: The bottleneck of materials R&D is the development cycle of traditional "trial and error" methods , which are long and low efficient. The data-driven method can greatly speed up this process. The current materials database is fragmented and industrial data is often sparse and incomplete, while conventional machine learning would require a large amount of high-quality data. We learn from small, sparse data and maximize the value from all data resources. To empower the data-driven method, it will require interdisciplinary talents and close collaboration, while hiring an entire in-house team would require lots of resources. We act as a CRO to provide the easy-to-access and cost-efficient way to accelerate your R&D department. Companies who want to meet the design target faster and develop product formula more efficiently.
technology_description: We provide data-driven machine learning approaches to optimize materials design. Our "problem-oriented" concept sat at the convergence of various cutting-edge technology (high-throughput computing, high-throughput experiments, and physics-inspired neural networks, etc.) to utilize the all available historical data in materials science to accelerate the materials discovery and design process. Our technology consists of 3 main parts: 1. We build comprehensive materials databases using multiple-sourcing data including experiments, simulations, and data mining from literature. 2. We develop advanced meta-data based machine learning pipelines to automatically select machine learning models and train materials data. The physics and materials understanding were employed to construct physics-inspired neural network to make models consistent with real-world industrial extrapolation. 3. We integrate analysis tools and provide clients with suggested data visualization options using our advanced inference technology (e.g. Use uncertainty quantification to make rational experimental decision).

name: DETOXYFI Edit
elevator_pitch: DetoXyFi is a drinking water filtration startup working to enable access to clean drinking water as a human right. At DetoXyFi, we are building drinking water technology for households— individuals and families— affected by disasters and in need of drinking water. We take waste wood and pass it through a human-safe chemical filtration process to create filters that are 60% cheaper and up to 10x more effective. These filters are biodegradable, take waste wood out of landfills and into productive use, help people affected by disasters get clean drinking water and adapt to climate change, and also help reduce emissions by acting as a replacement to plastic water bottles, carbon filters, boiling water, and such. We have field tested our patent-pending technology across five countries and thousands of people to provide WHO standard comprehensive-protection grade water. We are currently working with humanitarian agencies to provide these filters to the millions of people across the world who need these the most.
description: >200 million people/year are affected by drinking water contamination because of natural disasters such as floods. Globally 2 Billion people face drinking water stress at home. This lack of clean water access also disproportionately affects health outcomes of marginalised, vulnerable communities.
technology_description: For humanitarian organisations providing post-disaster relief, we provide highly effective, affordable, and efficient drinking water filters that help provide individuals clean water for one month. Our filters offer 10x protection against drinking water contaminants at 40% of the cost, in comparison to competitors. Developed over 12 years of research, our field tested, patent pending innovation leverages 100% natural materials to provide comprehensive protection against chemical/metal contaminants and disease causing agents.

name: DIFFRAQTION Edit
elevator_pitch: Using breakthroughs in quantum technology developed for NASA to discover life on other planets, we are creating minituarizable quantum sensors that significantly increase magnification and capturing speed. Furthermore, our sensors provide incredibly fast machine vision via Optical Neural Networks. Optical Neural Networks are physical optical devices that can fully replicate a digital neural network for machine vision. Our quantum sensors are fully integrated with Optical Neural Networks, allow
description: We tackle 3 problems of modern camera sensors and machine vision: 1) Magnification and Shutter Speed: Imaging sensors used by cameras in cellphones, autonomous vehicles, and robotics are based on CMOS or CCD technology to capture images. A key challenge of these sensors is low magnification and capturing speed, limited by a physical boundary, the diffraction limit. 2) AI Inference Speed: Machine Vision applications require an increasing amount of compute power, offloading it to the cloud. These delays affect user experience and limits applications, especially in environments where quick decision making is important, e.g. autonomous vehicles. 3) Energy Consumption: Modern AI systems are inefficient and are consuming an escalating amount of energy, contributing to a growing share of the tech sector's carbon footprint, which accounts for 2-3% of global emissions.
technology_description: Our technology was developed in partnership with DARPA and NASA for high-precision space situational awareness. It is intended to fit into the Habitable Worlds Observatory, the successor to the James Webb and Hubble space observatories, dedicated to finding exoplanets that can support life. We use modal imaging at the quantum limit of resolution, for passive imaging with incoherent light. We attain the fundamental quantum limits in the regimes when conventional imaging techniques fail, using pre-detection spatial mode sorting, including adaptive techniques.
mit_connection: MIT faculty as founder | MIT staff as founder | MIT alumni as founder | Saikat Guha - Co-Founder, Chief Scientific Advisor: MIT PhD 08' & SM EECS, Adjunct Professor at MIT EECS Johannes Galatsanos - SM 24' Management of Technology, Sloan Fellow, RA at MIT Sloan IDE
contact: johannes.galatsanos@diffraqtion.com, startupexchange-admin@mit.edu, startupexchange@mit.edu

name: DISPLAID Edit
elevator_pitch: Displaid promotes the safety and efficiency of transportation networks through a standardised and scalable bridge monitoring solution, enabling digital transition and predictive maintenance. Thanks to an innovative integrated system based on smart sensors and proprietary AI algorithms, Displaid provides infrastructure managers with accurate information to support real-time decision-making and maintenance.
description: Road infrastructure is vital for every country. Worldwide, bridges, which are key network nodes, are subject to increasing risks due to ageing, traffic and extreme weather events. The current approach to maintenance, based on subjective and ineffective visual inspections, not only jeopardises safety, but also causes frequent service disruptions, late interventions and inefficient allocation of available resources. Predictive maintenance based on continuous monitoring with sensors could address these problems, but current solutions are costly and time-consuming to implement, not integrated, and unable to provide timely information to managing organisations. This hampers widespread adoption of monitoring by both local authorities and highway and rail operators
technology_description: Displaid distinguishes itself from direct competitors (i.e. engineering companies, system integrators, and other startups) by an innovative approach to monitoring, characterised by scalability, which is necessary for large-scale adoption, and greater information effectiveness. The founders, PhDs with a focus on bridge monitoring, have developed proprietary analysis algorithms tested on more than 25 bridges, capable of identifying 300% more damage than traditional methods. These algorithms generate standardised and replicable KPIs for different types of bridges, eliminating the need for structure-specific models. In addition, Displaid designed smart IoT sensors with autonomous power and data quality equal to wired sensors, reducing installation costs and time by 70%. The sensors enable AI analysis directly at the bridge, lowering IT costs. Processed data is available in dashboards for an intuitive and immediate predictive system.

name: DORADUS LABS Edit
elevator_pitch: Doradus Labs is a software development company focused on commercializing cutting-edge technology developed in response to the Boston Marathon Bombings to efficiently analyze large video sets and identify specific objects or people. FOVEA (Forensic Video Exploitation and Analysis) software tool is designed to give operators the ability to quickly detect and track objects of interest in a scene, such as people, vehicles, and other objects, using advanced computer vision algorithms and machine lea
description: Many public facilities have already invested in comprehensive and technologically advanced video surveillance, however the task of reviewing video is still time consuming and tedious for human operators Review of surveillance video is often performed in response to a report of suspicious activity, video review is entirely manual and can take hours or days depending on the event
technology_description: FOVEA is a forensic video exploitation and analysis tool suite that helps law enforcement agencies, security agencies, and other organizations analyze video data for evidentiary purposes. The FOVEA tool suite offers a variety of features such as object tracking, image and video enhancement, facial recognition, and scene reconstruction. It uses machine learning and computer vision techniques to extract relevant information from video data and can handle various video formats, including compressed and encrypted videos. Extremely efficient algorithm implementations that do not require new or specialized hardware (e.g., GPUs or large servers). Implementation of tools as a lightweight add-on that is directly integrated with existing video surveillance systems, therefore not requiring export or download of video before analysis. FOVEA provides several capabilities and benefits that can aid investigators in analyzing video footage and solving crimes. Its efficient algorithm implementations and lightweight add-on integration make it an attractive option for many organizations.

Duality Technology's products empower multiple parties to collaborate and gain new insights while keeping sensitive data protected. Duality products seamlessly integrate with your existing systems, making it easy to set up collaborative projects quickly and at scale. Our product platform allows you to securely query third-party data, use AI tools and analyze data, all while utilizing encrypted data or model
description: Data security and privacy is a major and continually growing concern for modern society in general and businesses in particular. Regulatory concerns such as HIPAA and GDPR oblige companies to limit the sharing of data, both externally and internally. These sharing limitations restrict companies’ abilities to derive valuable insight from data, such as developing new cancer treatments if genomic data could be shared, or identifying fraud and other financial crimes by allowing banks to more effectively scan suspicious transactions. Furthermore, regulatory and security concerns limit companies’ abilities to leverage the elasticity and cost-effectiveness of cloud computing environments. Using homomorphic encryption schemes, a user is able to encrypt data then send the data to an less-trusted server that executes an encrypted computation, such as an encrypted query on local data. The server then returns the encrypted result of those computations to the client. Finally, the user decrypts the result. Usability has been a guiding principle of Duality since our founding, based on the prior experiences of our co-founders using data science tools in production and in deployed encrypted computing solutions for early adopters in the US government. Hence, Duality’s platform is designed from the ground up to be usable and easily adopted by production data scientists, surpassing our competitor’s products in ease-of-use and practical effectiveness. A prime example of where Duality’s solution has been particularly effective is in the domain of privacy-preserving computing on genomic data. Duality was funded by the National Human Genome Research Institute (NHGRI) of the NIH to develop an encrypted computing solution that would enable Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS) on encrypted genome data at scale for use by cancer researchers at the Dana Farber Cancer Institute (DFCI). Duality’s solution surpassed all expectations of our NIH sponsors, developing techniques that scale linearly to perform GWAS operations on “live” encrypted genomic data.
technology_description: Duality Technologies leverages secure computing techniques, such as Fully Homomorphic Encryption (FHE), that offer the possibility of general computing on data while it remains encrypted, thus providing both privacy and security that satisfy regulatory requirements. FHE allows sensitive data to be encrypted such that arbitrary programs can be securely run over the encrypted data without decrypting it, yielding encrypted output. When decrypted, this output is equivalent to the result of running the original program on the unencrypted data. Practical and usable FHE leads to a sea change in computing, thus allowing privacy-preserving analytics and machine learning on encrypted data. For example, it would enable computation to be outsourced to untrusted computing resources such as cloud-based servers while guaranteeing the privacy of data used in that computation. The basis of homomorphic encryption schemes used by Duality Technologies comes from recent advances in lattice-based cryptography. As such, homomorphic encryption schemes used by Duality Technologies are known to be post-quantum, meaning that they are resistant to quantum computing attacks. Between its functional use and security properties, there is a mature, vibrant and rapidly growing community of homomorphic encryption researchers and users. Duality Technologies co-founders help to lead the industry standards consortium for FHE.

name: DUST IDENTITY Edit
elevator_pitch: DUST Identity links physical objects to their digital records - securely.
description: DUST -- the Diamond Uncloneable Security Tag -- is a proprietary technology which utilizes nanodiamonds to create an unclonable identity layer on any object. An optical scanner and cloud-based infrastructure provides an interface to the object identity and provenance. DUST ensures that trusted data and verifiable products are used and traced across their full lifecycle. HISTORICAL INFORMATION: Formerly Diamond Nanotechnologies, Inc., DUST Identity is a Boston-based early stage venture focused on developing advanced microscopy tools for neuroscience and biology. The technologies stemmed out of scientific research that we conducted at Columbia University and MIT on nitrogen-vacancy color centers in diamond. As this research transitioned from fundamental studies to development of practical imaging and sensing tools, there was a growing interest in our tools from physicists, chemists, biologists and neuroscientists; thus, we decided to spin-off the company. This allows us to focus on our users needs and deliver the best tools for their applications. DUST Identity continues a strong relationship with early adopters in a variety of scientific disciplines. This has enabled an applications-driven development approach to solve some of the greatest challenges of our time such as simultaneous, real-time imaging of the action potential of thousands of neurons with single-neuron specificity and single-molecule tracking in live cells. Recently, Diamond Nanotechnologies was awarded a multiple-year contract from the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) to develop an optical imaging system that uses diamond nanosensors. This system can potentially enable high-speed parallel recording of neural activity in brain tissue in vitro and in vivo of animal models.
technology_description: DUST Identity developed a process to engineer nano-scale synthetic diamonds with quantum properties, known as "nitrogen vacancies," that allow us to detect the diamond's orientation. After enhancement, the diamonds are embedded into physical objects using common polymers.

name: DXLAB INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: DxLab Inc. (DxLab) is a biotech startup, spun out of MIT and Harvard in September 2020, developing and commercializing a next-generation point-of-care (POC) diagnostic solution for rapid, on-site detection of dangerous pathogens. Combining proprietary platform technology with novel target detection and signal processing methods, we are advancing a pipeline of rapid POC tests.
description: The mission at PathAI is to transform, accelerate and improve cancer diagnosis and cancer care by integrating pathology machine learning / artificial intelligence (AI) with traditional pathology methods in both research and clinical labs. By leveraging recent advances in computational processing power and AI, the conventional methods of pathology are disrupted and improved, leading to meaningful improvements in medicine and patient outcomes. PathAI's revolutionary approach provides the highest level of standardization, accuracy and precision in pathology available today, delivering solutions to researchers and empowering pathologists with decision support tools.
technology_description: We have developed a new POC testing solution that utilizes a proven isothermal amplification technique, enabling highly accurate detection of targeted nucleic acids in as little as 10 minutes. Our testing solution does not involve any sample purification steps and instead works directly with crude specimens, simplifying sample collection and processing. The key feature of our solution is a portable, POC testing device with a small form factor (only weighing 5.1 lb.) that uniquely provides eight reaction chambers (i.e., test bays) that can be independently controlled in a random-access manner. Coupled with our “one-pot” assay design for simultaneous detection of targeted nucleic acids and control nucleic acid in a single reaction tube, our testing device enables up to eight samples to be tested at once on-the-spot. This testing throughput is several-fold higher compared to any existing POC testing systems (most of which can only test one sample at a time). Key advantages of our solution include: ● Simple operation – Our test only involves four simple steps (sample collection, sample elution, sample transfer, device operation) without any need for expensive reagents or equipment for sample purification. The testing device provides clear on-screen instructions on how to run the test and automatically performs the amplification reaction on the samples. The device also performs signal processing and interpretation to provide unequivocal test results that do not involve any subjective signal interpretation. Various built-in controls in the test ensure that integrity of the amplification reaction is maintained, minimizing the rate of false-positives and false-negatives originating from various interfering sources. ● Proven device platform – Our testing device has been developed in partnership with Axxin, the ISO 13485 accredited experts in the development of diagnostic platforms. The device is built on the same core technology and platform that have been used in other FDA-approved in vitro diagnostic devices, such as Abbott’s ID Now device. ● Rapid testing time – Our testing solution provides a test result in 10-15 minutes for positive samples, 25 minutes for negative samples. ● Flexibility and adaptability – The core technology used in our testing solution is readily adjustable to target different nucleic acids, allowing for rapid development and deployment of new pathogen detection tests. ● High-throughput testing at the POC – Up to eight samples can be tested per device. Each of the test bays on our device can be controlled independently in a random-access manner, making it possible to test the samples sequentially or in parallel. This is especially useful in the POC settings, since samples can be tested as soon as they are collected, instead of waiting for all eight samples to be collected before running any test or waiting for previous sample testing to finish before starting the next test. To confirm the capabilities of our solution, we designed our amplification reaction to target SARS-CoV-2, which could provide highly accurate detection of the virus on our testing device in as early as 10 minutes. This COVID-19 testing system received the emergency use authorization from the FDA.

name: DYNOCARDIA, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: There is an unmet clinical need for wearable continuous, non-invasive blood pressure (cNIBP) technology for out-patient diagnosis and management of hypertension (high BP), and in-patient monitoring of BP to prevent complications and reduce costs. There is no standalone cNIBP monitor in the market. Dynocardia's ViTrack technology is the first direct non-invasive method for measuring BP and a novel, cuff-less, standalone, wearable technology for cNIBP.
description: With support from the National Institutes of Health, a combined team of researchers at Tufts University School of Medicine and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology have developed the patented ViTrack technology. Work completed to date includes the development of hardware and software, bench-top studies, animal validation studies, and clinical studies. In clinical studies, ViTrack meets FDA standards. Dynocardia, Inc a Delaware Corporation, was recently established to commercialize ViTrack.
technology_description: The technology, continuous blood pressure monitor was jointly developed by MIT and Tufts University Faculty, who are also co-founders. This platform technology includes a proprietary optomechanical sensor and a new method for accurate and continuous measurements of BP, respiratory and advanced heart parameters. ViTrack technology is fundamentally different from all existing BP devices. ViTrack, based on pressure-dependent skin displacement, is the first to measure beat-to-beat systolic and diastolic BPs directly with the accuracy of invasive arterial pressure without external calibration, irrespective of subject movement or wrist position relative to the heart (hydrostatic pressure change). Over the past 6 years, the Company has developed multiple versions of the technology and proven that the technology meets FDA standards in preclinical and outpatient clinical studies. Over the last year, the Company has built a minimal viable product and, in clinical protocols more challenging than the FDA recommendations, has demonstrated accurate 20-second BP measurements despite patient movement in the ICU and operating rooms. The Company is currently conducting a 270-patient multi-center study on a wide range of patients for product validation in world-renowned hospitals.

name: EDEN Edit
elevator_pitch: Eden GeoTech is a Cambridge-based cleantech start-up, with a focus on developing sustainable downhole solutions for the geothermal, and oil&gas industry. Currently, we are in the piloting stage of proprietary technology to enhance wells' productivity by improving the fracture network within reservoirs. This water-less technology will replace the environmentally hazardous hydraulic fracturing method currently used globally. Additionally, the company is developing a technology to harvest renewable
description: Eden GeoPower is a renewable energy company founded by a group of MIT and LSU students in April of 2017. The vision of our company is to develop new technologies to transform low-grade heat from depleted oil and gas reservoirs to sources of geothermal power. The power generated at these marginal well sites will be used to replace diesel generators during ongoing oil field operations, or sold to the grid in power purchase agreements.
technology_description: Eden GeoTech is developing a novel method to directionally increase reservoir permeability by utilizing high-voltage electric pulses as a stimulation mechanism, Pulse Electrical Reservoir Stimulation. Alternative hydraulic fracturing methods create unpredictable fracture networks and consume substantial amounts of water per operation. This technology is a water-less, inexpensive, and environmentally friendly method to increase reservoir permeability. In the deployment, a custom-made power supply is utilized to create a voltage difference between electrodes inserted into the reservoir. Joule heating of the reservoir induces thermal stresses, creating a network of micro-fractures. These fractures increase reservoir permeability for enhanced hydrocarbon extraction, geothermal heat recovery, carbon capture, and gas storage applications. The company is also working on a Wireless Power technology, to utilize downhole production mechanics and produce wireless and sustainable power downhole (up to 100 watts). The wireless power technology will help power downhole sensors and equipment during production, eliminate any workover necessary otherwise for batteries or wires for up to 10-years.

name: ELECTRIFIED THERMAL SOLUTIONS, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: Electrified Thermal Solutions (ETS) is working to electrify and decarbonize industries globally. To move on from fossil fuels, the world needs a new approach to heating. Electric heating from wind and solar farms today is frequently less expensive than burning fuel. All that is missing is a technology that can practically deliver that energy as reliable, high-temperature heat. To solve this, we’re developing the Joule Hive: a new energy storage technology that turns unreliable wind and solar e
description: ETS is developing the Joule Hive: a new energy storage technology that converts surplus zero-carbon electricity into heat. The stored heat can replace fossil fuels in industrial processes such as cement or iron production, or run a turbine for on-demand electricity at a fraction of the cost of lithium-ion batteries. The innovation of the Joule Hive stems from a novel joule-heating system, built from electrically conductive ceramics developed at MIT. With its unique ability to store gigawatt-hours of energy, hot as flames, the Joule Hive may act as a drop-in replacement for fossil fuels to decarbonize the energy consumption of any co-located industrial plant.
technology_description: The Joule Hive technology innovates on 100 years of ceramic energy storage, and is inspired by the hot blast stoves of the steel industry. It is a large mass of electrically conductive ceramic bricks, which is joule-heated by surplus electricity from wind, solar or nuclear plants, to temperatures approaching 2000oC. When the energy is desired, air or another gas is blown through the Joule Hive, and blended to produce whatever temperature is required by the co-located boiler or furnace. Joule Hive can be sized to produce constant heat to megawatt or gigawatt-scale processes. Joule Hive may also be attached to existing power plant technologies, allowing them harmonize with renewables, e.g., by storing surplus solar energy in the Joule Hive during the day and running the turbine with it at night, completely free of combustion. Joule Hive also makes process emissions capturable without expensive gas separation in the steel and cement industries, approximately 15% of global emissions.

name: ELEKTROFI Edit
elevator_pitch: We have built a platform to deliver high concentration, low viscosity biologic drug solutions, while simultaneously improving the lifetime of the drug in the body. Our solution is based on a proprietary formulation technology that enables high biologic drug concentrations (>500 mg/ml) but eliminates intermolecular interactions. Our solution benefits the pharma company, the insurance company, the patient and the healthcare provider.
description: An MIT spoinout company revolutionizing the delivery of biologics with a particular focus on protein therapeutics. Elektrofi has developed a proprietary platform formulation technology to take protein therapeutics from a time intensive IV injection to SubQ delivery while maintaining bioactivity and stability. The all MIT Cambridge based team seeking to solve the following problem: At-home, self-administered subcutaneous delivery of biologics therapeutics (i.e. delivery of peptides, proteins, monoclonal antibodies etc.) is preferred as it improves ease of use and avoids hospitalization for administration. This can increase patient compliance and reduce workload for clinical workers – reducing overall treatment costs. However, in many cases the required dose is significantly higher than the 1.0 - 1.5 mL limit of self-injection devices which introduces the need for concentrated protein drug solutions. Unfortunately, injectable high concentration protein solutions often cannot be achieved because the protein solutions become too viscous when > 100 mg/mL. This leads to either more frequent subcutaneous injections at lower concentrations or clinically administered, large volume IV infusions that can take hours to deliver. We are able to solve these issues utilizing our proprietary tech.

name: ELMWORKS Edit
elevator_pitch: Elmworks is developing additive manufacturing for electric motors—the single largest user of electricity in the U.S. and a critical component in decarbonized infrastructure. This technology can transform the design and manufacturing of electromagnetics from a dark art to a turnkey process and produce motors with increased performance at lower cost.
technology_description: Elmworks is developing additive manufacturing for electric motors and other electromagnetic devices through high-speed, precision placement of fine wire. By leveraging modern motion control and efficient upstream manufacturing processes, the geometric control and turnkey production common in PCB manufacturing can be brought to electromagnetics, enabling new architectures and dramatic performance improvements. Because of the achievable density and additive scaling, disparate components can become monolithic, and disparate processes can be combined, reducing development costs, uncertainties, and timelines. Elmworks’ process also embeds sensing and control directly into devices, enabling granular feedback control and performance optimization. Applied to electric motors, this technology enables agile manufacturing of next-generation designs, with dramatic increases in achievable power density and material utilization. Elmworks’ technology will transform design and manufacturing of electromagnetics from a dark art to a turnkey process, while also enabling new electric motor designs with significant performance increases and cost reductions. These performance increases, particularly power density, will be critically enabling for difficult-to-decarbonize sectors like aviation. Further, Elmworks’ process will also bring high-performance designs to cost-constrained applications, saving significant energy (and money) due to the vast (and growing) amount of electricity flowing through motors today.

name: ELROY AIR Edit
elevator_pitch: Elroy Air is the leading Aerospace + Logistics company working to enable same-day shipping to every person on the planet. Based in San Francisco California, Elroy Air is developing the Chaparral - an autonomous vertical-takeoff-and-landing (VTOL) aircraft that delivers cargo rapidly and flexibly by air (300-500lbs, 300miles). The impact of this cutting-edge vehicle is expanded express capabilities for B2B parcel shippers, immediate aid and relief in disaster and fire-fighting situations, the ene
description: De-Ice has a scalable platform technology that will first be launched in the aerospace industry. The beachhead market within this segment is comprised of air charterer companies in the United States. This market is a $400 million market and was selected based on the relatively lighter regulation, the emphasis placed on avoiding delays, and the flexibility of company budgets and purchasing decisions. The first follow-on market is commercial airliners, a $2.6 billion segment. Next, we plan to move on to European ($1.6 billion) and Asian ($1.3 billion) commercial airline markets. Finally, we will tackle other verticals including wind turbines, cars, and driveways. Every year, the airline industry devotes billions of dollars and considerable manpower to de-ice airplanes. To make matters worse, they employ a slow and harmful chemical treatment. De-Ice has created a novel technology that uses electric systems in lieu of these harmful chemicals. Our product will be manufactured directly onto airplanes, completely eliminating chemicals from the de-icing process. Additionally, our method entirely eliminates the manual labor associated with the process, and removes the ice in a fraction of the time and cost. The target business model consists of a one-time up-front installation fee, for retrofitting airplanes with our de-icing system. We will be responsible for developing and maintaining the technology, however we will outsource the actual manufacturing to a specialized third party. The beachhead market for our technology is comprised of U.S.-based private charterer companies which operate via a fractional ownership model, (i.e., individuals can purchase “time shares” in private jets from private charterer companies which own the jets). This market is a $400 million market and was selected based on the relatively lighter regulation, the emphasis placed on avoiding delays, and the flexibility of company budgets and purchasing decisions. The first follow-on market is U.S. corporate fleets ($120 million) where companies such as Microsoft own their own private jets. Finally, we will target U.S. commercial airliners, a $6.8 billion market.
technology_description: Chaparral is a VTOL UAS capable of supporting defense, civil government, NGO and commercial customers with a highly responsive aerial cargo delivery system. The design point for the Chaparral in base configuration is 300 lbs payload with a 300 mile range at 6k95. Hybrid-electric powertrain, with all-electric propulsion. Autonomy in flight and on-ground, with hands-off cargo pickup/dropoff.

description: Empatica is a affective computing company, focused on human data analytics. The company develops groundbreaking wearable devices with medical quality sensing. The goal is to help people make better decisions in their everyday lives, based on smart human data analytics. Empatica, which builds wearable devices to measure how biological signals relate to emotions, sought $100,000 in crowdfunding for the device, called Embrace, on IndieGoGo in mid-November. The company met that goal after a day of soliciting donations, and has since raised more than $50,000 on top of it. Embrace is slated to be available next summer (2015) for $199. It will include apps to spot seizures and to let you know when your stress level has risen past a certain point that you’ve set. It also can do things that regular activity trackers do, like track movement and sleep. If Empatica’s algorithm detects a seizure, the band will vibrate, giving the user a chance to indicate that there’s been a false alarm. If the user doesn’t respond, it will connect with his or her smartphone to alert a list of people, such as a doctor and family members. The company plans to seek approval for the device from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration.

description: Emvolon is a technology company developing a platform for distributed chemical production from resources that otherwise would be wasted. Its platform converts wasted natural gas at flare sites into usable chemicals for use in a broad array of industrial applications or as a fuel. The team is reimagining mass-produced diesel engines as miniature chemical reactors that can efficiently and effectively provide communities the raw materials they need, without building massive refineries and chemical plants. The process enables economically attractive small plants by exchanging economies of mass production for economies of scale. Launched out of MIT, the company plans to use the capital to expand its engineering and business development staff. The team expansion will help continue to scale Emvolon’s technology as a key enabler of a low-carbon future.

name: ENCORE HEALTH SOLUTIONS Edit
elevator_pitch: We are working on an AI-focused Revenue Cycle Management platform for denials management. The platform would be for hospitals, health systems and clinics to successfully and efficiently appeal their clinical denials. The product is ready to pilot with hospitals and clinics.
description: What is the problem you are are trying to solve? Who might have this problem? Approximately 8% of clinical claims submitted by hospitals to payers/ insurance are denied for medical necessity. The process to appeal these denials is highly manual and time consuming. This could also lead to closure of hospitals given that many of them operate on 2 - 3% margins. This is especially a major problem for hospitals in rural regions of America.
technology_description: Our product uses clinical NLP and AI to overturn denials and recoup reimbursements for the hospitals. We speed up the workflow for denial teams while keeping the human-in-the-loop for final review. The product integrates with the Electronic Health Record (EHR) and the exchange house software such as Athena IDX. We also have a licensing agreement with the American Medical Association to use relevant CPT and ICD-10 codes. We also use Llama 2 to generate appeal letters. The product is HIPPA and SOC-2 certified.

name: ENGIMATA Edit
elevator_pitch: Development of a vaccine against COVID-19 is crucial, especially now during the current Pandemic. Engimata is working towards developing a vaccine against COVID-19 using its platform technology that enables development of freeze- and thermostable vaccines with broader immune response.
description: Engimata’s mission is to make stable and effective vaccines against infectious diseases to extend life expectancy and to save lives. Engimata is developing heat- and freeze-stable vaccines that overcome the need for a cold-supply chain, reducing cost of vaccine distribution and revaccination, decreasing waste, and increasing accessibility to vaccines throughout the world.
technology_description: Engimata has a patented platform adjuvant technology that improves vaccine efficiency, reduces antigen dose and enhances vaccine stability outside the cold supply chain. Engimata’s vaccine is cost-effective, easy to scale up, and simple to manufacture and distribute outside the cold supply chain. This increases vaccine accessibility and stability, ultimately saving cost, resources, and lives. Engimata’s platform technology is compatible with recombinant protein antigens and it enhances immune response required for vaccines against diseases such as influenza, SARS, AIDS, and COVID-19. Vaccines containing this adjuvant do not need to be discarded if they are exposed to warm or freezing temperatures. This vaccine design prevents vaccine wastage in the supply chain, saving the costs of revaccination and vaccine repurchasing. Engimata has developed a vaccine against COVID-19 with promising results in animal studies. Unlike other COVID-19 vaccines in development, Engimata's COVID-19 vaccine can be transported and distributed outside the cold supply chain at room temperature.

name: EPIBONE, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: EpiBone’s mission is to advance skeletal reconstruction through precision design and living cells. The company's technology allows patient's to harness the healing capacity of their own body, and is able to grow living autologous bone and cartilage grafts. Currently pre-clinical, EpiBone aims to commence first-in-human clinical trials within a year. EpiBone’s technologies are based on a decade of NIH-funded academic research conducted at Columbia University.
description: EpiBone is a revolutionary bone reconstruction company that allows patients to “grow their own bone”. EpiBone’s pioneering technology utilizes a scan of the patient’s bone defect and the patient’s own stem cells to construct and cultivate a defect-specific autologous-like bone graft. EpiBone is strategically positioned to provide a superior bone graft that will provide exact defect repair, a simplified surgical procedure, improved bone formation and regeneration, and shorter recovery times, without the complications of foreign body implantation, to the over 900,000 patients who undergo bone-related surgeries each year. name: EPICORE BIOSYSTEMS, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: We offer a small, wearable patch that can continuously monitor anyone's hydration levels as well as levels of electrolytes and biomarkers such as cortisol by sampling tiny amounts of sweat through our patented microfluidics. This is a game changer for employers who want to protect their employees from heat-related injuries, professional and amateur athletes who want to maximize their performance, and researchers who need to monitor subjects during clinical trials. The patch relays data in real time to an app, which can alert users to potentially dangerous health conditions such as dehydration, electrolyte imbalance or stress, thus preventing injury. Our machine learning algorithms can combine the sensor data with environmental and other data to accurately forecast dangerous conditions to further protect against injury.
description: As extreme heat becomes more and more common around the world, workers across a wide variety of industries, including construction, mining, oil & gas exploration, logistics, landscaping, firefighting and more, are being exposed to far greater risk of severe or even fatal heat injury. Employers wish to protect their workers from this type of injury while at the same time ensuring that they are able to work effectively. Epicore’s connected hydration patch provides individualized, real-time monitoring and feedback on each worker’s current state of hydration, their body temperature, movement, and their electrolyte and cortisol levels, to detect heat stress, dehydration and electrolyte imbalances before they become severe, alerting the worker to take a break, rehydrate and replenish electrolytes. This is not only a moral imperative for employers, but is a huge cost saver in terms of evacuations, medical treatments, lost productivity and worker’s compensation claims.
technology_description: Epicore holds over two dozen patents on the core microfluidics technologies that make it possible to accurately and continuously monitor hydration, electrolytes and biomarkers from just a few microliters of sweat. Our patch consists of a microfluidic substrate and microchip housed within an impact-resistant, static-resistant plastic, and is certified under five different standards for hazardous environments. The patch can be worn under PPE all day and does not cause skin irritation. Our deep patent portfolio and our years of research results represent a strong differentiator and barrier to entry for any potential competitors.

Aranyosi, our Chief Scientific Officer, has a PhD from the Harvard-MIT Health Sciences and Technology program, and served as Lecturer at MIT from 2006 to 2009, Research Scientist at MIT from 2002 to 2009, and Research Assistant at MIT from 1994 to 2002. name: EQORE INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: Valeriia Tyshchenko (MIT BS'23), Jorge Nin (MIT BS'22, MS'24), and Donald Groh (Duke BS'22) are the founding team behind EQORE. The company's developing smart battery systems for commercial and industrial facilities to reduce their electricity bills without any change in operations. EQORE’s work makes adding storage to the grid financially attractive, helping enable the integration of renewables while supporting businesses. The team brings in battery engineering experience from Apple and Tesla and installation expertise from 6+ years in construction and permitting. With 5 paying customers secured, they are already in the process of launching 2 pilot sites. They’ve received $118K in non-dilutive funding and are now actively raising a $1.5M pre-seed round (which already reached 50% in soft commitments) You can find their 5-minute MIT Demo Day stage recording here: https://vimeo.com/1007732944
description: Electricity consumers throughout the US are getting affected by rising utility costs. In certain places like California, industrial utility rates have tripled in just the last few years. That forced certain manufacturing businesses to move or even shut down. One of the reasons behind that rate increase is the lack of storage in the grid. The supply of power can be intermittent, so to match it with the demand, that energy needs to be stored. Otherwise, there’s an expensive imbalance in the grid, and the people paying for it are the customers. While some storage has been added to the grid in the recent years, we need to be integrating it more than 20 times faster to support the energy transition. With EQORE, we can distribute the cost and benefits of storage across thousands of businesses, all while helping them reduce their bills.
technology_description: Our product is a smart battery system installed on the site of a business. While it is a turn-key solution, our innovation lies in its software and we are hardware-agnostic. Located behind the meter, an EQORE system acts as a filter between the grid and the facility, allowing it to operate and consume electricity as usual, while our algorithm decides when to pull that electricity from the grid or from the battery. Behind-the-meter commercial & industrial energy storage market is largely unexplored but is highly lucrative. We're unlocking its value with our exceptional software-to-market fit and deployment optimization strategies.

name: EQUALERT LLC Edit
elevator_pitch: Human and Veterinary health monitoring devices, BioSec™ monitors supply-chains of COVID-19 viral test kits, medications and vaccines using secure IoT, blockchain and AI technology. BioSec™can monitor test swabs, RT-PCR kits, vaccines and reagents throughout the process of distribution, testing and diagnostic lab as well as vaccination sites and protocols; BioSec™ provides insights into supply-chains which improves health care protocols for reducing false negatives and vaccine spoilage with effective asset delivery to maximize outbreak control.
description: The BioSec™ system consists of a miniature, low cost IoT data logger device that is ready for manufacture and deployment and is complimented by a scalable cloud-based architecture with a web portal, originally designed for veterinary vaccine supply-chain applications. The technology has been modified to secure and validate chain-of-custody (CoC) transactions during transfer of test kits and samples from time of packing and distribution to test site deployment then transfer of test samples for laboratory analysis. It provides an anonymous and unbreakable chain, which monitors samples continuously while gathering data which can reveal any tampering, contamination or temperature extremes during transport, storage or handling. The encrypted data is stored in a permissioned blockchain within a secure cloud platform. The data cannot be altered once recorded. As supply-chain data is collected, basic data analysis and AutoML technologies will be applied through numerous cloud providers such as Amazon Web Services. A template ML architecture plan is prepared and will be augmented with a business logic strategy through consultation with government bodies. These plans will tune the ML architecture to produce alerts and insights that are relevant to health authorities, planners and test kit manufacturers. A paper slated to be published in June 2020 in the International Journal of Information Management, has been released for online review, citing the benefits of using intelligent blockchains for safe vaccine supply and distribution. Blockchain by itself can only add the assurance of authenticity. It fails to provide the important data of actual individual package handling needed to identify when the vaccine is damaged by temperature fluctuations outside the safe bounds.Peer-reviewed and published, Gates,2020, has cited the use of machine learning (ML) and related technologies to improve vaccine supply-chain activities for the COVID-19 crisis. [ https://www.nejm.org/doi/full/10.1056/NEJMp2003762 ] At this time the aggregation of these technologies to produce a secure and trusted healthcare platform that can intelligently monitor supply chains of viral diagnostic kits and vaccines is still absent. BioSec™ fulfills this absence leveraging optimal digital transformation technologies for COVID-19 vaccine and test kit supply-chain monitoring; bringing to the global market an innovative commercial application to help resolve the COVID-19 crisis.
technology_description: Sensor wearable with wireless data communication to cloud data storage and a web portal. Monitoring biological samples for chain-of-custody handling and cold chain compliance.

name: EVA TECHNOLOGY CORP. Edit
elevator_pitch: Eva is developing 100X performance analog AI training solutions to replace energy-hungry graphic processing units (GPUs) and enable sustainable large-scale training model development. The company will build a novel class of high-performance private data centers to train and license complex AI models far beyond incumbents' current capacities.
description: The rapid growth of artificial intelligence (AI) has resulted in a corresponding increase in the computing demands of AI applications, doubling every two months. In contrast, digital processors are fast approaching their limits, where their performance doubles as slow as every 2.8 years. At this rate, training the state-of-the-art neural network in 2025 is expected to cost more than $1B and consume higher power than the entire New York City. To break this barrier, Eva is developing 100× performance analog AI training hardware, that will enable advanced AI applications far beyond our current reach.
technology_description: Eva is developing high-performance, general-purpose, analog AI hardware for large-scale training applications; as well as advanced algorithms that enable accurate computation with these processors. These systems are estimated to deliver more than 640 TOPS while only consuming 2 W of power, which is >100× higher than leading digital solutions. Importantly, these novel systems share the same high-level properties to GPUs, which enables their seamless adoption.

name: EXERGY DYNAMICS, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: Exergy Dynamics, Inc. has licensed MIT technology.
description: The idea of storing information using DNA has been around for a while. It’s just that the cost of DNA synthesis has been a bottle neck. What CATALOG is building can be thought of as a printing press with movable typefaces. Instead of having to synthesize billions of different molecules, we are creating the necessary diversity by moving around the typefaces in different combinations. The world will generate 160 zettabytes of data in 2025. That’s more bytes than there are stars in the observable universe. Conventional storage media like flash-drives and hard-drives do not have the longevity, data density, or cost efficiency to meet the global demand. DNA is the digital storage medium selected by nature that has been perfected over 3 billion years of evolution. It can store millions of times more data in the same volume as conventional solutions, can last for thousands of years, and gives you the ability to physically own your data – even massive amounts of it.

description: Online scams have increased by 1800% in the last five years primarily due to easy access to four billion users on social media (Source: US FTC).
