name: KAPITALE Edit
elevator_pitch: Kapitale is a fintech that helps retailers leverage their accounts receivable to purchase goods from suppliers. We are the perfect solution for retailers that sell to consumers in installments (Buy Now, Pay Later) but must pay suppliers before receiving full payment from customers. Our solution eliminates this cash flow gap by allowing retailers to purchase inventory using their accounts receivable—without additional costs—reducing friction and avoiding expensive working capital financing.
description: Brazil has 1.4 million establishments in the cosmetics sector, and the market continues to grow rapidly: 700 new businesses open every day. However, there is a major challenge for these entrepreneurs: the mismatch between payment and receivable terms. Small retailers need to pay their suppliers upfront or within 7 to 60 days, while their customers pay in installments using credit cards. According to Experian, 7 out of 10 consumers in Brazil choose to pay in installments, creating a cash flow gap that hinders the growth of these stores. Without Kapitale, retailers have only two options: (1) Rely on expensive receivables anticipation or working capital lines, which can cut 2% to 4% from their already tight margins. or; (2) Reduce inventory, missing sales opportunities and limiting business growth. Kapitale solves this problem. Our solution allows retailers to use their own credit card receivables as a direct payment method for suppliers, eliminating the need for early settlement and margin loss. This way, they can secure inventory, boost sales, and scale their business without straining cash flow.
technology_description: Kapitale is revolutionizing payments in the cosmetics retail sector with a smart payment gateway that allows manufacturers and distributors to accept credit card receivables as payment for inventory. How it works? (1) Suppliers send payment requests via Kapitale’s platform or WhatsApp bot. (2) Retailers pay with receivables in just two clicks. (3) At zero cost to retailers, they instantly gain 2% to 4% in margin by avoiding early payment fees. Plus, Kapitale offers up to 1% cashback for repeat purchases, driving loyalty and recurring orders.
mit_connection: MIT alumni as founder | Anderson Pereira is cofounder and CEO at Kapitale. He holds a Master in Management of Technology from MIT Sloan School of Business from the Sloan Fellows Program class of 2023.
contact: andi@kapitale.com.br, startupexchange-admin@mit.edu, startupexchange@mit.edu

name: KEYTANGO Edit
elevator_pitch: keyTango’s secure Multiparty Computation (sMPC) wallets are safer than the current best-in-class (cold wallets stored in banks) and x100 faster (trades take place in minutes vs. hours/days). Our wallets leverage sMPC technology to enable multisig-like functionality for any blockchain. We provide these wallets to professional crypto funds (B2B): prop shops, hedge funds, etc. Our team is comprised of seasoned entrepreneurs and experts in the field, alumni of MIT, Ycombinator and IDF’s elite cyber
description: keyTango offers a unique combination of swift and highly secured wallets for institutional crypto funds. Our wallets can sign transactions within minutes (order of magnitude better than cold wallets that requires hours or days). keyTango leverages sMPC technology for institutional crypto wallets. In technical lingue, we provide a threshold cryptography signing mechanism. Which means we split the wallet’s private key between two (or more) parties who are then both required in order to sign a transaction. Therefore a rogue employee can no longer make a transaction without a second employee approval. Externally, an attacker would need to compromise multiple devices at once. In contrast to multi-sig, this solution is chain-agnostic and can support any signing algorithm (e.g., ECDSA, Schnorr).
mit_connection: MIT alumni as founder | Dan Danay (MBA 15), Guy Zyskind (MS, Media Lab 16)

name: KINNAMI SOFTWARE CORPORATION Edit
elevator_pitch: At Kinnami, we provide resilient hybrid data fabric for edge devices (satellites, drones, etc.) and the Cloud. Our distributed data management software securely collects, processes, stores, and shares data delivering a holistic solution for extending the capabilities of MDO platforms and supporting real-time data exchange. This provides assured, resilient, low-latency data to the military through client-side encryption and data movement while assuming all devices are hostile, and networks are unreliable. The platform fragments, encrypts and transmits data by automated policy between devices. Current active military use-cases include data connectivity across Battlespace domains, digital engineering, sensor-based autonomous data collection, Multi-Level Security, and PNT/data transfers in GPS denied environments.
description: Kinnami provides a distributed peer-to-peer data management and security solution that enables data protection, security and availability to be dealt with holistically. Our automated policy engine securely stores encrypted fragments of data and regulates their access across distributed networks of devices. What this enables us to do is dramatically improve security but also improve redundancy and performance which is absolutely fundamental to any distributed network. With our technology you can now secure data with confidence on any storage device even if it has less security than a data center. The ability to store data securely in a distributed way and move it across unreliable trust-less networks is compelling to the defense sector as well as Satcoms, financial services, and others. The technology is based on over 10 years of research on how to protect distributed data and enable resiliency for data at the computing edge.
technology_description: Kinnami’s distributed, resilient data management platform, AmiShare protects information on any storage device or platform, such as datacenters, cloud, sensors, Unmanned Aerial Vehicles, & satellites. AmiShare, installed on ad-hoc or mesh networks of devices, establishes a hybrid data fabric, on which data can be stored, moved, and accessed securely. When data is added into AmiShare, it is split into smaller uniquely encrypted fragments. These encrypted fragments are prioritized and scheduled for transmission across the data fabric to storage devices by a dynamic policy engine whose policies are defined by administrators up-front so it can operate automatically. Fragments are stored in multiple locations and move throughout the data fabric as the environment changes. AmiShare’s auditing system tracks end-user operations at access points & storage locations as well as administrator operations. Removable discs allow secure data movement across air-gapped networks, extending the hybrid data fabric to include isolated devices and networks.

name: KIVERDI, INC. (FORMERLY AIR PROTEIN) Edit
elevator_pitch: Instead of a huge field of cows contributing to global warming with their burps, Air Protein uses CO2 to feed microorganisms, which then produce a protein that can be made into a meat alternative.
description: By 2050 we are expected to reach 10 billion people, resulting in a 70% increase in the demand for food production. Current food production accounts for over 20% of greenhouse gases, more than all of transportation combined, and uses over 37% of the planet’s land mass – the amount of land equivalent to the size of both Africa and South America! We developed Air Protein as a way to make meat without requiring the taxing inputs and added arable land necessary to feed more people.
technology_description: The company calls its technology a probiotic production process, similar to making yogurt. Inside a fermentor, naturally occurring microbes consume CO2 and a secret blend of “mineral nutrients” to produce an ingredient that is 80% protein. Unlike soy or other plant protein, it’s a “complete protein,” with the same amino acid profile as protein in beef or chicken. It also has vitamins such as B12 that aren’t typically found in vegan food. Unlike some animal protein, it doesn’t have any antibiotics and hormones. And the process runs on renewable energy.

name: KNOWLEDGE AI INC. Edit
description: Established in the fall of 2010 in Cambridge, MA, NuVu is an award winning full-time innovation studio for high school students. NuVu’s pedagogy is based on the architectural studio model and geared around multi-disciplinary, collaborative projects. NuVu provides students the opportunity to work collaboratively with academic and professional experts (PhDs/alumni from MIT and Harvard as well as leading professionals) to solve real-world problems. NuVu nurtures creative problem solving, team collaboration across networks, oral and presentation skills, technological proficiency, systems thinking, adaptability, risk-taking and imagination; All critical for student success in the 21st century. NuVu’s pedagogy is informed by the architectural design Studio where a coach guides students in hands-on problem-solving to solve complex, comprehensive problems. The Studio model uses exercises to build skills and integrates students’ knowledge in a final project. Within each multidisciplinary Studio, students explore problems rigorously by focusing on one project for two weeks. A Studio Coach mentors students to develop their project through an iterative process over the course of the Studio. Students confront the small and large contexts within problems as they are exposed to complex, ‘messy’ situations. The NuVu Team continuously evaluates students through deskcrits and final reviews. Develop Real-World Solutions for the World -- Taught within the multidisciplinary framework of the design Studio rather than traditional subjects, NuVu students acquire a highly personalized understanding of the world and how they relate to it and can fully participate in it. They develop multiple solutions to problems and learn the importance of moving from one solution to the next, combining, exploring and thinking of the possibilities. They also learn how to change their perspective on an issue quickly. They learn that solutions depend on perspective, and only by understanding an issue from multiple perspectives can they fully explore the terrain of possibilities. Iterative Process, Constant Feedback -- The iterative process, or process of refining an idea, product or solution, in the design studio is intended to provide students with continual feedback from NuVu Coaches and Staff on performance as well as product. NuVu students also experience working in an intense, feedback-rich environment that provides them with information and support for continuous self-evaluation, reflection, and improvement. Learn in New Ways -- NuVu challenges students to learn in new ways: analytical thinkers are inspired to explore their creative selves, while creative students expand their capacity to think and learn analytically. NuVu capitalizes on the immense resources of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and Harvard University to focus on hands-on problem solving, encourage an inventive culture, promote peer teaching and learning, and cultivate students’ curiosity. Portfolio-Based Assessment -- Instead of grading, NuVu uses a portfolio-based assessment. A portfolio serves as a compilation of student work done at NuVu over the course of the term, semester or full year and is meant to show the student's growth over time and development of key academic and life skills (creativity, critical thinking, collaboration, communication, research, quantitative reasoning and analysis). Each NuVu student is provided with their own online profile on NuVu's online platform where they document and present their work. At frequent periods during the term, NuVu's team works with the student to assess how far the student has developed since the beginning of the term. The portfolio-based assessment helps make learning and assessment relevant to students' lives.

name: KNOWLEDGE MACHINE LLC Edit
elevator_pitch: We are a Biomining and more specifically myco-mining company. We harness the power of fungi to extract strategic materials such as rare elements and rare earths from a variety of sources including fly ash, mine tailings, and e-waste. We turn waste into valuable materials and also remediate environmental problems in the process. We work with leading global experts in the US and EU and have unique domain expertise.
description: Fungi have remarkable properties in terms of bioaccumulation of valuable materials such as Antimony, Gallium, the Rare Earth Elements, Copper, Nickel, Gold and Silver, among others. The myco-mining approach allows the use of very dilute source materials in a very energy - efficient process that does not involve the displacement of hundreds of tons of rock for every ton of useable ore. We can even use starting materials such as coal fly ash, mine tailings, acid mine drainage, and pollutants such as 'red mud' which is associated with aluminum production which all pose serious environmental challenges at present. Furthermore, when applied to e-waste and metals recovery, we offer a very environmentally friendly, low cost and low energy process as compared to existing technologies.
technology_description: Our technological advantage is threefold. First we have world-class expertise in different strains of fungi, how they can be altered to perform specific tasks, and the selectivity of various fungi for specific biomining / myco-mining operations. We have a member of the Polish Academy of Sciences on our team who has decades of experience in the biology of fungi and their industrial applications. Secondly, we have several patent-pending designs for processing equipment that will enable low cost, high bioaccumulation rate, high recovery rate, and low energy usage. These dual technological advantages will enable us to be very effective in this space in scaling the process at a global level. Lastly, through partnerships we have access to over 50 patents on environmentally friendly CO2-based extraction technologies which avoid the use of harsh solvents. This will enable us to also be very competitive on the metal extraction side, i.e. separating the biomass from the metals.

name: KOYA AI Edit
elevator_pitch: Koya is creating the universal API for product data in e-commerce. Koya takes in unstructured merchant data and delivers ML-powered canonicalized product catalogs via API, so ecommerce players can focus on optimizing their core business.
description: Managing product catalog data across the ecommerce value chain is critical yet complex. Crucial services such as product discovery, new merchant onboarding, and underwriting decisions… all directly depend on the underlying product data quality. This data not only varies widely across providers but also gets updated constantly. Today, most sellers and marketplaces attempt to manage that complexity manually; which is slow, inaccurate, and expensive. Ultimately, ecommerce brands, buyers, and sellers suffer, leading to lower conversion rates and churn. Koya solves that problem by managing all the complexity from different sources and delivering one structured data feed to our customers. They just need to indicate the data sources and the output format and Koya takes care of the ingestion, normalization, deduplication, and product matching. The final delivery is done via our platform or a direct call via API.
technology_description: Koya takes in unstructured merchant data and delivers ML-powered canonicalized product catalogs via API. In order to do that efficiently, we develop tools assisted by foundational models (the same used for LLMs such as GPT). These models are trained and fine-tuned to be the best at the most important parts of data preparation, including normalization, categorization, and product matching. Because we focus on e-commerce, our models are much better at these tasks than general-purpose models (GTP 3.5, LLaMA) Finally, our models are also improved on the job by data operators. We use an HLML (human-in-the-loop machine learning ) framework that incorporates few-shot learning and adapts to different datasets and use cases.

name: KYTOPEN CORPORATION Edit
elevator_pitch: Kytopen is pioneering a novel and non-viral process to engineer human cells for applications in immuno-oncology and genetic disorders. This process can deliver genetic information encoded in mRNA, DNA, and CRISPR to billions of cells per minute while maintaining their therapeutic potential. Kytopen enabled engineered cell products will deliver cost-effective cell therapies for patients around the world.
description: Kytopen is developing platforms to accelerate the discovery and manufacturing of next-generation cell & gene therapies. The Flowfect technology offers a scalable, non-viral solution to deliver genetic payloads to cells in order to augment their functionality. The technology also enables continuous flow genetic manipulation of cells in a platform that can be easily automated and can be used to process both small and large sample volumes. We are integrating our technology with automated liquid handling systems and developing a large volume platform for therapeutic applications. The non-viral Flowfect solution will reduce the cost and accelerate time to market for discovering and manufacturing next-generation cell & gene therapies.
technology_description: Kytopen enables transformative therapies with our patent-pending continuous Flowfect™ cell engineering platforms. The non-viral Flowfect™ technology is a fast, scalable, and gentle process that yields billions of high-quality engineered cells in minutes while maintaining cell health and function. The Flowfect™ technology combines continuous fluid flow with electric fields for high efficiency delivery of payloads such as mRNA, DNA, and CRISPR Cas9 RNP to primary cells. By carefully synchronizing the pulse delivery with the fluid flow we have eliminated the harmful effects of traditional transfection via static electroporation. Our ex vivo cell engineering platform is compatible with primary cells being developed for immuno-oncology and gene editing applications.

name: LABBY INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: Labby is a hardware + optical AI startup born out of MIT, developing real-time material (milk) sensing data for the dairy industry and providing fast, accurate, and affordable testing solutions for enhancing milk biosecurity, improving animal health and reducing greenhouse emissions.
description: When the whole world seems to transition into the instant delivery economy and mindset, the dairy industry still operates antiquatedly in its core dairy testing business. Centralized lab-based testing has complicated consequences in animal disease management, particularly mastitis. It is a very common yet costly disease that presents a global challenge of lost revenue, antibiotic overuse and food waste, with an estimated cost of $32B each year. The problem is that mastitis is hard to detect, and it spreads easily among the herd. Frequent and timely milk testing for individual cows is crucial to spot mastitis early on. However, the current centralized lab-based milk testing is labor-intensive, human error-prone, and has a long waiting period. Between the testing days, farmers have little information about new infections or if those cows with mastitis are improving or deteriorating.
technology_description: Labby has developed Milkey: a cow-side milk testing device coupled with an AI and software service, as shown in Fig. 1. It includes 3 modules: an optical milk analyzer with embedded machine learning, a data portal with customized data visualization for herd health and milk quality management, and veterinary care for best practices and recommendations by our animal care partners. The company’s competitive advantage lies in its ability to use its tech stack (choice of spectrophotometers) to enable cost-effective materials and allow broadband applications, optical techniques to examine light interactions on nano, microscopic and molecular levels, and its algorithm engine to enhance the optical data quality and discover previous unknown biomarkers. Additionally, our solution is non-invasive and reagent-free. In comparison, most technologies use reagents to tag cells and detect fluorescence using a flow cytometer arrangement. Others use direct microscope counting methods. None of these can be done on farms in an economical, sustainable, and scalable manner. Effective calibration is another competitive advantage against some of our instrumental competitors. Our calibration can be consulted online with the ease of a one-click button.

Our innovative cloud-based image analysis from drone platforms solves these auditing problems by comprehensively informing retrofitting design decisions.

name: LAYERBIO, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: LayerBio is commercializing drug delivery solutions in ophthalmology, wound care, and orthopedics. The technology enables localized controlled and sustained release of therapeutics (small molecules, nucleic acids, biologics) over minutes to months all the while maintaining the integrity of the drugs. We work with partners to enable or enhance therapies within their drug development pipelines with the goal of long-term, joint value creation.
description: LayerBio's technology platform, LayerForm™, is based on a layer-by-layer (LbL) fabrication technique that stably incorporates drugs (small molecule, protein, and nucleic acid therapeutics) from water into an ultrathin polymer film atop a biomedical surface (anything from a dressing to a prosthetic device to nanoparticles). The polymer film gradually degrades under physiologic conditions delivering drugs to target tissue with the desired dose and timing. Benefits include: (i) precise control of drug dosing and release, (ii) effective transfection of nucleic acids, (iii) fully biodegradable materials, (iv) modular platform capable of combination therapies with staged release profiles, (v) readily scalable for manufacturing. We strive to work with partners to enable or enhance therapies within their drug development pipelines with the goal of long-term, joint value creation.

Leela Platform can capture best practices for use in training, as well as identify safety, PPE, and ergonomic hazards and inform staffing and robotics deployment planning. Features include graphical visualizations, privacy controls, and API extensions.

name: LELANTOS Edit
elevator_pitch: Lelantos is revolutionizing gas sensing for high value IoT applications in environmental and air quality monitoring, medical diagnosis, threat detection, food storage, waste management and agriculture markets. Our technology offers unparalleled combination of high detection performance, compact size, low power consumption and price, unmatched by competing systems - a true chemical sensor for the Internet of Things.
description: Currently available gas detection technologies suffer from a combination of high-power consumption and production cost, limited selectivity as well as robustness, reliability and accuracy issues. Our system exploits the unique properties of piezoelectric materials that can be grown to thin layers for high frequency operation. Our IP covers methods of directly integrating bulk acoustic wave devices on CMOS ICs, drastically reducing the power requirements and device size. The approach enables the construction of an array of devices that allow for real-time calibration against environmental effects as well as selective, multi-gas detection and identification capabilities. As such, we alleviate the most important issues present in conventional systems, providing a device with 1000x smaller size, lower power consumption and lower cost while maintaining high detection accuracy.
technology_description: The core, patented technology is based on high-frequency thin-film bulk acoustic resonator (FBAR) devices co-integrated with silicon (CMOS) circuitry. The use of these high performance resonators allows for the fabrication of a sensitive sensor capable of detecting small changes in the surface adsorbed mass. When co-integrated with selective receptors these devices allow for an accurate, selective, compact, low-power gas sensing system. Specifically, the IP covers methods of directly integrating bulk acoustic wave devices on CMOS ICs, reducing parasitic elements that add noise and increase the power requirements. This approach also offers the cost scaling and manufacturing efficiency of a full wafer-scale process for vapor sensing applications. The small size allows for the construction of a device array where a reference sensor can be used as an environmental control for real-time calibration. It also allows for multiple receptors so as to achieve chemical fingerprinting capability.

name: LENDICA CORP. Edit
elevator_pitch: Lendica is an embedded finance platform that changes how SMBs access capital. Today, SMBs seeking funding products must rely on inefficient non-bank lenders or expensive captive programs. Our software captures and standardizes SMB profiles (token) - which includes granular banking, accounting, and operations data - to promote instant funding decisions for merchants. We are on a mission to build critical infrastructure to improve market efficiency and empower SMBs to use their data for their bene
description: Lendica is a financial technology company focused on next generation lending. The Lendica Lens enables financial institutions to instantly gain insights into small businesses by analyzing financial and operational data and automating loan product offers. We dedicate ourselves to making lending simple, fast and humane. The world of small business lending is changing. Small businesses (“SMBs”), defined as entities generating between $1-50mm in annual revenue, have historically struggled with access to capital. Today, new pools of liquidity have become available through SaaS vendors that power SMBs. Amazon, Shopify and Square, armed with troves of data on their SMB customers, now issue more small business debt capital than the top five banks combined. Financial institutions have been slower to adopt this data driven approach. Lendica provides our financial institution clients with the tools to easily capture and assess critical, real-time data to compete in the digital lending era. We believe data is the ultimate form of collateral and the building blocks for creditworthiness. Our mission is to build cutting edge technology to eliminate the friction between SMBs and the traditional lending process.
technology_description: Lendica Lens’ underwriting engine is built to quantify a borrower’s ability and willingness to repay a loan. The Lens consumes live operational data from SaaS vendors such as ERPs, POSs, Accounting and eCommerce along with transaction data from bank statements to analyze and assess the creditworthiness of an SMB. The underlying model is called the Sales Expected Default Frequency (“SEDF”) model. Based on Robert Merten’s Expected Default Frequency model, the SEDF model replaces Merten’s enterprise value and equity volatility with projected three months cash sales and projected sales volatility, respectively. The SEDF score is mapped on a distribution to determine the probability of delay of payback on the loan. The higher the score, the lower the probability of delay. The probability of delay is used to calculate the appropriate rate and size of the loan.

name: LEUKO LABS Edit
elevator_pitch: PointCheck, the first non-invasive white blood cell test, enables frequent at-home monitoring to improve clinical outcomes and quality of life for cancer patients. Our initial market focuses on the 850,000 chemotherapy patients in the US which suffer 140,000 annual hospitalizations that could be prevented by our device. We have completed our proof-of-concept and validation clinical studies with >150 cancer patients and plan to complete our pivotal clinical trial for FDA approval.
description: The fight against cancer can be scary, stressful, and acutely dangerous. During chemotherapy, the immune system is temporarily killed, and if it doesn’t recover in time, severe infections can cause a more life-threatening risk than the cancer itself. Leuko is working to allow patients and their caregivers to monitor their immune system recovery in the home, through a revolutionary tabletop non-invasive, finger-based blood cell monitor, reducing the stress and risk of outpatient chemotherapy. White blood cells are also the key to detect acute infection. A simple test for these cells is sought throughout the resource poor regions of the world; especially where HIV-associated bacterial co-infection is endemic. This niche alone would account for approximately 40 million tests per year. There are approximately 4 billion people living in rural regions of our planet who currently have little or no access to testing for infection, which we've set out to provide. The project is completing its proof of principle phase and entering its clinical trials.
technology_description: Leuko is addressing this critical unmet need with PointCheckTM, the first noninvasive device that can measure neutrophil levels without a blood sample. PointCheck performs this test in 1 minute by using proprietary portable optics and AI algorithms that collect and analyze videos of the blood flow from superficial capillaries through the finger’s skin. Because no blood is required, PointCheck enables, for the first time, frequent assessments at home, flagging critically-low cases to the care team so that early treatment (e.g. growth factors, prophylactic antibiotics) can be delivered. Based on prior studies, 50% of current FN-related hospitalizations ($3.2B/year and ~5,000 lives) could be saved if critically-low patients were flagged early with PointCheck and treated before they develop febrile neutropenia.

Exclusive license of the IP from MIT TLO.

name: LINELAB Edit
elevator_pitch: LineLab is a powerful software platform that helps manufacturers and engineers model, analyze, and optimize complex production systems. Unlike traditional spreadsheet-based approaches, LineLab leverages multi-variable mathematical optimization to provide precise insights into system dynamics, bottlenecks, and cost drivers. Our technology enables companies to quickly assess the impact of new investments, scale-up scenarios, and operational improvements, leading to up to 30% cost savings or sig
description: Manufacturers face a fundamental challenge: how will their operations scale, and what will it cost? This problem is especially critical for companies transitioning from prototype to full-scale production—a phase where many fail to cross the "valley of death." Even with a successful prototype, scaling up often introduces unexpected bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and cost overruns that can jeopardize the entire venture. While much attention is given to the “zero to one” challenge of developing new technologies, the real economic impact lies in the “one to one thousand” problem—scaling production efficiently and cost-effectively. The earlier companies can understand their system’s constraints, costs, and trade-offs, the greater the positive impact on their bottom line and time to market. LineLab enables manufacturers to predict dynamic behavior, identify risks, and optimize investment decisions before committing capital, ensuring smoother scale-up and long-term operational success.
technology_description: LineLab uses novel mathematical formulations to solve one of the most complex problems in manufacturing: how to design a system that scales efficiently. Traditional tools—spreadsheets, heuristics, and even advanced simulations—struggle with this challenge because they only validate a given design rather than prescribe the best one. Our technology flips this approach from right to left, meaning we start with the desired production outcome and mathematically determine the optimal system configuration to achieve it. This method provides orders-of-magnitude improvements over traditional approaches by solving for thousands of variables simultaneously, considering constraints, trade-offs, and uncertainty in a single model. Unlike discrete event simulation (DES), which relies on trial-and-error, LineLab’s multi-variable mathematical optimization rapidly converges on the best possible solution, ensuring faster, more reliable, and cost-effective scale-up decisions. This fundamentally changes how companies plan production, enabling them to scale with confidence.
mit_connection: MIT alumni as founder | Co-founders are Scott Nill (Course 2 SM '12 & PhD '18, Sloan Postdoc 2018-19) and Larissa (Nill) Nietner (Course 2 SM '12 & PhD '17, Postdoc MechE 2018, Postdoc Sloan 2019). LineLab is based on a Boeing-sponsored MIT research project 2015-2019 led by Scott Nill and overseen by professors (emeritus) Warren Hoburg (NASA astronaut since 2016) and Steven Graves. The co-founders continue to publish original research as MIT affiliates.

name: LITHIOS INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: Lithios aims to revolutionize global lithium production by enabling access to untapped, low-grade brine resources using an environmentally friendly, low-cost electrochemical process called Advanced Lithium Extraction (ALE). The Lithios ALE system consists of a layered stack of membranes, electrodes, current collectors, and flow channels, where it continuously performs selective electrosorption (or electroextraction) of lithium ions from a feed solution and electrodesorption (or electrorelease) into a recovery solution. Ion exchange membranes are used to enhance selectivity, control the transport of ions, and—like neurons in the brain—generate voltages from salinity differences between the feed and recovery solutions. Compared to the best competitor Direct Lithium Extraction (DLE) technologies, Lithios ALE replaces harsh chemical reagents with renewable, programmable electrons, thereby reducing environmental hazards, carbon footprint, and costs (both CAPEX and OPEX) by up to 30%. Lithios ALE seeks to open vast new lithium resources in the US and around the world, including magnesium-rich and geothermal brines, spent batteries, and ultimately seawater, the planet’s largest and most equitable lithium resource.
description: We are developing a new technology for ALE from tough brines using electrochemistry. The technology enables selective and economical lithium capture from previously untapped resources.
technology_description: In contrast to traditional processes or competing Direct Lithium Extraction methods, the Lithios ALE technology can produce lithium from untapped brines and resources, which contain comparatively high concentrations of sodium, calcium, magnesium, and other competing ions. Unlike DLE technologies based on adsorption, ion exchange, or solvent extraction, the ALE electroswing technology uses only electricity and eliminates the need for excess freshwater or harsh chemicals and solvents. Moreover, the ALE technology is unique in its ability to operate as a galvanic cell that generates electricity by “reverse electrodialysis,” which can be used to drive the process. Based on these features as well as our technoeconomic modeling, the significant upfront cost reductions in materials, reagents, and operating requirements should translate into very favorable project economics at scale.

name: LUMENASTRA INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: We are commercializing patents from the Univ of Colorado for a non-invasive, wearable sensor measuring deep tissue (core body) temperature several cm below the skin, wherever placed. When placed on the forehead, we directly measure brain temperature in real time. Beachhead application is brain temperature during deep cooling required for aortic surgery. We can reduce time-at-cold and surgical time by 15 minutes saving 20% of the patients that die during this surgery. Future applications include: early warning of heat stress (military, athletes, first responders), tumor hyperthermia co-therapy, circadian conditions e.g. fertility windows, and novel approach to consumer thermometry. We have raised $3.2M in non-dilutive funding from NSF, USARMY, and State of Colorado.
description: Upper aortic dissection surgery is among the most dangerous surgeries with a 17% mortality rate and 60% of patients suffering cognitive loss. The brain must be deep cooled to allow time for circulatory arrest during the repair. Today, nasal and bladder catheter temperature sensors are used as surrogates for brain temperature. With our novel, non-invasive wearable, we directly measure brain temperature in real-time cutting 15 minutes off the time-at-cold and surgical time, which will reduce mortality by 20%. The military is interested in a wireless wearable directly measuring core temperature to provide early warning of heat stress which claims thousands of casualties and numerous deaths per year.
technology_description: Our sensor exploits black body radiation: sensing very low level microwaves generated inside the body proportional to temperature. Effectively, we are a near-field form of a radio telescope. Our patent covers impedance matching to the tissue stack under our sensor and temperature calibration. Prior technologists and companies have attempted this, but failed to understand the near-field issues which we have solved. Our solution is challenged by the small internally generated signals (femto-watts) in the presence of larger signal interference from cell phones, GPS, bluetooth, WiFi and surgical instrumentation.

name: LYDIAN Edit
elevator_pitch: Lydian is pioneering novel technology that uses captured CO2, water, and renewable electricity to produce a sustainable, drop-in alternative to today’s fossil-based jet fuel that reduces lifecycle emissions by up to 95%. Uniquely built for cost, scale and the modern grid, Lydian's modular technology delivers superior energy efficiency and operates intermittently, solving for the greatest challenge e-fuels face - their significant electricity demand. Within four years of the company's founding,
description: If SAF isn’t scaled quickly, aviation could account for 20% of global emissions. The biofuels we have today are not scalable enough. e-SAF has the greatest opportunity to enable net zero operations, but early projects have been far too costly, take too long to construct, and are limited to running on continuous power or stored hydrogen, both of which add significant cost and complexity. Lydian is redefining this category by proving that e-SAF can be cost competitive with biofuels in the near future and can scale much faster without feedstock concerns, to ultimately decarbonize aviation and enhance energy resilience. Lydian is uniquely approaching e-fuels as both a chemical process and a power systems asset. We are the only player that has designed a fully-integrated plant solution for the unique challenges of e-fuels, namely the need for rapid deployment, cost-effectiveness at smaller scales, and the ability to operate the entire plant in an intermittent fashion to take advantage of the very cheap electricity input needed for cost-effective SAF, which is not available around the clock.
technology_description: We’ve developed breakthrough modular CO2-to-fuels technology to create the lowest cost e-fuels on the market. Our proprietary syngas catalyst and reactors (syngas and FT) enable 50-70% lower cost e-fuel plants which are the first purpose-built to follow intermittent renewables. How our CO2-to-SAF technology works: We take water, CO2, and renewable electricity and convert those inputs into a synthetic crude oil that is further processed into fuels and chemicals. Our process innovates on two well-understood steps: the reduction of CO2 via the reverse water-gas shift (RWGS) reaction to produce syngas and the hydrogenation of carbon oxides via Fischer-Tropsch (FT) synthesis into hydrocarbons. Lydian has designed its proprietary RWGS and FT units with a focus on minimizing cost through process intensity and modularity while maximizing energy efficiency, single-pass yield, and flexibility (i.e. turndown), all of which are uniquely enabled by the breakthrough performance of Lydian’s proprietary catalysts and reactors.

name: MACROCYCLE TECHNOLOGIES Edit
elevator_pitch: MacroCycle is commercializing a patented technology that will enable circular plastics with zero carbon emissions. Through an innovate chemistry-based approach, we can take lower value PET plastic waste and upcycle it to virgin-grade quality with 90% less energy consumption. The remaining 10% can then be electrified with renewable energy to achieve recycling with zero-carbon emissions. Due to the simplicity of this technology, MacroCycle can produce this high-quality pellets at a much lower cost
description: Plastics are useful materials, but they are also associated with significant environmental toxicity and climate change. About 8 million tons of plastic per year leak into rivers and oceans. Production of plastics released >850 million tonnes of CO2 into the atmosphere in 2019, representing now roughly 4.5% of the global CO2 output. Plastic recycling can reduce the environmental impact and carbon footprint of plastics production. However, our existing scheme of recycling relies on Mechanical Recycling, which is an inherent “downcycling” into lower quality products given the degrading impact and inability to re-establish the original polymer. Molecular recycling, also termed advanced or chemical recycling, has the potential to enable fully circular plastics. However, these processes break every functional bond along the polymer, for example ester bonds in PET, which then require extensive separation and re-polymerization, leading to high energy demand and limited climate benefit. Big plastic using brands therefore either struggle to find recycled plastic on the market, or have to choose from the few upcoming chemical recyclers that cannot offer a significant carbon footprint reduction. The plastics crisis is a critical matter to resolve as we combat climate change and mitigate future generation’s exposure to everlasting microplastics. This requires not only consumer change and regulation, but especially profitable technologies to create truly circular plastics economy.
technology_description: Our patented process technology, which exploits thermodynamics and catalysis, can upcycle a variety of plastic wastes into high quality “bottle-grade” plastic, with much lower energy demand and carbon footprint. We achieve recovery of intermediate species from plastic waste (PET bottle flakes, polyester textiles and other functional polymers) followed by re-polymerization of these intermediates to produce high quality plastics with a much simpler and more efficient process, while removing color and other impurities with a single solvent. Therefore we can dramatically reduce the energy demand and carbon footprint of our upcycled plastic by 70-80% compared to conventional PET production and other advanced recycling technologies, with the potential to be fully decarbonized given that all unit operations and temperatures required are electrifiable. Our upcycled PET has been tested for commercially relevant material properties. This output material will satisfy a broad range of customers in the plastic packaging market place and help them decarbonize while fulfilling their circularity pledges.

name: MAGMA SPACE Edit
elevator_pitch: Magma Space is developing cutting-edge satellite subsystems for unprecedented performance in pointing control and power management, benefiting space communication, remote imaging, smallsat proliferation, and more. Magma’s core breakthrough is a low-power magnetic bearing that brings incredibly stable and efficient operation to satellite mechanisms. Specifically designed for control systems, Magma reduces on-board vibrations 95% to illuminate fine details in images and overcome pointing challenges in laser communication. In addition, the technology opens new flywheel energy storage capabilities that can be built into existing control hardware, expanding benefits to high-power payloads including radar-based imaging and directed energy. Magma has received grants from NASA and the National Science Foundation, and has Letters of Intent including the US Space Force, MAXAR, D-Orbit and the Air Force Research Lab.
description: Magma Space is solving four satellite performance bottlenecks. First, laser communication is 200x faster than radio and is needed to meet the 14x increase in data transmitted to and from space over the next decade. However, unprecedented pointing accuracy is required for its 10,000 narrower signal. Today, laser communication is only run at a fraction of its potential. Second, remote observation is transitioning towards hyperspectral and very-high-resolution imaging, which are highly susceptible to vibrations that blur images and limit mission usefulness. Third, control systems are a primary cause of premature system failure when ball bearings within reaction wheels (which maneuver and point the spacecraft) degrade over time until complete blockage. Fourth, current Li-ion batteries are highly inefficient and struggle to supply high-power radar-imaging and directed energy, leading to burdensome charging cycles and oversized satellites.
technology_description: Magma Space has developed a new magnetic-bearing reaction wheel for satellites. Three to four reaction wheels are virtually every satellite and are used for maneuvering and pointing. At a high level, the wheel spins one way and the satellite spins the other way. While these wheels are used for positioning, they’re a primary emitter of vibrations due to ball bearings. Magma’s technology is a magnetically levitated flywheel that eliminates ball bearings with a frictionless mechanism. Prior attempts at magnetic bearings for satellites have required full five-axis active control; however, Magma’s design requires only a single active control degree-of-freedom, leading to low-power operation and high reliability.

name: MAGNOLIA ELECTRONICS INCORPORATED Edit
elevator_pitch: Magnolia has novel techniques, and circuit designs, to parallelize the sampling of analog signals into digital signals. Our techniques sidestep the constraints of the Shannon-Nyquist sampling relationship and allows us to open new possibilities for high-speed, low power, and relaxed-tolerance ADCs. We have built and tested prototypes that demonstrate the techniques work, and achieved a 100x increase in effective sample rate at no loss of resolution.
description: Analog to digital signal conversion occurs everywhere we move between physical phenomena and the abstract realm of digital logic. Denser data streams require wider signal bandwidths, and ever faster sampling devices are needed to process those streams. As serial sampling devices run faster, they take more power, sacrifice resolution, and require more precise engineering and manufacturing. The ADC process is ubiquitous, but our technique is particularly relevant to devices that contain sensors and communication components limited by speed, cost, and power availability. Devices in industries including telecommunications, radar, satellites, and medical imaging are likely market candidates.
technology_description: Our control circuits allow simple, cheap ADC samplers to coordinate their operations with very little overhead. Our techniques: Tolerate manufacturing imprecision - unlike conventional high speed ADC chips Avoid synchronization challenges - unlike Time-Interleaved Sampling Handle arbitrary signal domains without pre-configuration - unlike Compressed Sensing or other sub-Nyquist approaches

name: MANTEL Edit
elevator_pitch: Mantel is developing the first molten-salt based carbon capture technology. Our molten borates are designed to operate at the high temperatures found inside boilers, kilns, and furnaces – enabling highly efficient carbon capture that has not been possible until now. Our technology can be applied across industry to reduce emissions - and even achieve net-negative emissions. By solving for efficiency Mantel can reduce energy losses by more than 60%, unlocking carbon capture’s role in reaching global net-zero emissions.
description: We are building a platform of carbon capture solutions to tackle emissions across industry. Our technology can be applied to hard-to-abate industries such as industrial heat, cement, steel, and hydrogen production, or in hard-to-abate geographies where coal, oil, and natural gas, are likely to remain prevalent fuels for decades. We can also support carbon removal from the atmosphere. By adding our system to biogenic sources of carbon dioxide net-negative emissions can be achieved in sectors such as pulp and paper, waste-to-energy, and bioenergy.
technology_description: The majority of existing materials for carbon capture are inherently limited by the efficiency penalty associated with low temperature operations. There is a thermodynamic benefit to carrying out a separation process at high temperatures (600C) and addressing the thermodynamics is the only way to significantly decrease the cost of carbon capture. Existing materials that operate at high temperatures are solids, and they face significant challenges related to performance degradation. At Mantel we are developing the first high temperature liquid phase materials - molten borates - which overcome these limitations and drive down the cost of carbon capture.

name: MANUS ROBOTICS Edit
elevator_pitch: More than 200 million people around the globe are currently living with limb loss or impairment and must struggle every day to feed, dress, or clean up after themselves. Most of these people depend on family or staff at skilled nursing facilities to carry out activities of daily living; but this is not an ideal situation considering the loss of dignity and independence, let alone the tremendous economic burden posed by long-term, in-person care. Assistive and smart home devices designed to im
description: Manus Robotics, Inc., located in Lexington, Massachusetts, was formed in 2016 to develop affordable, wearable sensors and robots that can improve the quality of life for the disabled, the elderly, and everyone in between. Co-founded by world-renowned roboticist Dr. Harry H. Asada and his Ph.D. students, Manus strives to change the paradigm of daily living assistance and in-home rehabilitation, harnessing the power of robotics and machine learning to help people regain control of their lives. The company is currently fundraising to commercialize Hemyo, an innovative sensor for detecting gesture commands.
technology_description: Hemyo, developed by Manus Robotics, is a novel muscle activity sensor that could replace EMG as the input device to control assistive technologies. The multichannel sensor can be worn on the arm or leg to monitor the activity of multiple muscles at different depths based on blood flow oxygen delivery and consumption. Unlike EMG sensors that can only passively measure weak neural signals, Hemyo can actively control the incident light intensity and waveform to maximize signal-to-noise ratios, compensate for sensor misalignment or interference, and detect muscle contraction through clothing or thick subcutaneous tissue. Furthermore, the patent-pending gesture detection algorithms can dynamically identify unique features in signal patterns and adaptively correlate those to the user’s intended commands, making it an effective means to interact with various devices without requiring extensive training. Users can intuitively and reliably use Hemyo to control smart home devices, assistive technologies, and even AR/VR, achieving a higher level of independence and productivity.

name: MEALMATE INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: MealMate Inc. provides an AI-based personal digital assistant to health and wellness companies, guiding their customers on the path to healthy eating. We have developed spoken language understanding technology that allows users (e.g., obesity patients) to more easily track the food they eat, simply by speaking naturally, as if to a friend or nutritionist. A study in the American Journal of Preventive Medicine showed keeping daily food journals doubled the amount of weight loss. However, exis
description: Founded in 2012, Akselos designs digital twins of the world’s most complex systems. Their next-generation simulation technology helps guard critical infrastructure by creating a virtual replica of an asset in its current environment, right down to the smallest detail, allowing operators to monitor a system’s condition in real-time, as well as predict what will happen in the future. Akselos has developed into a well-established company and continues to grow internationally, working with clients across industries, including off-shore structural engineering, mining, and port infrastructure, to help protect and maintain the large-scale assets that are so central to our lives.
technology_description: We have developed a novel deep learning method for spoken diet tracking, where people easily describe what they ate in natural spoken language. We designed a convolutional neural network (CNN) model that learns semantic vector representations of the user’s unstructured natural language meal description, and maps it to the best matches in the structured USDA food database. We demonstrated that our CNN 1) parses a meal description into foods and quantities, and 2) maps the user’s food description to USDA foods using its learned vector embedding. We also demonstrated that deep reinforcement learning asks more intuitive followup questions about food attributes than entropy or rules. We are currently building a computer vision system for users to log their meals with photos, or photos and language.

name: MEDIKANA Edit
elevator_pitch: Medikana is a platform that simplifies and automates medtech commercialization. We connect US manufacturers to LatAm distributors and, like a TurboTax for medtech sales, walk them through all steps of the sales process including regulatory, training, logistics, etc. We provide manufacturers growth opportunities while increasing access to medtech in LatAm.
description: The LatAm healthcare system is very complex. Increases in chronic diseases and an aging population have led to an increased need for high-quality medtech. Because local production can’t meet demands, around 85% of medical technologies in the region are imported. LatAm laws require local companies to import medtech products, so US manufacturers typically have to partner with distributors to avoid opening offices in each market. Local distributors are constantly searching for innovative technologies to remain competitive and improve health outcomes within their local markets. Even though this presents US-based manufacturers with great opportunities, the process of exporting devices is currently labor intensive, time-consuming and manual. The distribution processes in this region is complex, has country-to-country fragmented regulatory landscapes and contrasting culture and language. All these factors result in manufacturer's getting a low ROI. Tens of expert interviews and our years of experience confirm that these barriers scare manufacturers from devices to this region. Sadly, this leads to lack of access to innovative healthtech for millions of patients in LatAm and poor healthcare outcomes in many countries.
technology_description: Medikana is a platform that automates and simplifies medical device commercialization internationally. Our product is a one-stop-shop for medical device sales including features to match distributors and manufacturers, plan and prepare regulatory registrations, assign and maintain training records, and manage orders and accounts. Medikana automates the entire contracting and regulatory submission process, and like a TurboTax for medtech sales, reduces the amount of overhead time needed in document preparation. For US manufacturers, it makes the process faster, more profitable, and transparent. For LatAm, it will provide distributors with novel products for their portfolio while increasing access to life-saving tech for patients in the region. Our vision is to unlock global access to medical innovation. As the process for selling internationally is the same for most markets, medikana can eventually reach dozens of global markets as we democratize medical device distribution and increase access to medtech for patients all over the world.

keywords: medtech, go-to-market, commercialization

name: MEDISIGHT, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: Optical sensor for real-time tissue identification at the tip of medical procedure needles
description: Medisight's innovative tools empower doctors and patients by improving medical insight and accuracy. In the U.S., there are more than 40 million medical procedures with blind or semi-blind needle and instrument insertion into tissues. Complications from these procedures can be serious and are commonly a result of needle tip misplacement. Medisight has developed an optical sensor that uses multi-modal spectroscopy (MMS) to identify tissues and organs near the tip of procedural needles and instruments in order to increase accuracy and decrease complication rates. MMS is a combination of Raman spectroscopy (RS), diffuse reflectance spectroscopy (DRS), and intrinsic fluorescence spectroscopy (IFS). This technology has previously been shown to aid with the diagnosis of breast, colon, prostate, oral, skin, and cervical cancers as well as atherosclerosis. Researchers Medisight to continue developing the technology, which they believe could also be applied to medical procedures, such as cancer biopsies or injecting drugs into the joints, which can be difficult to do accurately. This commercialization effort is supported by MIT entrepreneurship programs, including the MIT Translational Fellows Program, MIT Venture Mentoring Service, and MIT Innovation Initiative. The team also received support from the National Science Foundation in the form of a Small Business Technology Transfer program grant.

name: MESPAC Edit
elevator_pitch: To install and operate an offshore wind farm, developers need accurate metocean and environmental data. Today accurate data can be collected only via an in-situ metocean campaign with expensive equipment. But mostly, they can last up to 4 years because of bureaucracy, data inconsistencies and gaps and processing time. Offshore wind auctions timelines do not allow a complete in-situ survey. MESPAC is a cloud-based service that uses SatEO data, in-situ data and advanced AI to provide metocean and environmental surveys for offshore wind developers. The quality is equivalent to in-situ surveys, but the duration is reduced by at least 50%. In fact, by speeding up the process of installation by just 1 year is equivalent to $250M+ worth of wind energy generated revenues. Through our platform and API, we intend to serve our clients throughout the entire lifecycle of their offshore projects.
description: To collect accurate and reliable data of wind, waves and other offshore metocean and environmental information there are 3 main issues: 1) It takes a lot of time (even 3-to-4 years) to get accurate data with in-situ instrumentation installed offshore 2) The data streams coming from instruments like FLIDAR or wavemeter always present inconsistency and gaps 3) Average offshore wind farms span more than 400 sqkm, but data is collected in only 1 or 2 points inside this vast marine area. Today our clients can use one of three type of services: a) Surveying companies: collect data with instrumentation on site. Whilst the data can be accurate, it generally takes 3-to-4 years to complete a survey. For auctions, you don’t have that time available. b) Historical databases: provide access to databases of historical datasets. But the space definition is low, as data is generally provided on 50km x 50km grids c) Modelling techniques: phisically model the wind and or other metocean variables propagation. Tend to underestimate extreme and hazard events and need local customisation, thus are not scalable
technology_description: Our solution combines Satellite Earth Observation data with in-situ measurements. We feed them into proprietary probabilistic supervised AI algorithms that are trained and validated to reach the same level of accuracy of in-situ surveys. Our patent pending process has no dead times and insists on various levels of parallelization and automation. MESPAC can save 50% of the time of traditional metocean surveys. Our platform approach enables us to look at some potential competitors, like surveying companies, more as potential partners rather than competitors. We will provide an easy access to our MESPAC platform and will serve our customers with a Data & Analytics As A Service subscription model. Using our platform or our APIs, our users will receive support throughout the entire lifecycle of their projects.
mit_connection: MIT alumni as founder | Andrea Gulisano, MBA 2013 Giuliana Mattiazzo, Visiting Scholar
contact: info@mespac.space, startupexchange-admin@mit.edu, startupexchange@mit.edu
keywords: SpaceTech downstreamMachine LearningOcean Energy

name: METANOVAS BIOTECH Edit
elevator_pitch: We use AI and knowledge graph to develop clinical-grade consumer health products. With proprietary data and algorithms, we focus on three areas: 1. understand complex human biology underlying consumer health needs; 2. design highly potent bioactive peptides and small molecules that address health concerns; 3. develop skincare products and dietary supplements that have clinical efficacy. We have forged commercial partnerships with public pharma companies and brands, both established and emerging.
description: Addressing the challenge of inefficacy and lack of uniqueness in consumer health products, we approach the issue scientifically. By comprehending intricate human biology, identifying powerful ingredients, and creating highly efficacious formulations, we offer indispensable solutions for health product companies. These firms seek our expertise for technical consultation, co-development, or acquisition of our offerings, which range from raw ingredients to complete formulations.
technology_description: We have developed four cornerstone platforms: 1. MetaNLP is our exclusive fine-grained NLP platform, transforming unstructured texts into structured data. It delves into extensive literature, patents, and supplier documents. 2. MetaKG, our expansive knowledge graph, interlinks vast biological entities. This engine uncovers hidden biological network relations and aids in formulating bioactive ingredients. 3. MetaOmics, our multi-omics analysis platform, examines genotype-phenotype relationships. It identifies distinctive genetic traits in specific populations to develop precise products. 4. MetaPep is our innovative peptide design platform, powered by deep learning and experimental feedback. It produces highly potent bioactive peptides to tackle various health issues.

name: METHENA, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: Introduction Methena, Inc. (https://methena.com/) is a newly formed U.S. based education platform company. It is founded by three co-founders, Paul Shih, Dr. June Huang, and Dr. Charles Hsu. Methena secured an exclusive partnership with IEG Global Corporation (https://ivyedugrp.org/), a U.S. based 501(c)(3) non-profit in early 2021, where Methena could sell all of IEG’s educational products. Our Methena® APP serves as a marketplace with a “experiential tutoring” services focus.
description: Company and Opportunity With a GPA of 2.76 and 2.58 from high school and university respectively, our CEO, Mr. Paul Shih, was able to get admitted into The Johns Hopkins University and Columbia University for his undergraduate and master’s degree. He is, therefore, a strong believer in enabling students to “find their passion”, and the importance of extracurricular activities. Methena focuses on three key product offerings: extracurricular activities, train the trainers, and tutoring services. Methena’s certified short-term top university programs (extracurricular activities), both online and offline, targets students from grades 3-12, university students, and young professionals. We also provide online and offline training for bilingual and international school teachers (train the trainers). We started with customers in Asia, and we plan to expand to the U.S., Europe, and Southeast Asia market with our APP launch. With our proprietary “experiential tutoring service” (tutoring services), students will not only score high on their AP, IB, or subject tests, but also receive firsthand information from the universities that they want to attend in the future. We plan to become “the Uber in global tutoring”. Industry and Market Analysis The global tutoring market will reach $173.4 billion by 2027, with $46.9 billion and $61.4 billion in the U.S. and China respectively. There are currently around 10 online tutoring companies averaging $50 million in annual sales. However, none of them have the ability to work directly with top universities in the U.S. to offer supplemental experiential learning programs, enabling students to develop their leadership, research, and communication skills at a younger age. For extracurricular activities, Methena continues to leave competitors behind with official programs at Harvard, Stanford, Columbia, Caltech, Berklee, and Brown. These residential and online programs offer certificates directly from each university, and faculty members’ recommendation letters are written on the university’s behalf, not on an individual basis. In addition, we also host the first ever Ivy League business school competition for high school students, the Model Entrepreneur® Competition. With U.S. universities shifting from the reliance on standardized testing, the role extracurricular activities play in the admission decision process will only continue to carry more weight. Our train the trainers program is the only program allowing teachers to be taught by Columbia, Harvard, MIT, Stanford, UC Berkeley, and Caltech faculty members. In addition, we bridge international teachers with local school educators to exchange best practices and address cultural challenges in teaching. All of the teachers will also receive a certification of completion from the host university each year. With over 800 university and professional tutors and counting, our tutoring services aim to not only grow the company, but also helps U.S. university students to pay for their student loans. We have the highest pay rate for tutors and utilizes our proprietary tutor training processes to better streamline the tutoring experiences for both the tutor and students. Management and Operations Methena’s management team is consisted of professionals with background in the education, finance, technology, and medical field. With its flat organizational culture, all members are able to effectively share best practices amongst each other and leverage on each other’s domain expertise. All members of our management team have graduated from Harvard, Stanford, Columbia, MIT, UC Berkeley, Johns Hopkins, University of Pennsylvania, and are passionate in the field of education. As a true believer in “changing the world through education”, Methena combines technology and educational products to deliver effective educational services to students across the globe.
technology_description: Implementation and Marketing For extracurricular activities, Methena plans to expand its university partners to 10 (currently at 8 with Harvard, Stanford, Columbia, Caltech, Berklee, Brown, and Pratt) by the end of 2022. These certified programs will be delivered physically (residential) and online (synchronous). Methena has been operating on a B2B sector, working with schools and agencies across Asia. With the APP launch and experiential tutoring services, Methena will be able to gain more traction directly with consumers. This will not only enable Methena to expand its presence in the educational arena, but also offer multitudes of educational products such as tutoring, passion finding projects, and freshman concierge services, directly to the consumer market on a global scale. The planned Methena APP launch date is April 30th, 2021 (Alpha release). Methena plans to first promote its APP through its 10,000 past customers in Asia, thus, this version of the APP will focus on Asia Pacific first. Methena plans to build up its marketing channels via CEO interviews, various educational discussion boards, online and offline hiring events, and the gamification of its “Methena Coin”, where users could earn actual scholarship sponsors for referring and purchasing of Methena’s products. A “rest of the world” version of the APP will then be launched with the same features. Financial Plan Methena received its first funding of $700,000 USD back in May of 2019. Before being funded, we were able to maintain profitable each year with a net profit of 28%. For this round, Methena is seeking $3 million USD in exchange for 30% of the company. Methena’s current customers’ average spend is between $5,000 to $8,000. However, with other more affordable products being offered through the APP, it will reach $3 million in sales for the year 2021, $5 million for 2022, and $10 million for 2023. In order to achieve this, we are not seeking pure investors, but investors who could provide value on one of our three product lines. Use of fund: 24% on the APP 10% on business development 20% for operation costs including hardware 46% on SG&A Methena will reach a $500 million valuation in three years, as its management team continues to build up wing-to-wing proprietary educational products for students seeking to study in the U.S. globally. Conclusion Methena has been blessed with the support from Harvard, Columbia, Stanford, Caltech, Berklee, Brown, and Pratt, as the only company in the world to run both online and offline certified programs. Leveraging on its 8 years of university partnerships, Methena plans to build up its presence in the education technology sector by offering more affordable products in the forms of extracurricular activities, train the trainers, and tutoring services. Methena plans to reach a market value of $500 million in three years, with over 30,000 customers worldwide.

Unlike text-to-speech, Modulate's technology produces rich, nuanced output speech, suitable for use in entertainment, marketing, voice-first apps, and many more applications!
description: Modulate has performed novel machine learning research to enable voice conversion - that is, convert any input speech into any chosen target voice. This target voice can be that of a real person (learned from only a few seconds of speech), or a custom voice designed within our system. The final audio will retain the prosody and emotion of the input speech - which means, by varying the vocal characteristics applied by Modulate, and the intonation chosen by the voice actor, absolutely any vocal performance is possible! Modulate currently has a private beta as they refine the quality of their outputs and speak with potential customers to refine their product direction. We are excited to speak with anyone who sees an application for voice conversion, but are currently primarily focused on applications related to media - particularly audiobooks -- as well as designing digital profiles for marketing purposes.

name: MOLTEN Edit
elevator_pitch: At MOLTEN, we are building the foundation of the next-generation media industry, supporting film, TV, books, music, VR, games, etc. The MOLTEN cloud platform transforms media rights, content and financial management, radically simplifying global operations. Leveraging its domain expertise and deep capabilities, the MOLTEN cloud infrastructure empowers its users with real-time analytics and tools to accelerate deal-making and content monetization worldwide.
description: Today, most of the digital media content in the world (such as movies, TV, music, photos etc.) relies on decades old and manual infrastructure to manage rights, content and money operations globally. This creates a highly inefficient value-chain, with lost revenue, copyright infringements, and exorbitant operational expenses. MOLTEN is the next-generation infrastructure for digital media that transforms rights, content, and financial management globally. Built by a team from MIT, with advisors including Jack Dorsey, MOLTEN is the state-of-the-art cloud technology for digital media.
technology_description: MOLTEN is a vertical-cloud technology delivered as a service. MOLTEN incorporates deep functionality purpose-built for simplifying the management of media rights and content globally. MOLTEN Core, the underlying processing engine, incorporates technologies ranging from rights processor, contracts digitizer, metadata manager, search engine, identity & access manager, CDN/DRM, to lower-level technologies like transport protocols, payment gateways, tamper-proof auditable DB, and many more. The integrated multi-cloud infrastructure transforms, streamlines and simplifies core operations involved in managing digital media assets - including rights, contracts, content, distribution and financial operations - so that enterprise and rights holders can accelerate development of great content, deal-making, and monetization anywhere in the world.

Mori's core customers are large and regional fruit and vegetable producers who are in need a natural and cost-effective solutions to extend shelf life and reach new markets. name: MORINGACONNECT Edit
elevator_pitch: MoringaConnect takes the moringa tree, a plant common in arid climates like Africa, and turns it into beauty products and pre-packaged snacks.
description: The company, founded by then-undergrads Emily Cunningham and Kwami Williams after a trip to Ghana, is tackling the lofty goals of improving agriculture, economics, and supply chains in Africa. And they’re doing so with the launch of two initial product lines—cosmetics and healthy snacks—sourced from Ghana’s native Moringa Tree. Moringa is known as “the miracle tree” in Ghana. The tree’s leaves are packed with nutrients, and the oil seeds it produces are rich in antioxidants and natural moisturizers, making it a perfect base for both beauty and food products—except that the trees weren’t being used to their full potential by Ghana’s farmers. The founder used his background in engineering to develop a method for extracting the tree’s oils, and MoringaConnect was born. Now, the company trains and advises farmers in Ghana, purchases Moringa seeds at a fair price, and employs locals in its African processing center, all with the aim of improving living and working conditions.

name: MUI LAB Edit
elevator_pitch: mui Lab is a Japanese startup that develops design-focused technology. With the mantra of “mui shizen” (“live according to nature” in Japanese), the company strives for innovative engineering solutions that foster harmony among technology, the humans who use it and the nature that surrounds them. mui Lab, which presented its work at Milan Salone 2018, conducts its global business from its home office in Kyoto, the city known for its successful blending of traditions and technology.
description: mui Lab is a Calm Technology startup specializing in designing IoT interfaces that enable a “calm” digital living. Our design concept stems from Taoism philosophy of “mui shizen,” which means “doing nothing.” We believe “technology” can become synonymous with “unintentional,” and strive to harness the power of cutting-edge engineering to create a harmony among technology, the human who use it and the nature surrounding them. mui Lab conducts global business from its headquarters in Kyoto, a city known for its successful blending of traditions and technology. mui Lab has presented its work on various global stages, including Milan Salone (2018 & 2019) and Consumer Electronics Show (CES) 2019, and has garnered worldwide media attention. mui Lab is a recipient of the Best of Kickstarter Award and CES Innovation Award 2019.
technology_description: In recent digital era, we humans are subconsciously forced to think, act and behave in accordance with the way how the technology is designed. mui advocates the concept of “Calm Technology & Design” being inspired by one of the philosophy of Taoism, “mui shizen” and bring the technology more calm and subtle to harmonize between the human, technology and nature. With our expertized design and engineering, we create products and conceptual art system in order to make our pioneering concept tangible in the society.

name: MULTIMER (FORMERLY DUKODE STUDIO) Edit
elevator_pitch: Multimer, an NYC-based MIT spinoff, offers a unique, quantitative way to build empathy by measuring a population's sentiment and experience. Its products include a location-aware biosensor system and a data analytics platform that integrates biosensor and geographic data. We are proud to be a new member of Matter.vc and an awardee of the National Science Foundation SBIR program.
description: Multimer helps businesses, governments, and organizations understand how humans react to and interact with spatial environments by quantifying and mapping human sentiment. Multimer uses lightweight, low-cost biosensor wearables to continuously collect and analyze biometric data from populations as they move through a city or building, allowing us to monitor what people are actually experiencing throughout the day. Multimer’s platform interprets the data into human sentiments, integrating it with other data sets to provide actionable insights towards the creation of sites and spaces that prioritize the human experience. Although physiological data such as heart rate, vocal patterns, and facial expression are increasingly used for commercial purposes, Multimer is one of the few companies that integrates brainwave data in a consumer-friendly and research-oriented manner outside of the lab. HISTORICAL INFORMATION: The DuKode Studio focuses on creative data transposition to many forms, including software, animation, print, and physical objects. DuKode's particular specialty is scientific visualization. Its principals, Ilias Koen and Arlene Ducao, first collaborated in a 2003 Physical Computing class at the School of Visual Arts MFA Computer Art program. In addition to their MFAs, DuKode has collaborated with nonprofits, think tanks, artists, educational publishers, pop stars, government agencies, scientists, and sociologists. DuKode is always open to new collaborations.
