name: MULTIPLY LABS Edit
elevator_pitch: Multiply Labs’ vision is to build the gold standard robotic technology for the air scalable manufacturing of personalized pharmaceutical products. To fulfill the promise of personalized medicine, advanced therapeutics such as cell and gene therapies must be tailored to the needs of each patient. Yet, their highly manual and labor-intensive manufacturing process represents a major bottleneck stifling their widespread adoption and accessibility. The robots built at Multiply Labs are designed to
description: Multiply Labs designs and deploys modular robotic clusters to scale traditional pharmaceutical manufacturing processes. Our approach enables scalable manufacturing of highly personalized therapeutics that is simply unprecedented, due to the highly manual and labor-intensive nature of current production processes. Custom-made therapeutics are the key of personalized medicine and will enable the patient-specific treatment of several pathologies ranging from immune diseases, to oncology to heart failure. Our customers are large pharmaceutical companies interested in adopting our technology to bring unprecedented scaling capabilities to their manufacturing processes. We also partner with academic and industrial leaders in pharmacology and medicine to imagine, design and pioneer the future of personalized medicine from advanced drug products to cell therapies.
technology_description: Multiply Labs builds robotic systems validated for the production of specific, advanced drug products. Thanks to our approach, our pharmaceutical customers have been able to fine-tune the type and dosages of the active ingredients in a custom drug and to tailor their amounts to the needs of a specific patient. Each robotic system is a self-contained unit occupying less than 15 square-feet. The unit features a robotic arm surrounded by manufacturing modules capable of sliding and pivoting to move materials through production. Leveraging the latest advances in cloud and software engineering, we provide secure and sophisticated data processing, storage and transfer, to track and optimize production. Today, our robots are being deployed on the production floors of leading pharmaceutical companies worldwide. Their modular design enables customers to purchase as many clusters as they need and run them in concert. More recently, we have also undertaken the development of a new robotic manufacturing platform to ease bottlenecks in the creation of cell therapies - a powerful tool in the treatment of cancer, whose production is incredibly labor-intensive leading to prohibitive costs. Multiply Labs is automating the processes that can currently only be performed by highly trained scientists, eliminating the most time-consuming tasks in cell-therapy production processes. Multiply Labs’ partners in the cell therapy space include UCSF’s GMP Cell Therapy Facility, and Cytiva (fka GE Life Sciences) - the leader in cell therapy manufacturing equipment.

name: MUSCA INC Edit
elevator_pitch: Hyper-Efficient Biomass-Recycling in a Week -- Insect technology firm MUSCA uses the power of thoroughbred-houseflies, reared as animal feed, to speed-convert biowaste into organic fertilizer. Driven by a vision to pass on a cleaner planet with lasting food security to future generations, MUSCA’s team developed a “double-blade” sustainable platform to solve two vital problems in today’s agriculture industry.
description: MUSCA owns houseflies that have been selectively bred over 1200 generations for half a century. Utilizing this army of elite-thoroughbred houseflies, MUSCA developed a hyper-efficient biomass-recycling system that requires only a week for conversion, drastically shortening composting time-lengths compared to traditional practices. The thoroughbred-housefly larvae, which MUSCA rears as natural animal protein feed, consume biowaste including livestock waste as its natural diet, converting it to excrement which is used as fertilizer. MUSCA Feed has high functionality, such as increased disease resistance, and promotion of body mass increase, as identified through scientific research at partner universities. MUSCA Fertilizer has superior qualities compared to conventional fermented fertilizer, such as heightened bacterial resistance, as identified through scientific research at partner universities. With the promise to address both current biowaste pollution issues and future protein food security concerns within a single “double-blade” supply system, MUSCA aims to fast-track to commercialization on an industrial scale as early as possible.

name: MYA HEALTH INC. / RECLAIM Edit
elevator_pitch: RECLAIM, is a financial wellness app whose mission is to help plan members save a median of $1,500 on their healthcare out-of-pocket spending, both for their planned and unexpected care needs. To self-funded health plans, Reclaim is an analytics and optimization powerhouse that saves them up to 5-10% on their healthcare bill through optimizing their provider network down to each of their plan member's needs and personalizing their engagement in their healthcare benefits throughout the year.
description: The company plays at the intersection of InsurTech and FinTech, with our technology resting on a big-data healthcare analytics engine. Specifically, thetechnology feeds off of identified and detailed medical and pharmacy claims data with diagnosis and service codes, as well as provider credentials and adjudicated prices. The engine consists of (1) descriptive analytics which creates episodes of care algorithmically from claims data, (2) predictive analytics which predicts a plan member's future healthcare needs given their claims history, and (3) prescriptive analytics which optimizes plan members preferred providers within their network and prescribes recommended actions to lower their health spending. On the frontend, the outputs from the analytics engine are communicated to plan members via a personalized member mobile application designed to simplify their navigation of their health spending and push notifications to alert them of eligible savings.

description: The brand is built upon the coexistence of dichotomies: everyday and fantasy, tradition and innovation, design and versatility -- creating an elevated experience that defies trade-offs. name: NABLA MOBILITY INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: NABLA Mobility develops, "Smart navigation system for Aviation", an adaptive advisory tool to implement better flight trajectories and flight settings. We contribute to augment the operational excellence and the decarbonization of the aviation industry. In fact, airspace is usually filled with many uncertainties in the various aspects of flight conditions limiting further optimize their operation. Our navigation software dynamically identifies optimal flight settings accounting for the predicti
description: Solution provider to decarbonize the aviation industry utilizing power of AI/ML.
technology_description: Since the aircraft fuel consumption is inherently non-liner to its weight, we employ a quasi-linear optimization algorithm of transport model to identify optimal flight settings, which is new in this area. In order to ensure the quality of its output, it is essential to improve the quality of the models of fuel consumption, traffic prediction and the prediction of atmospheric conditions. We, therefore, dynamically utilize both public and internal data to upgrade our models with the selection of key attributes with physics rationales. Further optimization of fight trajectory and settings is enabled with the sufficient situational awareness beyond in the range of single aircraft. In other words, the advisory tool provides feasible recommendation accounting for the trajectory and traffic constrains so that airlines can appropriately request their favored flights settings to air traffic controllers.

name: NANOFIBER QUANTUM TECHNOLOGIES Edit
elevator_pitch: We aim to realize a society where people can utilize the power of quantum computing anywhere through a quantum network. Our proprietary technology, nanofier Cavity QED, holds the distinctive scalability of quantum computer which is the optimal platform to integrate quantum computing with quantum communication
description: Scalability in hardware for quantum computers is one of the biggest challenges to build Fault-tolerant Quantum computing. Our unique technology holds strong promise in developing the most scalable system for quantum computers. Our system could accommodate a large number of atoms (~10,000) in one cavity and furthermore interconnect multiple cavities with optical fibers, resulting in a network of quantum computers (distributed quantum computer) and integration with quantum communication
technology_description: Our Nanofiber Cavity QED is the unique design integrated with laser cooling techniques. Compared to other major platforms for quantum computing such as superconducting circuit and ion trap, this platform holds unique properties: 1) hybrid system of atom and light, 2) all-to-all connectivity of qubits, 3) accommodation of a large number of qubits in one unit (~10,000), and 4) compatibility with optical fiber, allowing integration of quantum computers and quantum communication.

description: Mission We engineer scalable, graphene-powered devices that replace legacy materials in high-impact sectors—accelerating breakthroughs in compute, energy, and health. SUSANNE powers our core product family: nSD (nanostructured Scalable Devices). nSD-I (Semiconductors) Our graphene-enhanced substrates outperform copper in interconnects and vias—achieving 1.4× higher electrical and 2× thermal conductivity. Ideal for analog, RF, and non-leading-node applications where performance density matters. We’re actively engaging global industry stakeholders across packaging, foundry, and aerospace to co-develop and qualify early prototypes. nSD-H (Hydrogen) A rare-metal-free catalyst that delivers up to 4× more hydrogen output than stainless steel, at a fraction of the cost of steel and platinum-based alternatives. TRL7 validation is underway with global hydrogen integrators and power companies in APAC and Europe, targeting plug-in-ready deployment into stack systems. nSD-α (Biosensors) A high-sensitivity graphene biosensor validated against gold-standard PCR benchmarks. name: NEOVIEWS Edit
elevator_pitch: The global sports sponsorship market was estimated at around USD 78 billion in 2022 while that for the sport analytics was at 2.45 billion in 2021 with a projected annual growth of 27.3% until 2030. We offer broadcasters and clubs with the innovative tools to add dynamic virtual advertisement contents to the original broadcast videos according to targeted audiences. We also offer football clubs, coaches and players sport analytics tools to understand themselves and opponents better than anyone else, both for game preparations and real-time tactical analysis. Our state-of-the-art 3D field reconstruction technologies require no infrastructure investment other than original video feeds and hence can be integrated to any existing systems. Our deep mathematical insights for camera/video calibration together with optimised AI and advanced Computer Vision enable us to reconstruct the 3D field at pixel-level accuracy and hence virtual advertisement and sport analytics are just straightforward extensions.
description: We address the problems facing the sport broadcasting advertisement and sport analytics through developing the same core technology on 3D field reconstruction without any additional infrastructure investment. Advertisement industry: the current broadcasting videos on big events such as the recent World Cup in Qatar are delivering the same contents to all viewers around the world. This means only a limited number of brands can appear in the billboards and these brands can often only be relevant to a small portion of the audiences while many other brands do not have the opportunity to advertise. In other words, the current system is not socially optimal and we aim to make it more efficient. This is done through virtual advertisements where the original broadcasting videos are added with different advertisement contents on the same physical billboards before broadcasting to specific audiences depending on their demographic and preferences. Sport analytics: Football clubs in major leagues are using more and more big data to gain and keep a competitive edge. To enable this, they either employ football video analysts to semi-manually turn football videos into insights or to buy data from some data provider such as OPTA, who in-turn employ a large labour force to do the video analysis (despite the use of some AI tools). The 3D field reconstruction enables us to identify the locations of the billboard, the players, the ball and obstacles and add the corresponding dynamical contents or to perform sport analytics.
technology_description: The key technology is on video calibration based on our deep mathematical insights in the domain. Essentially, each video frame contains a number of clues, which can be detected by Advanced AI and computer vision tools, on the 3D real-world coordinates. The challenge is to turn these (noisy) clues into mathematical equations that govern the cameras’ operations and their parameters. A sport broadcasting video is often produced from a system of cameras, each has a changing set of parameters and our calibration task is to efficiently and accurately compute these coefficients from noisy data. While the virtual advertisement and sport analytics have been well-established, existing technologies often required hardware installation while our technology requires only the video feeds being broadcasted. Our AI and Computer Vision tools are guided by mathematical insights and hence are more computationally efficient, which allows us to perform real-time advertisement placement and in-game analytics.
mit_connection: MIT alumni as founder | I was an MIT PhD gradudate (2004-2009).
contact: ngtridung@gmail.com, startupexchange-admin@mit.edu, startupexchange@mit.edu
keywords: Virtual advertisement; sport analytics; 3D reconstruction; AI, Computer Vision; Mathematical Optimization

name: NETACARBON Edit
elevator_pitch: NetaCarbon is a workflow and intelligence solution that enables corporations to invest in bespoke high-quality carbon projects. We address the struggle to source quality offsets by matching buyer preferences with developers who create customized offsets. Our process is supported by standardized tracking and reporting tools that comply with international regulations. Unlike off-the-shelf credits, our solutions provide transparency and quality assurance, enabling companies to manage their carbon inventory with confidence. This alignment strengthens their brand reputation and supports their mission-driven sustainability goals. We started this as a side hustle during our MBAs at MIT and Harvard in 2022, after witnessing the problem first-hand in Kenya. We officially launched NetaCarbon in October 2023. We received over $50K of non-dilutive funding, onboarded our first paying customer, built a low-code platform based on user feedback, and are currently in late-stage sales conversations with 3 corporates.
description: The voluntary carbon market is projected to grow from $2 billion today to $30 billion by 2030, requiring a 15-fold increase in just six years to meet corporate climate commitments. However, misaligned incentives and lack of transparency hinder the market's growth, with corporate buyers concerned about reputational risks when purchasing off-the-shelf carbon credits. NetaCarbon's solution addresses these challenges by enabling corporate buyers to create and finance high-quality carbon projects, rebuilding trust in the market. Our pre-financing model serves as an effective climate finance solution, gets projects off the ground, and contributes to global climate action, while also strengthening brand narratives and driving topline growth.
technology_description: NetaCarbon is a SaaS platform that connects corporate companies with carbon project developers, instead of off-the-shelf carbon credits that other players are focus on. Our proprietary algorithms match corporate’s climate/branding objectives with our database of project developers. After a successful match, we provide standardized offtake contracts, simplifying the procurement paperwork, and provide a tracking platform where buyers can see the implementation of the project in real time - we would be the first-in-the-market to provide project tracking for buyers.

name: NEWBORN SOLUTIONS (NBS) Edit

description: NewBorn Solutions was born to become leader provider of medical solutions to non-invasively characterize superficial body fluids. The aim is to revolutionize the medical devices sector for the non-invasive screening and treatment monitoring of infectious and neurodegenerative diseases. NBS accomplishes this aim through the design, development and commercialization of high-value high-impact medical solutions to unrecognized and unattended problems. The Neosonics is a sophisticated precision-engineering system using high-frequency ultrasound to non-invasively count white blood cell in the cerebrospinal fluid below the infant fontanel, the region of the head where the bones are not yet closed. In the current practice, increased cerebrospinal fluid white blood cell count obtained through lumbar puncture immediately triggers medication irrespective of diagnostic bacteriologic results. There are 3 easy steps: (1) Place the Neosonics on the infant fontanel, the head area where bones are not yet closed (2) Push the button to get the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) white blood cell (WBC) count (3) Detect abnormal CSF WBC count to immediately trigger medication or to follow-up patient’s response to treatment

name: NEWS DETECTIVE Edit
elevator_pitch: Social media companies hire professional factcheckers to check articles one-by-one. There are only a handful of factcheckers, compared to the billions of social media posts. There are nowhere near enough factcheckers to check all of it. The answer: News Detective. News Detective is a platform that uses moderatored crowdsourcing, professional factcheckers, and AI. Social media users rate articles for truthfulness and provide evidence on website. Professional factcheckers and more experienced users rate other users. Ratings/explanations of highly-rated users appear on Facebook, Google, Twitter, and other social media Currently, misinformation starts as a few small pieces of misinformation that snowball into a big one. But with News Detective, we nip misinformation in the bud. As misinformation grows, these fact-checks follow it just as fast.
description: Social media companies hire professional factcheckers to check articles one-by-one. There are only a handful of factcheckers, compared to the billions of social media posts. There are nowhere near enough factcheckers to check all of it. ​ Artificial intelligence won't solve this either. AI is just an extension of humans. Fake news is made to trick humans. If fake news can trick humans, it can easily trick AI. Crowdsourcing, letting regular users rate articles, can handle the volume. But crowds aren't always that wise. Some people are biased. Some people are inexperienced. Some people are bots.
technology_description: Social media users rate articles for truthfulness and provide evidence on website. Professional factcheckers and more experienced users rate other users. It's like Wikipedia for factchecking.

name: NEXTDROID Edit
elevator_pitch: The introduction of Advanced Driver Assistance System (ADAS) features in consumer vehicles began in earnest w/ the widespread availability of the Tesla Auto Pilot and GM Super Cruise in 2015. The commercial success & consumer popularity of these driver support features have accelerated rapidly due to the scale of investment in ADAS features and Autonomous Vehicles (AVs) across the spectrum of the automotive supply chain.
description: Making Autonomous Vehicles a Safe Endeavor..... NextDroid designs & builds development tools for ADAS and AV feature validation on public roads. Our ground truth platform (Veritas) combines a hardware appliqué with a scalable cloud based software service (SaaS). Veritas collects mileage data and produces ground truth information that assesses the feature performance in the real world. It also offers a suite of tools for root cause fault analysis and correction. It can be used throughout the development and release process. Platform users improve validation results over fewer miles, in less time and at a lower expense than present methods. The lynch pin to achieving these benefits is providing more information per mile. NextDroid is a young company with a small and growing customer base in North America – OEM and Tier 1. Team members come from MIT, Stanford, and Carnegie Mellon, and University of Tennessee faculty. Our domain experience spans vehicle OEMs, mapping, test & diagnostics, robotics and machine learning.
technology_description: Our ground truth platform (Veritas) combines a hardware appliqué with a scalable cloud based software service (SaaS). The hardware component is an integrated assembly of survey grade roof top sensors that collect spatial and temporal data. This data is logged with data from the vehicle sensors, then processed together in a scalable cloud infrastructure to describe to the the performance of the feature and vehicle in the real world. NextDroid has pioneered the use of machine learning to accelerate processing cycle time associated with large amounts of drive data (hundreds of thousands of miles). Real world data plus cloud based processing enable users to get more information per mile, which is key to increasing feature safety while reducing test expense and duration.

name: NEXTGEN JANE Edit
elevator_pitch: NextGen Jane (Jane) is a data-driven health company changing the way women and people who menstruate engage with and access healthcare. The company’s smart tampon platform allows users to conveniently mail in cells from the reproductive tract that are shed during menstruation. By developing genomic classifiers for specific disease states, Jane hopes to enable earlier diagnosis of devastating reproductive disorders which can take up to a decade to identify today.
description: NextGen Jane (Jane) is a diagnostic startup focused on developing tests based off a patented tampon collection technology. Jane’s technology platform allows users to collect menstrual and cervicovaginal samples with an everyday household product, preserve nucleic acids and other analytes important for disease detection and ship them off to a lab for in-depth sequencing analysis and disease detection. name: NEXTILES Edit
elevator_pitch: Nextiles is building the next generation of fabric-based wearables where we convert traditional consumer products into responsive and adaptive devices. Through our consulting, licensing, and joint-development business model, we are helpin
description: We are the only company to provide cheap, machine-washable, and platform-agnostic plug-and-play sensor technology that is truly wearable. In a one-to-one comparison, traditional sensor technologies such as strain gauges and accelerometers can cost upwards of $50 - $500, whereas our technology can be made with $15 - $20 of materials with an even easier construction method using standard sewing methods. In addition, we have secured a moat around this technology with our 3 patents and trademarks. Our patents include the design, manufacturability, and application of sensors in a variety of garments (helmets, shirts, sleeves, etc.). This has allowed our business model to attract licensing and joint-venture partnerships where we de-risk the build and research & development for larger companies.
technology_description: Our technology uses traditional sewing technology with innovative threads and patterns to construct motion sensors entirely out of fabric. Therefore, we can build traditional electronic devices directly into apparel that is form-fitting and machine washable. We also host a data platform with an API that wirelessly measures incoming pressure, bending, and stretch data, and convert those values into biomechanical metrics such as angle, velocity, power, etc.

name: NINE DIAGNOSTICS Edit
elevator_pitch: Our pioneering platform technology consists of arrays of carbon nanotube sensors which can uniquely identify a disease-specific spectral profile in response to molecular binding interactions to proteins and metabolites in patient blood serum. The technology has been initially validated for detection of high-grade serous ovarian carcinoma, prediction of IVF pregnancy loss, and differentiation between types of intracranial tumors. Using information including disease diagnosis, disease stage, patie
description: The factors that underpin diseases, and our ability to treat them effectively is multi-factorial and can be highly individualistic that needs to take into consideration not only the local biology and pathology, but also the patient's whole health, environmental factors, and social determinants of health. We are striving to address this issue through our AI-Enabled Nanosensor Platform technology which provides information to help screen and diagnose earlier, and measure treatment effectiveness. We aim to provide a feedback loop for therapy selection, dosing, frequency, and cadence, and guide decisions on combination therapies. This has the potential to help clinicians and therapeutic developers by providing earlier markers for treatment effectiveness, moving patients towards more effective treatments more quickly.
technology_description: Our pioneering platform technology consists of arrays of carbon nanotube sensors which can uniquely identify a disease-specific spectral profile in response to molecular binding interactions to proteins and metabolites in patient blood serum. The technology has been initially validated for detection of high-grade serous ovarian carcinoma, prediction of IVF pregnancy loss, and differentiation between types of intracranial tumors. Using information including disease diagnosis, disease stage, patient demographics, co-existing diseases, current medications, and social determinants of health, we train machine learning classification models to predict disease states. We envision that our technology can serve as a diagnostics platform for functional precision medicine to measure treatment effectiveness faster, optimizing treatment dosing and frequency faster, identifying novel disease-specific biomarkers, and identifying disease recurrence or treatment resistance.

name: NONA TECHNOLOGIES, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: noNa Desalination is a technology company with the mission of making portable desalination easy, and sustainable. Developed in an MIT lab, our proprietary technology allows users to turn seawater into drinking water with nothing but the sun, and do so at a production rate high enough to support a small group. Our product can provide clean drinking water off-grid for soldiers, boaters, and emergency preparedness enthusiasts with better portability, usability, reliability, and cost than incumbents
description: We are solving the problem of water scarcity for small groups who are temporarily without access to drinking water. People who are subject to natural disasters, or are placed in extreme environments because of war, political crises, or recreation often have this problem.
technology_description: Our solution is a portable desalination device which solves the woes of Reverse Osmosis devices using an entirely new technology, which was developed here at MIT. Whereas RO pushes water through a membrane at super high pressures, our device passes seawater through a channel and removes salt and other particles using an electrical field. Because water never passes through a membrane, there is no change for membrane destruction, and no need for high-pressure; the entire system is low-pressure. Because no high-pressure pumps are required, the electricity needs are massively reduced. The bottom line? Our product will produce enough water to support a group of 10 people at 1/3 the weight, 1/2 the cost, and 1/10 the amperage of the best RO competitor on the market. And it does all this with vastly improved usability and reliability.

name: NORTHWOOD Edit
elevator_pitch: Opportunities to impact life on earth through satellite technology are abundant, from expanding internet connectivity to tracking climate change with real-time imagery and data. However, to take full advantage of these opportunities for impact, satellites must have better contact with the earth. Today, innovation is constrained by a bottleneck in ground communication infrastructure. Antennas remain inefficient and expensive with little or no interoperability. We seek to provide dramatically more
description: Please add
technology_description: We propose an low-cost active electronically scanned array (AESA) for efficient earth-to-space communication. Currently this technology has proven success with the US Military, however it has been prohibitively expensive to produce at scale for the commercial space sector. After many customer and stakeholder interviews, we have distilled the most important improvements to existing technology: 1. Interoperable across frequency bands, no longer requiring a different antenna for each use case. 2. Efficient, enabling 10 simultaneous connections through one device. This is a 20x improvement from existing parabolic antennas that require often two antennas tracking a single satellite to achieve comparable coverage. 3. Affordable, by borrowing from cellular technology and capitalizing on advances in software, we are able to offer a 5x reduction in cost for the same coverage. Additionally, our technology requires nearly zero maintenance, a dramatic improvement from the wear and tear on parabolic antennas.

name: NOTCH INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: Notch develops RF solutions using novel electronically controlled metasurfaces for wireless applications in defense and commercial sector. On the defense side, Notch's metasurfaces can be used to give phased array capabilities to simple omnidirectional antennas.
description: Just as transistors revolutionized computer design, we at Notch believe that the RF metamaterial we have developed will revolutionize existing wireless markets and even create new ones. We are well funded through government grants and were graduates of the Boston Techstars Autonomous Accelerator in 2018. Some of the applications include Metasurface-based Software-Defined Antennas (SDAs) that give phased-array capabilities with a single antenna element and no power consumed for steering . Applications that include Counter Unmanned Aerial Systems (C-UAS), UAV Ground Control Units (GCU) and electronically steerable SATCOM antennas for LEO satellites. Ultrawideband, lightweight metasurface Radar Absorbing Materials (RAM) in UAVs for reducing signature or changing RF signature dynamically. Integration on LEO CubeSats to protect against uplink jamming and simultaneously provide RF cross-links. Fabric based clothing/apparel to conceal antennas while simultaneously providing anti-jamming and communication range boosting capabilities with recent successful demonstrations. Detect and protect against spoofing and jamming signals on UAV/USV platforms. Solutions for protection against Havana Syndrome.
technology_description: In nature, metals reflect radio waves across all frequencies. Metasurfaces are 2D materials that can act like metals but are frequency selective. Notch’s Radio Frequency (RF) metasurfaces can be made controllably transmissive/reflective, frequency tunable, or absorptive to radio waves of a desired frequency band. They are light weight, consume no power, and are conformal/flexible. This makes Notch's metamaterial technology easily integrated into low power, low compute systems, upgrading their wireless capabilities to that of a multi-antenna element system. Notch's absorptive metamaterial technology can be used to controllably change the radar cross section (RCS) of any platform it is integrated into.

description: Nth Cycle was created to disrupt the electronics manufacturing and recycling industries by changing their linear material model into a more efficient, circular one. The mission is to help transition the United States away from their reliance on primary mining and refining of metals overseas, toward the recycling of rare earth and specialty metals (e.g., Co, In, and Y) domestically from (1) the electronics and semiconductor manufacturing processes themselves, and (2) the products at their end-of-life during the recycling process, for reuse in future advanced manufacturing processes. Advanced electronics are becoming irreplaceable parts of modern life. Due to the increasing demand for these products, along with the global movement toward alternative energy sources, reliance on the foreign metals that these products rely on has reached 100%. technology_description: Demand for critical minerals to power the energy transition is growing exponentially. name: NUVU STUDIO Edit
elevator_pitch: Takes High School Students Out of the Classroom and Into a Design Space to Invent and Create
description: Established in the fall of 2010 in Cambridge, MA, NuVu is an award winning full-time innovation studio for high school students. NuVu’s pedagogy is based on the architectural studio model and geared around multi-disciplinary, collaborative projects. NuVu provides students the opportunity to work collaboratively with academic and professional experts (PhDs/alumni from MIT and Harvard as well as leading professionals) to solve real-world problems. NuVu nurtures creative problem solving, team collaboration across networks, oral and presentation skills, technological proficiency, systems thinking, adaptability, risk-taking and imagination; All critical for student success in the 21st century. NuVu’s pedagogy is informed by the architectural design Studio where a coach guides students in hands-on problem-solving to solve complex, comprehensive problems. The Studio model uses exercises to build skills and integrates students’ knowledge in a final project. Within each multidisciplinary Studio, students explore problems rigorously by focusing on one project for two weeks. A Studio Coach mentors students to develop their project through an iterative process over the course of the Studio. Students confront the small and large contexts within problems as they are exposed to complex, ‘messy’ situations. The NuVu Team continuously evaluates students through deskcrits and final reviews. Develop Real-World Solutions for the World -- Taught within the multidisciplinary framework of the design Studio rather than traditional subjects, NuVu students acquire a highly personalized understanding of the world and how they relate to it and can fully participate in it. They develop multiple solutions to problems and learn the importance of moving from one solution to the next, combining, exploring and thinking of the possibilities. They also learn how to change their perspective on an issue quickly. They learn that solutions depend on perspective, and only by understanding an issue from multiple perspectives can they fully explore the terrain of possibilities. Iterative Process, Constant Feedback -- The iterative process, or process of refining an idea, product or solution, in the design studio is intended to provide students with continual feedback from NuVu Coaches and Staff on performance as well as product. NuVu students also experience working in an intense, feedback-rich environment that provides them with information and support for continuous self-evaluation, reflection, and improvement. Learn in New Ways -- NuVu challenges students to learn in new ways: analytical thinkers are inspired to explore their creative selves, while creative students expand their capacity to think and learn analytically. NuVu capitalizes on the immense resources of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and Harvard University to focus on hands-on problem solving, encourage an inventive culture, promote peer teaching and learning, and cultivate students’ curiosity. Portfolio-Based Assessment -- Instead of grading, NuVu uses a portfolio-based assessment. A portfolio serves as a compilation of student work done at NuVu over the course of the term, semester or full year and is meant to show the student's growth over time and development of key academic and life skills (creativity, critical thinking, collaboration, communication, research, quantitative reasoning and analysis). Each NuVu student is provided with their own online profile on NuVu's online platform where they document and present their work. At frequent periods during the term, NuVu's team works with the student to assess how far the student has developed since the beginning of the term. The portfolio-based assessment helps make learning and assessment relevant to students' lives.

description: OpenBiome (full name Microbiome Health Research Institute Inc.) is a nonprofit organization dedicated to expanding safe access to fecal microbiota transplantation (FMT) therapies. Founded by a small team of microbiologists, public health advocates, and concerned citizens, OpenBiome aims to significantly reduce the practical barriers for clinicians providing FMTs, while connecting scientists across studies and disciplines. Motivated by scientific curiosity and frustration at the struggle of a friend suffering from recurrent C. difficile, we founded the OpenBiome project to give a broader pool of clinicians access to the carefully screened samples necessary to perform FMT. Despite the underlying simplicity and efficacy of FMT, it has become difficult to practice at the scale required due to the challenges of screening donors and processing stool material. OpenBiome is designed to simplify the FMT process by freeing clinicians to focus on providing care and conducting research rather than preparing stool and filing paperwork.

name: OSMOSES Edit
elevator_pitch: Industrial purification and separation processes account for 15% of the world energy consumption and 16% of the CO2 emissions. This is because we still use energy-intensive, century-old technologies. At Osmoses, we developed a clean solution to change this: molecular filters that can purify hydrogen and natural gas, and can perform carbon capture at scale. Our product is a membrane module and we target the $20 billion gas separation market, $1.5 billion of which is already serviceable. We are co
description: Ekotrope Inc. is a Cambridge-MA-based company that offers unique software solutions for designing energy-efficient buildings to maximize owners’ investments as well as ensuring energy code compliance in today’s changing construction environment. Founded in 2010, the inspiration for Ekotrope’s optimization engine grew out of MIT Aeronautics and Astronautics Professor Edward F. Crawley’s quest for a way to find the most energy efficient design for a home he was building in 2009. Crawley found there was no way for his architect to easily analyze component tradeoffs to find the best energy and investment combination. The enterprising rocket scientist drew on NASA technology and assembled a select group of industry experts to come up with the Ekotrope solution.
technology_description: Traditional separation technologies are effective, but very inefficient, because they rely on expensive heat to perform separation. Membranes changes the approach towards separations as they do not require heat and operate as molecular filters, separating molecules based on their size. However, commercial membranes have poor separation performance and high operating costs, which leads to poor adoption. At Osmoses we developed a materials platform and completely re-designed the materials that make membrane technologies. Our polymers have very rigid ladder structures, which leads to abundant porosity that we can leverage for precise molecular filtrations, achieving minimum energy consumptions and unprecedented separation performance that make Osmoses membrane a breakthrough technology for the future of separations.

name: PACCATECH Edit
elevator_pitch: PaccaTech is a clinical‑stage MedTech company that has created MagClean®, the first non‑invasive, wearable device that uses safe, low‑energy electromagnetic fields to generate micro‑currents on metal implants. This patented technology disrupts bacterial biofilms, preventing and treating prosthetic joint infections without the need for revision surgery, saving lives and billions in healthcare costs.
description: Every year biofilm‑related infections in orthopaedics affect ≈13 million patients and claim ≈500 000 lives worldwide.¹ Current standards—IV antibiotics, antibiotic‑loaded cement and complex revision surgeries—fail because biofilms shield pathogens such as Staphylococcus aureus from drugs and the immune system. A single infected knee or hip replacement costs hospitals US $50–116 k per patient and prolongs hospital stays by weeks. PaccaTech addresses this critical gap with MagClean®, a lightweight brace that can be prescribed for post‑operative prevention in high‑risk patients and as the first truly non‑surgical therapy for established infections, cutting complication rates, hospital days and overall treatment costs.
technology_description: Device: Ergonomic brace/orthosis housing toroidal coils that create a precisely controlled (<3 mT) magnetic field and a low‑intensity alternating current on the surface of orthopaedic hardware. Operation: daily wear; silent, battery‑powered; rechargeable pack provides >24 h autonomy. Mechanism of Action: Induced micro‑currents destabilise the extracellular matrix of bacterial biofilms ("electricidal effect"), exposing pathogens to host defences and adjuvant antibiotics. Validation: In vitro (Albert Einstein Hospital, 2022) – 82 % biofilm reduction on stainless‑steel in 14 days. Small‑animal safety + efficacy (2023) – No cytotoxicity; significant CFU reduction. Porcine osteomyelitis model (Univ. Minho, 2024) – Histology shows bone healing and lower bacterial load; no adverse events. Regulatory Path: Class II medical device (ANVISA, Brazil); 510(k) predicate search completed; ISO 10993 biocompatibility passed; CE‑MDR roadmap under way. IP: 5 patents granted (US, CN) + 2 pending (BR, IN) covering waveform, coil design and clinical indications.
mit_connection: MIT alumni as founder | MIT SLOAN EPGM Cohort 8 graduated alumni
contact: 848 Brickell Avenue ste 203, Miami, FL, 33131 • danielpacca@paccatech.com, pablo@paccatech.com, startupexchange-admin@mit.edu, startupexchange@mit.edu

name: PASCAL TECHNOLOGY Edit
elevator_pitch: Using solid state refrigerants to drive high efficiency, zero GWP heat pumps. Technology is extensible to a broad range of heating and cooling sectors and is vitally important in a world that is warming and will need to install billions of new heat pumps in the next 15 years.
description: Current heat pumps and air conditioners rely on a gaseous refrigeration cycle that is more than 100 years old. While effective, the refrigerants used today are extremely potent greenhouse gases (with more than 2,000 times the potency of CO2). Pascal’s novel solid state refrigerants have no global warming potential, allow for an extremely efficient thermodynamic cycle and do not rely on “PFAS” materials.
technology_description: Pascal has developed a family of solid refrigerants that transfer heat via a solid-solid phase change induced at low pressure. This technical innovation is applicable to a broad set of addressable market segments totaling more than a trillion dollars. The advantages of Pascal’s well-defended IP are numerous - including 15-20% lower installed cost, 30-50% lower operating costs and smaller, quieter and more resilient operation. Pascal’s solid refrigerants also have a near zero global warming potential (GWP) and do not rely on any PFAS materials.

name: PASCALL SYSTEMS, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: PASCALL, a groudbreaking precision EEG-guided anesthesia management platform, aims to reduce over-exposure to anesthetics to IMPROVE POSTOPERATIVE OUTCOMS such as PREVENTING POSTOPERATIVE DELIRIUM (POD) and OPIOID DEPENDENCE/USE. Built on neuroscience research from luminaries in the field (Drs. Emery Brown & Patrick Purdon), our first innovation, the Wiresless EEG system (M0 System), achieved FDA 510(k) clearance in 2022 for R&D purposes. PASCALL target market is estimated at $2B for the operating room (OR) in the US alone with adjacent future market as emergency department and ICU.
description: Upto 25% of elderly patients undergoing surgery receiving general anesthesia suffer from persistent post-operative delirium. This is because each patient has a different anesthetic requirements. However, current practice does not have a way to quantify this requirement, leading to imprecise dosing and subsequent delirium. Typically, patients of all ages may suffer some degree of neurocognitive impairment due to general anesthesia. This is mostly short-lived but can persist in elderly patients (> 65 years old), affecting their quality of life, lengthening length of stay at hospitals and adding downstream cost to the healthcare system.
technology_description: PASCALL successfully completed development of its M0 wireless EEG monitoring platform and received FDA 510(k) clearance in May 2022. The system comprises *A bio-compatible, disposable sensor patch is placed on the patient’s forehead to establish good skin contact to measure the electric potential generated by the brain and to measure the impedance of the electrode-skin interface. *The biometric signals are amplified through a sensor connected to and attached to the patch and transmitted to a display and storage module. *A tablet visualizes the electric potential as the electroencephalograms (EEGs) and shows other derived forms such as a spectrogram (showing the time evolution of the frequency content of the EEG) that are informative to device users. *We are currently developing the follow-on next geneneration system, i.e. PASCALL precision Precision Anesthesia System based on our FDA clear device. With this system, anesthesiologists can also rely on an accurate neuroscience-based age-adjusted brain state index to maintain the patients’ brain states ‘just right’ during the case. The system enables well-managed anesthesia during the surgery, reduced length of stay for the hospital and improved neurocognition through the reduction of persistent delirium in high risk and elderly patient which cost the healthcare system upto $44,000 per patient per year.

elevator_pitch: Pendulum is the AI company that tunes supply chains. US Air Force and Fortune 500 companies as customers; 30% more accurate forecasts within weeks of deployment. description: Pendulum tunes supply chains to make companies more profitable and the world safer. Pendulum AI predicts change across the supply chain and shows organizations what to do about it - next-generation demand and sales forecasting and optimal inventory management - integrated into existing systems and processes. Pendulum Systems calibrates resource to need and supply to demand for publicly traded companies and for the US Air Force. Pendulum Predict shows our customers what will change in the future. AI-first forecasting for inventory management. Pendulum Plan helps our customers shape the future – what to do now to solve for the change that’s coming: procurement, allocation and distribution. Pendulum for retailers (Apparel) Challenge: Omnichannel inventory management – What products (in what quantities) to sell where. What inventory to order and when. Pendulum Result: Cut stock-outs 16% without increasing opex. >4% EBITDA uplift. Pendulum for Retailers (CPG) Challenge: Multi-country network; multi-unit operator and distributer to 3rd party retail. Vendor-managed and consignment inventory. Pendulum Result: 60% more accurate forecasts. Pendulum For healthcare networks Challenge: No one shows up to 30% of appointments, but systems cannot predict which appointments will be no-shows – causing revenue loss. Pendulum Result: For health system customers, generating $XXX,000/month in new, highest margin revenue by recommending which appointments should be over-booked. technology_description: The Pendulum team spent near a decade focused on the hardest problems in AI – backed by $11M in R&D funding from the US Air Force and the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. The result was AI, built for mission critical resource optimization where lives lie in the balance, deployed in the most challenging environments in earth. AI that’s resilient to volatility and uncertainty and that can learn quickly from sparse data. This is a new way to predict what will come off the shelf and what to do about it. Pendulum AI learns from customer supply chain data, augmented by proprietary systems for learning from satellite imagery, demographics, and public data. name: PHUC LABS, INC Edit
elevator_pitch: We developed a novel way to not only DIGITIZE PARTICLE SEPARATION within fluids, BUT ALSO sort desired compounds. The system uses computer vision, machine learning (ML), and artificial intelligence (AI) to “see” and separate particulates in water WITHOUT physical barriers such as filters and membranes. With our solution called Vision Valve™ (VV), if you can see it, the technology can separate and sort it. Primary applications are li-on battery recycling and wastewater remediation.
description: Accion is developing advanced technologies for the new space industry. We are striving to become a leader in high-quality, affordable propulsion technologies that enable increased access to space. The propulsion systems are some of the first that can turn affordable satellites into capable ones. Accion will reinvest their knowledge and resources into bringing the latest advances from other industries to aerospace, and will work to lower barriers to entry through decreased development cycles and costs for propulsion and other subsystems.
technology_description: With our solution, called Vision Valve™, if we can "see or detect" it, we can separate it. In doing so, we can remediate undesirable particles while also reclaiming desired ones. Our Vision Valve (VV) system is comprised of the following: 1. Computer Vision, where we detect and see compounds and particles using cameras and sensors. 2. Artificial intelligence and machine learning, where we create data models to identify and catalog many of the waters’ contaminants. Our AI instructs our hardware to remove target particles while reclaiming desired ones. 2a. Combining machine vision with multiple valves allows for the identification, sorting, and binning of particles. 3. Smart hardware with valves that are controlled by software. 4. These hardware and software components can operate in a recurring loop where impure fluids continuously flow until particles are removed and sorted to pre-specified purity levels.

name: PISON TECHNOLOGY Edit
elevator_pitch: The idea behind Pison Technology is to tap into the nerves of people with ALS using electromyography, or EMG, sensors and create a device that can translate those nerve signals into operational commands.
description: Pison Technology is creating a micromovement communication and control system to help people with ALS and other neuromuscular conditions who cannot speak or move their body. Our device is an EMG-based wearable sensor to control a laptop, phone and wheelchair. Even if a person has no ability to move, the nerves in the arms and legs are preserved and generate electrical signals. We capture the peak of that signal and translate it to a mouse click or keyboard press. Our device can help a person from initial diagnosis through progression of the condition. A person can wear 2-6 sensors for multiple channels of input to control the on-screen keyboard and mouse. The on-screen software will be customizable according to user preferences and level of tech savvy. It will be fully compatible with existing communication technologies like eye gaze. We have successfully tested prototypes on people who have lost arm and leg movement years ago and provided demonstrations to the X Prize, MIT, and MGH. The idea -- inspired by a remark made by one of the founder's mother -- is to tap into the nerves of people with ALS using electromyography, or EMG, sensors and create a device that can translate those nerve signals into operational commands. In practice, it would look like this: People with ALS wear wireless electrode pads on either their jaws, biceps, or thighs. The pads, which are equipped with small sensors, signal a device that is widely compatible with assistive and other technology. The new equipment -- wireless and wearable -- enables people with ALS to control an array of things, such as a computer, a phone, or a wheelchair. The most well-known communication technology for people with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, ALS, is eye gaze. The reality is that less than 10% of people with ALS use it. Our goal is to help every person with neuromuscular conditions have access to affordable, effective, and efficient communication. We seek to create wearable sensors that enable people to effortlessly control mobile phones, tablets and wheelchairs.

name: PLACON THERAPEUTICS Edit
elevator_pitch: Placon Therapeutics is advancing BTP-114 and other novel platinums therapies to substantially improve the efficacy and tolerability of today's widely used cytotoxic medicines.
description: Placon, based in Cambridge, MA, is advancing what had been Tarveda’s lead drug, a molecule called BTP-114. It’s meant to be a more targeted, next-generation version of the platinum-based chemotherapy compounds that are often used in cancer treatment. Placon will develop this and other next-gen platinum-based cancer drugs, hoping to come up with compounds that are safer and more effective than their predecessors. BTP-114, the lead compound, is the first next-generation platinum to arise from our proprietary albumin-conjugating, platinum-prodrug platform. BTP-114 has an approved Investigational New Drug (IND) application from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and is positioned to enter the clinic to begin its Phase I clinical study. Placon has demonstrated in pre-clinical studies that, once administered, BTP-114 rapidly conjugates to serum albumin in blood through strong covalent bonds, resulting in a substantially increased plasma exposure, long circulating half-life and increased up-take by cancer cells with certain molecular profiles. A 13-fold increase in platinum in tumors is observed following dosing of BTP-114, resulting in improved efficacy in preclinical models of lung and ovarian cancer compared to cisplatin, while also reducing key dose limiting toxicities of cisplatin.

name: PODIMETRICS, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: Podimetrics seeks to reduce the impact of diabetic foot ulcers through early detection and prevention.
description: Podimetrics is a home healthdevice that aims to free the world from diabetic wounds, a condition leading to 100k unnecessary leg amputations each year in the U.S. alone. Of the 26 million diabetics in the U.S., more than a million will develop foot ulcers each year due to reduced feeling from peripheral neuropathy. Many of these patients will acquire intractable infections and 92,000 will ultimately require amputations. Aside from the terrible human price, ulcer treatment and foot amputation cost the U.S. healthcare system $71 billion annually. Today, ulcers are generally handled through foot examinations during monthly visits with diabetes specialists. While these visits provide a baseline level of protection, they miss the vast majority of developing ulcers. The big opportunity is to catch ulcers as they are forming – when it’s still possible to prevent them from manifesting -- and ideally with minimal effort required by patients and providers. Podimetrics provides an early warning system that detects and prevents diabetic foot ulcers. Podimetrics relies on a decades-old discovery: Wounds heat up before they break down. Foot ulcers take weeks to develop, usually from the force of walking or friction from shoes. When ulcers begin to form, the tissue breaks down, causing inflammation, leading to minute spikes in temperature. The startup is scaling up and aiming to get into many more homes in the coming year. It’s also starting a new set of studies to measure the cost and health outcomes associated with the mat.

name: POLYGENCE Edit
elevator_pitch: Polygence is an online research academy dedicated to democratizing access to research opportunities for high school students. Polygence pairs curious students with expert mentors to pursue tailor-made research projects. Under the guidance of their mentors, Polygence students engage in academic fields across the humanities, fine arts and STEM.
description: Established in the fall of 2010 in Cambridge, MA, NuVu is an award winning full-time innovation studio for high school students. NuVu’s pedagogy is based on the architectural studio model and geared around multi-disciplinary, collaborative projects. NuVu provides students the opportunity to work collaboratively with academic and professional experts (PhDs/alumni from MIT and Harvard as well as leading professionals) to solve real-world problems. NuVu nurtures creative problem solving, team collaboration across networks, oral and presentation skills, technological proficiency, systems thinking, adaptability, risk-taking and imagination; All critical for student success in the 21st century. NuVu’s pedagogy is informed by the architectural design Studio where a coach guides students in hands-on problem-solving to solve complex, comprehensive problems. The Studio model uses exercises to build skills and integrates students’ knowledge in a final project. Within each multidisciplinary Studio, students explore problems rigorously by focusing on one project for two weeks. A Studio Coach mentors students to develop their project through an iterative process over the course of the Studio. Students confront the small and large contexts within problems as they are exposed to complex, ‘messy’ situations. The NuVu Team continuously evaluates students through deskcrits and final reviews. Develop Real-World Solutions for the World -- Taught within the multidisciplinary framework of the design Studio rather than traditional subjects, NuVu students acquire a highly personalized understanding of the world and how they relate to it and can fully participate in it. They develop multiple solutions to problems and learn the importance of moving from one solution to the next, combining, exploring and thinking of the possibilities. They also learn how to change their perspective on an issue quickly. They learn that solutions depend on perspective, and only by understanding an issue from multiple perspectives can they fully explore the terrain of possibilities. Iterative Process, Constant Feedback -- The iterative process, or process of refining an idea, product or solution, in the design studio is intended to provide students with continual feedback from NuVu Coaches and Staff on performance as well as product. NuVu students also experience working in an intense, feedback-rich environment that provides them with information and support for continuous self-evaluation, reflection, and improvement. Learn in New Ways -- NuVu challenges students to learn in new ways: analytical thinkers are inspired to explore their creative selves, while creative students expand their capacity to think and learn analytically. NuVu capitalizes on the immense resources of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and Harvard University to focus on hands-on problem solving, encourage an inventive culture, promote peer teaching and learning, and cultivate students’ curiosity. Portfolio-Based Assessment -- Instead of grading, NuVu uses a portfolio-based assessment. A portfolio serves as a compilation of student work done at NuVu over the course of the term, semester or full year and is meant to show the student's growth over time and development of key academic and life skills (creativity, critical thinking, collaboration, communication, research, quantitative reasoning and analysis). Each NuVu student is provided with their own online profile on NuVu's online platform where they document and present their work. At frequent periods during the term, NuVu's team works with the student to assess how far the student has developed since the beginning of the term. The portfolio-based assessment helps make learning and assessment relevant to students' lives.
technology_description: Online marketplace connecting academic mentors with high school students. React frontend, Django backend.

We provide university admins access to a dashboard where they can assess the structural quality of the papers written by the researchers affiliated with their institution by subject (reference quality, structural completeness, readability, etc.). name: PREDYCT, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: Predyct delivers zero-power sensors and wireless network automating energy infrastructure monitoring, with specific focus on wind assets. Hybrid AI, pre-trained on a large physics model, utilizes field data for online training delivering insights for predictive operations & maintenance (O&M) saving cost & reducing emission. Predyct has exclusively licensed MIT-developed technology, built an experienced team, have ongoing pilot with major energy operators and a strong sales pipeline. We will be r
description: To achieve ambitious energy transition goals demand production of 115GW of energy from offshore wind by 2030, it is imperative to cut the Levelized Cost of Energy (LCOE) by a third. The scale of offshore wind platforms, however, significantly exceeds that of their onshore counterparts, leading to escalating costs. For instance, the average blade lengths of offshore wind turbines are more than twice as long as those onshore, often exceeding 100 meters. Coupled with complex dynamics of not just wind, but also ocean loading on offshore wind assets, we face unprecedented challenges in design, installation, operations and maintenance (O&M). The role of smart assets and field automation in mitigating O&M costs is pivotal. However, the journey towards a fully automated future requires continuous data from critical components. While condition monitoring for nacelle components like gearboxes and electric generators is relatively mature, key assets like blades, towers, foundations, mooring lines, and cables are seldom instrumented. The calendar-based inspection and maintenance of these assets pose serious challenges to their performance, integrity, reliability, life extension, and cost-effectiveness. For example, leading edge erosion on blades can lead to an annual energy production loss of approximately 5% in the initial years of wind turbine operation, potentially reaching 20-25% if left unattended. Blade cracks and debonding result in integrity loss, unforeseen repairs, production loss, and a shortened lifecycle. The absence of performance data contributes to sub-optimal designs of offshore wind foundations, leading to escalating costs and high material requirements adding GHG emissions. Current sensor technologies (motion, strain, fibre-optics) and non-destructive technologies (ultrasonic, electromagnetic, radiographic) demand constant power for data measurement and storage, necessitating extensive wiring or frequent battery replacement. Given the dynamics, size, and distance to power sources of structural components (blades, tower, foundations), the use of existing sensor or NDT solutions for long-term deployment involves high costs, frequent maintenance, and complex installation procedures thereby limiting their scaled deployments, and continued high cost of offshore wind O&M.
technology_description: Predyct automates infrastructure condition monitoring and deliver AI-enabled insights for maintenance, resource planning, extended operations and early warning of failures. The complete solution delivered by Predyct include: 1. Zero-power sensor network for tracking silent killers (fatigue, corrosion, erosion etc.) for industrial operations. No battery replacement, easy to install and wireless data through asset (blade, tower, foundation, pipeline etc.) lifecycle. 2. Wireless power and communication network that is easy to install without requiring specialist personnel. 3. Hybrid AI, pre-trained on a large physics model, utilizes field data for high fidelity predictive insights. 4. Operations guidance dashboard providing ease of access to critical asset integrity, performance and sustainability insights. 1 and 2 substantially replace manual inspection and NDT. This eliminates the costs and carbon emissions related to such activities and associated transportation costs and emissions. 3 and 4 provide decision support which drives substantial improvements in the accuracy and value of digital twins.
mit_connection: MIT-licensed technology | Predyct has licensed a technology co-developed and co-owned by MIT and it's partners.
contact: himanshu@predyct.io, startupexchange-admin@mit.edu, startupexchange@mit.edu
keywords: predictive maintenance, Zero-power sensors, Nanotechnology, Wireless network, Hybrid AI/ML, Renewable Energy, Wind infrastructure

name: PROFIT ISLE, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: Make Your Data Speak Profit The Profit Isle Platform integrates, cleanses, and transforms business data—from any system or spreadsheet—generating a comprehensive P&L statement for every invoice line of every transaction. With the Profit Isle Platform, teams can: – Interpret complex, disjointed data – Unlock hidden profit patterns previously hidden by gross margins – Drive value to the bottom line in weeks – Fuel Generative AI projects using coherent datasets ready for AI
description: The Profit Isle Platform empowers customers to make their incoherent enterprise data speak profit. With our platform, companies can address key industry issues, drive value to the bottom line in weeks, and create a coherent, scalable dataset that's ready for AI. Deployed on Google Cloud Platform, Profit Isle systematically integrates and transforms all data from siloed systems, assigning general ledger costs to each transaction, and generating a full P&L for every invoice line. Our algorithms identify errors and outliers, improving data quality. Our platform leverages Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), providing customers with actionable insights and recommendations through Generative AI by accessing and retrieving relevant information from a vast database of customer data and historical records. The platform continuously learns, delivering more accurate insights over time. With Profit Isle, customers can unlock hidden profit patterns and drive value to the bottom line in weeks. Businesses looking to integrate Generative AI into their processes—beyond standard large language models—can transform their business data using the language of profit and gain a coherent dataset that's structured and ready for Generative AI applications. Profit Isle is a SaaS platform that supports companies in the retail, distribution, manufacturing, consulting, and services industries. Learn more at www.profitisle.com
technology_description: The Profit Isle Platform and our proven methodology is grounded in insights and techniques originally developed by MIT’s Senior Lecturer, Jonathan Byrnes. We've advanced the platform over the last 10 years and are embracing the future of AI for businesses through our certified Build and Service partnerships with Google Cloud. Profit Isle provides two different offerings that can be sold separately or as a bundle. Ai.R (AI Readiness): Ai.R is our method to get a company's data AI-ready. First, we integrate all data into a secure Google Cloud environment. Next, we cleanse and transform the data—assigning GL costs to each transaction, generating a full P&L for every invoice line. Our algorithms identify errors and outliers, improving data quality. With Ai.R, customers gain a coherent dataset, updated every period, ready for BI and AI applications. PI Platform: Our PI Platform is built on a modular framework and supports leaders in retail, distribution, manufacturing, services, and consulting. Our SaaS platform has processed over $200B of customer revenues, helping teams focus efforts and make data-driven, high-impact decisions to improve profitability in just weeks.

name: PROJECTUS.AI Edit
elevator_pitch: ProjectUs.ai is an MIT Media Lab spinoff that developed a tool to help people to develop their emotional intelligence skills (e.g., self-awareness, effective communication, empathy, etc.). It is practically an AI system that analyzes people's bio-signals (e.g., voice, body language, choice of words, etc.) and gives them feedback about emotions and conversation dynamics. They support organizations with their engagement, wellbeing, and productivity, with a strong focus on privacy and ethical AI. Their work has received recognitions from the United Nations, the US National Science Foundation, NVIDIA, among others.
description: While AI has the potential to make us faster, more productive, and better equipped, we can also pose an existential threat to humanity. In the span of a few months, GenAI has made enormous leaps at a human-like capabilities. Yet, we, humans are only starting to wonder what this means for us, our jobs, identities, and human relationships. - How will we keep evolving human talent for a world of synergetic collaboration with AI? - How will we nurture our human identity and mental wellbeing? At ProjectUs.ai, we believe the best way of preparing for a world of ubiquitous AI, is by using artificial intelligence rather than replace, our human intelligence. So, what if we stopped worrying about AI being better, and start focusing on how AI can make us better?
technology_description: Stemming from 4 years of research at the MIT Media Lab, ProjectUs.ai is a system that uses advanced bio signal processes for people’s day-to-day interactions during video calls. By analyzing our interactions (e.g., tone of voice, use of words, body language, etc.) across a diverse set of circumstances about us and becomes able to give us personalized feedback on a broad set of behaviors such as our communication, empathy, and collaboration. As shown through our research and on-the-ground deployments, over time, this personalized, adaptive, and fully can become more self-aware and significantly improve the targeted skills. Beyond the advanced algorithms that power ProjectUs.ai, the tool’s impact is rooted in its access to a large dataset work with any videoconferencing device and platform, and almost zero marginal cost – making it easily accessible.

name: PROTECTED Edit
elevator_pitch: Violent attacks, particularly those in schools conducted with firearms, pose a serious threat to our most precious resource - our children and our loved ones. These attacks can be difficult to predict or prevent, leaving victims unprepared. ProtectEd provides a unique security solution to this problem - the ProtectEd Bookshelf, which serves as a physical barricade, ballistic barrier, and psychological deterrent against violence in schools, government buildings, and offices.
description: Established in the fall of 2010 in Cambridge, MA, NuVu is an award winning full-time innovation studio for high school students. NuVu’s pedagogy is based on the architectural studio model and geared around multi-disciplinary, collaborative projects. NuVu provides students the opportunity to work collaboratively with academic and professional experts (PhDs/alumni from MIT and Harvard as well as leading professionals) to solve real-world problems. NuVu nurtures creative problem solving, team collaboration across networks, oral and presentation skills, technological proficiency, systems thinking, adaptability, risk-taking and imagination; All critical for student success in the 21st century. NuVu’s pedagogy is informed by the architectural design Studio where a coach guides students in hands-on problem-solving to solve complex, comprehensive problems. The Studio model uses exercises to build skills and integrates students’ knowledge in a final project. Within each multidisciplinary Studio, students explore problems rigorously by focusing on one project for two weeks. A Studio Coach mentors students to develop their project through an iterative process over the course of the Studio. Students confront the small and large contexts within problems as they are exposed to complex, ‘messy’ situations. The NuVu Team continuously evaluates students through deskcrits and final reviews. Develop Real-World Solutions for the World -- Taught within the multidisciplinary framework of the design Studio rather than traditional subjects, NuVu students acquire a highly personalized understanding of the world and how they relate to it and can fully participate in it. They develop multiple solutions to problems and learn the importance of moving from one solution to the next, combining, exploring and thinking of the possibilities. They also learn how to change their perspective on an issue quickly. They learn that solutions depend on perspective, and only by understanding an issue from multiple perspectives can they fully explore the terrain of possibilities. Iterative Process, Constant Feedback -- The iterative process, or process of refining an idea, product or solution, in the design studio is intended to provide students with continual feedback from NuVu Coaches and Staff on performance as well as product. NuVu students also experience working in an intense, feedback-rich environment that provides them with information and support for continuous self-evaluation, reflection, and improvement. Learn in New Ways -- NuVu challenges students to learn in new ways: analytical thinkers are inspired to explore their creative selves, while creative students expand their capacity to think and learn analytically. NuVu capitalizes on the immense resources of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and Harvard University to focus on hands-on problem solving, encourage an inventive culture, promote peer teaching and learning, and cultivate students’ curiosity. Portfolio-Based Assessment -- Instead of grading, NuVu uses a portfolio-based assessment. A portfolio serves as a compilation of student work done at NuVu over the course of the term, semester or full year and is meant to show the student's growth over time and development of key academic and life skills (creativity, critical thinking, collaboration, communication, research, quantitative reasoning and analysis). Each NuVu student is provided with their own online profile on NuVu's online platform where they document and present their work. At frequent periods during the term, NuVu's team works with the student to assess how far the student has developed since the beginning of the term. The portfolio-based assessment helps make learning and assessment relevant to students' lives.
technology_description: The ProtectEd ballistic bookshelf is a simple, easy-to-use product that provides both a practical function as a bookshelf and a protective function as a barrier against attack. In the event of a violent incident, it can be easily rolled in front of a classroom door or window by either children or adults in seconds. It securely latches in place over the door and door frame, where it serves as a ballistic, physical, and psychological barrier. Once locked in position, the bookshelf blocks assailants from seeing inside or entering the room, and it can block the room's occupants from small arms gunfire. Additionally, there is a patent-pending psychological deterrent on the rear face of the bookshelf that has the ability to deter or delay an attack, buying invaluable minutes and seconds for law enforcement to respond.

elevator_pitch: We are focused on developing a patented SaaS software for educating and treating consumers for anxiety and depression without the need for clinical human intervention. The software is developed using clinically researched lifestyle changes and levers that are known to positively impact and permanently treat those with anxiety and depression. Existing solutions focus on utilization of the already stretched provider population and do not help educate consumers on their own self-care. Additional
description: Globally over 180 million people have reported to suffer from depression with another 250 million having reported to suffer from anxiety. Sale of prescription and anxiety and anti-depressant drugs which are known to cause dependencies continues to rise globally Additonally, globally the prevalence of youth reporting anxiety and depression continues to rise. Several research studies have revealed that on average 1 in 3 youths are reporting anxiety or depression issues within the last two weeks. Moreover suicides amongst youth also a rising concern with depression and anxiety being the key issue. Unfortunately, the ratio of patients per mental healthcare provider is 1000:1 or more globally with; over 50% of mental health practitioners experiencing signs of burnout. The need is for a novel offering that is less reliant on the low provider network and one that can help address the access gap is urgent.

All technology in use currently is based on human treatment vs. software being the provider of treatment.
