name: STRATAGEN BIO Edit
elevator_pitch: Stratagen Bio is transforming MRI into a tool for quantitative biomarker assessment and objective clinical decision making.
description: Tumor hypoxia is characterized by extremely low levels of oxygen (<15.2 mmHg/2% O2). It occurs in fifty percent1 of all tumors and is a well-established negative prognostic indicator. Poor outcomes are seen in patients with hypoxic tumors in cancers including breast, cervical, head and neck, soft tissue sarcomas, pancreatic, and prostate. These patients suffer from higher relapse rates and lower survival rates than those with more well-oxygenated tumors. These poor outcomes are driven by resistance to treatment in hypoxic tumors. Beyond patients and clinicians, it is critical for companies developing new therapies targeting hypoxic tumors to properly identify patients for their treatments.
technology_description: Our first product, the OxyTrack platform, is a proprietary tissue oxygen sensor, treatment guidance software, and AI-enabled oxygen data engine. Our platform enables clinicians to incorporate direct and absolute measurements of tissue oxygen in their treatment planning process which isn’t currently possible. Our OxyTrack platform can be used to personalize care and improve outcomes beyond cancer in applications including trauma, ischemic injuries, and vascular disorders. Our OxyTrack sensors are fiducial marker sized, provide an absolute and direct measurement of tissue oxygen, and are read using commercial MRI sequences and scanners. The sensors are made completely of medical-grade silicone and are placed using minimally invasive methods that are standard of care for the placement of fiducial markers and brachytherapy seeds.

name: SUNFLOWER THERAPEUTICS PBC Edit
elevator_pitch: Sunflower Therapeutics is a biotechnology company delivering next-generation protein manufacturing solutions designed for anyone to use anywhere. Sunflower’s automated, easy-to-use protein manufacturing solutions empower innovators to keep pace with the rapidly expanding market for innovative new medicines, food products, and other bio-produced products. Every detail of our systems are designed to reduce barriers to protein manufacturing, so researchers and developers can get results faster. O
description: We founded Sunflower to increase access to vaccines and other new biologic medicines through the development of next-generation manufacturing technologies. Traditionally, bringing these life-saving medicines to market has been capital-intensive, involving a complex development process, and large-scale, single-product manufacturing facilities. This not only denies the promise of biologic medicines to millions of patients around the world, it hinders any company developing protein-based solutions, including new foods, biomaterials, and other health and wellness products. We aim to empower entrepreneurs at start-ups and established companies alike to produce protein products when and where they are needed most by replacing complexity with simplicity using our modular, automated, and fully-integrated platform.
technology_description: Sunflower is using key technologies, including optimized microbial hosts, data-driven methods for process development, and next-generation 'small-footprint' bioprocess equipment, to democratize protein manufacturing. Our first product, the Daisy Petal single-use bioreactor system, is the only microbial fermentation system designed and built for continuous protein production. And it's the only one that empowers non-expert users to get started quickly, with simple installation of intuitive single-use consumables and fully automated operations. We are also currently optimizing the Dahlia system, an automated end-to-end system for production of up to 10 kg of purified protein annually in just 50 square meters. Designed to immediately deploy processes developed on the Daisy Petal, the end-to-end Dahlia system also includes modules for purification via straight-through chromatography, formulation via tangential flow filtration, and refrigerated collection. Sunflower also supports customers through our contract research unit by developing strains and bioprocesses for efficient protein production.

description: SurgiBox is the solution that -- Makes surgery safer for patients by reducing intraoperative air/skin contamination of incisions - Makes surgery safer for providers by reducing provider exposure to bodily fluid splashes and aerosols The team stepped back from the classic paradigm that safe surgery requires a safe operating room and protection of everyone within it. Instead, focus was on what actually matters: the patient and providers. The "safe surgery" concept was redesigned by shifting the focus of protection to the actual surgical field. SurgiBox knows that there has to be a simple and inexpensive solution which can be easily incorporated into existing work flows. Designed for surgical and ob/gyn teams operating without access to standard surgical facilities, SurgiBox: (1) Makes surgery safer for patients by reducing intra-operative air/skin contamination of incisions; (2) Makes surgery safer for providers by reducing provider exposure to bodily fluid splashes and aerosols.

description: Swift Solar is a U.S.-based startup making high-performance solar products. Swift has developed an efficient tandem solar cell structure based on a new material system—metal halide perovskites—that the founding team helped pioneer. Swift’s technology offers performance and cost advantages over today’s crystalline silicon and thin-film technologies. OTHER INFORMATION: The Perovskite technology enables efficient, lightweight, low-cost photovoltaics to include: (*) Highest power-to-weight ratio -Perovskite solar cells can achieve unmatched power-to-weight ratios due to their strong light absorption and high efficiency (*) Lightweight and flexible - New form factors for lightweight solar modules are enabled by ultra-thin perovskite films (*) Abundant and cheap materials - Raw materials used in perovskite solar cells are produced in high volume at extremely low cost (*) High efficiency potential - Perovskites can be engineered to absorb different parts
technology_description: Swift Solar stacks individual metal halide perovskite solar cells to make tandem cells. Tandems can break through the 30% conversion efficiency barrier, they can be manufactured at low cost, and they can be integrated into ultra-lightweight and flexible solar panels with up to 100 times the power-to-weight performance of conventional panels. Our perovskite tandem technology delivers abundant zero-carbon electricity for any application under the sun.

description: Synthio Chemicals provides a solution for continuous-flow manufacturing of specialty chemicals involving hazardous reactions up to the tens-of-tons per year scale. technology_description: Synthio Chemicals utilizes process intensification techniques in continuous flow to accelerate reactions and allow the use of small reactors, minimizing process hazards and increasing throughput. name: SYZONC, LLC Edit
elevator_pitch: SyzOnc, LLC is developing Hippo pathway-modulating compounds that work via novel mechanisms to treat a variety of rare Hippo pathway-dependent cancers. Our first priority is undifferentiated pleomorphic sarcoma (UPS), a rare and understudied cancer type with no approved targeted treatments.
description: Soft-tissue sarcomas are rare, diverse tumors diagnosed in up to ~350,000 patients worldwide annually. Undifferentiated pleomorphic sarcoma (UPS) is a relatively common, aggressive subtype with a 10-year survival rate of only ~25%. Importantly, the UPS standard-of-care (surgical excision/amputation and/or radiation) is invasive and poorly tolerated. Thus, novel therapeutic strategies are urgently needed. The Hippo pathway, a master regulator of cell proliferation, is commonly deregulated in many STS subtypes, including UPS; however, existing Hippo-modulating compounds are generally ineffective in this tumor type. Compounds that modulate the pathway by new mechanisms may be effective for these patients, as well as those with other Hippo-deregulated cancer types such as pancreatic and liver carcinomas.
technology_description: Several companies are developing Hippo pathway related drugs but are focused on the same Hippo pathway target, YAP1. We have evaluated several of these compounds and they do not impede the growth of our Hippo-dependent UPS cells. Through a machine learning assisted virtual screen, we recently identified two chemical series that modulate Hippo signaling in and inhibit proliferation of UPS cells. It appears that these compounds modulate Hippo signaling via a novel mechanism of action. SyzOnc will be developing these compounds towards human clinical trials.
mit_connection: MIT staff as founder | Anne Carpenter completed her postdoc at the Whitehead Institute of MIT (2003-2006) and leads a research group at the Broad Institute of Harvard and MIT (2007-present). She is a co-founder of the company.
contact: Ashley.Fuller@pennmedicine.upenn.edu, startupexchange-admin@mit.edu, startupexchange@mit.edu
keywords: Cancer, sarcoma, drug development, Hippo pathway

This reactor will reduce both cost and emissions for major commodity chemicals. Examples of these chemicals include raw materials for transportation fuel, fertilizer, and plastic.
description: Syzygy Plasmonics is commercializing a radical new technology developed at Rice University. Our technology enables us to turn traditional catalysts into high efficiency photocatalysts. This conversion allows us to produce chemical reactors that are powered by light instead of burning fuel and operate at up to 1,000 degrees Fahrenheit lower temperature than conventional chemical reactors. Through this we can dramatically reduce the cost of chemicals produced while simultaneously reducing emissions associated with their production. Currently we are capable of performing multiple different chemical reactions and plan to enter the market with photocatalytic steam methane reforming to generate hydrogen gas. Hydrogen gas made through our process will reduce costs for industry and also help enable the expansion of the hydrogen fuel cell vehicle market.
technology_description: At the heart of the chemical reactor is the world’s most active photocatalyst. This means that our reactor is powered by light instead of heat that comes from burning fuel. Because we do not need to burn fuel, our reactor is able to reduce both cost and carbon emissions for the products that are created.

name: T-OMEGA WIND, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: T-Omega Wind is radically redesigning offshore wind turbines, from the water - up. Most offshore wind turbines adopt land-based structures, incurring huge manufacturing and maintenance costs. T-Omega Wind takes advantage of being on the water, rather than fighting it. Recognizing that weight drives cost and manufacturability, we designed a floating platform that is significantly lighter than standard designs. Our turbines can be deployed at depths of 20 meters to 2,500+ meters. Our goal is to democratize floating offshore wind.
description: Both onshore & offshore wind turbines have become increasingly large over the last 40 years, and all share the same design - a single steel pole (monopole), generator within a fixed nacelle, and 3 blades. This monopole design introduces tremendous challenges for ocean deployment. Fixed bottom monopole turbines can be deployed at a maximum depth of 60 meters, which severely constrains the ocean wind resource areas where they can be installed. Turbines are constructed at increasingly giant sizes, to reach economies of scale and to resist wave motion. These turbines have incredibly complex operations/maintenance costs - often requiring $2 million per week to service offshore. The entire ecosystem is impacted by these cost challenges: wind OEM's, wind project developers, marine cabling companies, marine operations/maintenance providers, electric utilities, and legacy energy companies.
technology_description: Our T-Omega Wind (TOW) turbine has been designed from the water up, to be lighter, less costly & more manufacturable platform, which is easier to launch, install and service. The upshot is cheaper electricity in more locations, accompanied by many local jobs and fewer bottlenecks. (Our technology involves shallower floats and a motion tolerant hub – both solutions that have been overlooked by today’s industry.) We can compete anywhere that you find fixed bottom offshore turbines today, and we can also go everywhere else. We will remain an OEM, and sell our turbine to wind farm developers & electric utilities globally. A single 10MW turbine from TOW will power 5,000 homes (at 50% capacity factor). But the groundbreaking TOW platform also opens up an opportunity far more vast – the production of green fuel in the form of liquid hydrogen and liquid ammonia. Green fuel development is focused upon addressing needs for energy storage, global energy distribution, energy where renewables are poor, and energy for non-electric sectors (heavy shipping, aviation, industrial manufacturing, etc.)
mit_connection: MIT alumni as founder | Our co-Founder and Chief Engineer, Jim Papadopoulos, received both his SB (Mech. Engineering, 2A) and his PhD (Mech. Engineering) from MIT. Jim also worked as a lab manager at the MIT 'Resource Extraction Lab' from 1982-1986.
contact: dave@t-omegawind.com, startupexchange-admin@mit.edu, startupexchange@mit.edu
keywords: Floating offshore wind. Renewable energy.

name: TAKACHAR Edit
elevator_pitch: Takachar is developing small-scale, low-cost, portable systems that can latch onto the back of tractors and pick-up trucks to deploy to remote, hard-to-access regions to locally upgrade and densify the residues on-site into higher-value, carbon-negative bioproducts, such as fertilizer blends, chemicals, and biofuels, without relying on external sources of energy or heat. Our process enables rural communities to become self-sufficient for their critical chemical commodities, rather than relying o
description: Most crop and forest residues (biomass) are loose, wet, and bulky, making them difficult and expensive to collect and transport to a centralized place where they can be converted into useful products. As such, many rural, underserved communities are often shut out from the benefits of the nascent bioeconomy, and their only recourse is to burn their residues in open air. Not only does this create a $120 billion/year economic loss, but the practice also contributes to severe air pollution and elevated risks of catastrophic wildfires. While biomass holds promise as a feedstock for a variety of purposes such as renewable energy, chemicals (e.g. hydrocarbon) synthesis, filter materials, and fertilizer, traditionally it is difficult to handle because it is often present in small pockets in remote places. Transporting wet, loose, and bulky biomass over long distances is very costly, and when not consumed immediately, raw biomass tends to rapidly degrade. In the world, about 4 billion tons/year of biomass residues are burned or disposed of rather than utilized, representing a ~$120 billion/year total market potential, as well as a burden of up to 18% of global anthropogenic CO2 emissions.
technology_description: Takachar is working on small-scale, low-cost, portable systems that can be latched onto the back of tractors or shipping containers and be carried from farm to farm to locally densify and upgrade the small pockets of residues in a way that does not require external energy input. This can cut down the subsequent transportation and processing costs of biomass by up to 70%. We envision that with our work, an additional $17 billion/year of biomass can be brought to the market at cost parity compared to the status quo as affordable source of energy or other products for rural communities. By adjusting the reaction condition, we can control our process to produce densified solid output that can be processed into various types of biofuels, fertilizer, and chemicals. At scale, we can remove more than one gigaton/year of CO2-equivalent, and avoid more than two gigatons/year of CO2-equivalent. We have received support from Bill Gates' Breakthrough Energy Fellowship, Elon Musk's XPRIZE Carbon Removal, Prince William's inaugural Earthshot Prize, and the Activate Fellowship. At MIT, we were supported by the PKG Public Service Center, IDEAS Global Challenge, Legatum Center, Tata Center for Technology and Design, J-WAFS, and Sandbox.

name: TALKINGHEADS WIRELESS, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: TalkingHeads Wireless is developing the world’s most energy-efficient Smart Radio Towers for sustainable 5G+ that provide at least a 2X reduction in energy usage for wireless carriers. THW radios have a direct impact on the bottom line and critical corporate ESG imperatives, especially around climate change and GHG emissions reductions. About the Solution Founded by MIT engineers and headquartered in Boston, MA, TalkingHeads Wireless is utilizing OpenRAN technology and proprietary techniques to think differently about the way energy is treated in traditional remote radio head (RRH) design, which is the hardware box that sits at the top of the cell tower. THW solutions center on the physical design of the RRH and the corresponding proprietary software base in the baseband unit (BBU), which sits at the bottom of the tower and connects the RRH to the core network. THW intellectual property includes patent-pending fronthaul and advanced, energy-based technologies, and a data/AI-driven approach to network planning & management. THW is currently the only US-based provider, a national security asset for domestic communications infrastructure, and a competitive advantage over the oligopolistic telco market dominated by European and Chinese providers.

technology_description: The respirator system consists of a reusable facepiece and a pair of consumable filter cartridges. The reusable component is transparent to provide visibility of the wearer’s face, and can be easily sterilized or disinfected using all standard supplies and systems available in a healthcare environment. name: TECHNEXT INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: At TechNext, we are building a software product to help decision-makers evaluate and choose technologies, minus the hype, from the complete technological toolbox. It’s like buying stuff before Amazon- you had a few options and you bought whatever was in the store. Now you can select from an almost infinite variety with objective criteria. TechNext predicts yearly performance improvement rates for nearly all definable technologies for the first time using the patent system network.
description: TechNext helps decision-makers and policy-makers make better decisions by providing rapid, precise and accurate technology forecasts
technology_description: the TechNext algorithm estimates yearly performance improvement rates for nearly all definable technologies for the first time. It does this by creating a correspondence of all patents within the U.S. patent system to a set of technology domains. We have already developed a proof-of-concept system using machine learning, patent network graph analytics and natural language processing to search for a user query over 1,757 identified top level technology domains in the U.S. patent system. We analyze the search results to identify the most likely matches for the technology that a user is interested in along with their improvement rates. We also identify highly central patents and their assignee organizations. This initial analysis of technology capabilities is completed in real-time and allows iterative analytical determination of potentially interesting technologies by the user. This allows the user to compare technologies on pace to reach product development ahead of other technologies

name: TERRAFUSE.AI Edit
elevator_pitch: Our mission is to build a world where climate change risks and their impacts to people's livelihoods and property can be mitigated by accurate, timely forecasts. We envision a real-time decision making and financial infrastructure that fully accounts for those risks. Our goal is to enable an efficient, transparent, and automated climate risk transfer market that significantly streamlines and expands climate and weather risk coverage globally.
description: Based on the team’s years of research, we’re building technology that re-engineers climate and weather risk infrastructure by leveraging advances in real-time remote-sensing observational data and physics-informed AI to substantially reduce the time and cost to build and run physics-based risk models. The modular and streamlined computational AI pipeline natively enforces key physical constraints and leverages domain knowledge, while naturally integrating observational data, enabling increased training stability and efficiency. This results in 2-5 orders of magnitude speedups and to arrive at real-time, hyperlocal, scalable climate hazard estimation across perils including fire, flooding, or windstorms. Initial customers are re-insurance, capital markets, renewable energy, and S&P 500 companies including the supply chain and construction industries.

name: TERVI Edit
elevator_pitch: Tervi dignifies and improves the lives of low-income homeowners in Latin America by facilitating the enhancement of poorly finished houses, through a centralized digital platform that provides access to design, financing, and construction services. Via a one-stop shop, homeowners can find everything they need to undertake their retrofit project. Our streamlined and intuitive interface walks customers through the process of (i) selecting a design that’s tailored to fit their budget, (ii) findin
description: Low-income housing in Colombia and other Latin American countries is delivered with basic to no finishes at all. To tackle the rising housing quantitative deficit, governments have come up with programs to provide formal homes through subsidized ownership to those who most need it, and it’s mitigating a significant quantity issue, however, they completely disregard quality conditions upon delivery. Just in Colombia over 150K low-income units are delivered yearly in this condition. Unfortunately, we are providing the most vulnerable with an unfinished shell. It’s a better shell than the one they were in, but it’s not one that’s livable, and it imposes additional accessibility and financial barriers for these families to live more successfully and comfortably. To live less at risk. Ultimately, low-income homeowners take years to finish their units as they lack the expertise, financial resources, and accessible construction options. Tervi provides an alternative to this reality.
technology_description: Our technology transforms a process that generally takes weeks and requires input from various intermediaries into a seamless automated experience that takes minutes to complete. The virtual showroom provides homeowners the option of choosing and customizing to a degree a design option that is suited to fit their budget. Then, by relying on an extensive database of construction prices and networks of providers and developers tervi.co automatically generates an accurate quote based on the area and basic specifications of each unit. If financing is required, the platform enables direct access to loans through third-party lenders. Furthermore, customers can follow the progress of their home live and submit requests via tervi’s app. Our technology is also data-driven and collects data on each quote, transaction, and specification to further refine processes and moving forward add value to customers by offering additional tailored features to fit their space.

name: TESSEL BIOSCIENCES Edit
elevator_pitch: Tessel combines human physiology and AI to discover new drugs for patients with chronic diseases. We focus on restoring organ function by targeting the tissue damage and remodeling that occurs as a result of insult, injury, and inflammation. We use our platform Tesselogic to identify effective drug targets and optimize drug candidates. Tesselogic combines disease models in vitro and in silico to pinpoint causal targets that underlie clinical endpoints. This allows us to design drug candidate
description: We solve the problem of finding safely druggable targets that can reverse tissue remodeling and restore organ function in chronic diseases. We focus primarily on immune, inflammatory, and fibrotic diseases of barrier tissues like the lung and gut (e.g., COPD and Crohn’s). These diseases have known drivers that are difficult to drug safely – e.g., Notch and TGF-beta. Using our platform, we can identify tissue-specific targets that phenocopy these known disease drivers while offering a much larger therapeutic window. We use our platform not only for in-house drug development (for lung disease) but also to help others with their drug discovery campaigns.
technology_description: Tesselogic, our AI-enabled, high-throughput discovery platform, models complex human disease in a dish to prioritize drug targets by their predicted effects in people. Tesselogic combines organotypic cultures and active learning algorithms to shortlist and validate druggable targets in disease-relevant settings – all for a fraction of the cost and complexity of a brute-force screen.

name: TEVARD BIOSCIENCES Edit
elevator_pitch: Tevard is a biotechnology company pioneering tRNA/mRNA-based gene therapy platforms to cure rare genetic diseases. We leverage tRNAs to target mRNA and modulate gene expression in a precise and regulated way, and to restore non-functional proteins. Through tRNA/mRNA-based gene therapy we are addressing key shortcomings of traditional gene therapy— Delivering a large gene, and producing the normal level of protein in different cell types. Using tRNA as “drugs” we now have the ab
description: Tevard Biosciences is developing lifelong cures for patients with rare genetic diseases. They are pioneering tRNA-based gene therapies to treat severe genetic diseases not amenable to traditional types of gene therapy
technology_description: We have developed two tRNA-based gene therapy platforms with the potential of treating a broad set of diseases. Suppressor tRNA Platform, for diseases caused by nonsense mutations. One copy of the gene is mutated due to the presence of a nonsense mutation, producing a truncated non-functional protein. We deliver tRNAs with modified anticodons that read the premature stop codon and insert the normal amino acid. One “drug” can be used across diseases.” The result is a normal functioning protein. Enhancer tRNA Platform, for diseases caused by haploinsufficiency. There is one healthy copy of the gene and one non-functional copy, leading to ~50% protein levels, which are not sufficient for healthy functioning. We overexpress a unique combination of endogenous tRNAs to increase lifetime of the mRNA. As a result we increase protein production from the functional copy of the gene by two-fold. tRNA-based gene therapies have clear advantages over other types of gene therapy: - Precise & Regulated: Restores protein & mRNA to normal physiological levels only in cells that express the gene. Highly gene and mutation specific. - Size Agnostic: Accommodates large target genes. Genes that encode for tRNAs are 150 bases in size, small enough to be delivered by viral vectors. - Safe: Does not affect gene transcription, RNA splicing, or other post-transcriptional steps. Low risk of off-target effects. - Durable: Delivered in a one-time gene therapy administration through viral or non-viral methods.

name: TEXTICIAN, LLC Edit
elevator_pitch: Textician is commercializing a patented technology in text machine learning that has proven faster, more accurate, and less expensive than competing means, especially in multilabel classification problems. Primary focus is healthcare and, in particular, leveraging the text notes in the Electronic Health Record to create value. Initial application is ICD10 medical coding, with a channel partner already generating revenue with the engine.
description: Central to healthcare reimbursements, Computer Assisted Coding (CAC) adds productivity and quality to the work of human coders. Fast and accurate medical CAC is extremely challenging, though, and became much more so as the number of codes grew 4X in the transition from ICD-9 to ICD-10, leading to a need for innovative new solutions. Textician provides two options for faster and more accurate ICD-10 medical coding: (1) Delivered through on-premises applications, Textician’s ICD-10 text-to-code engine is faster and more accurate over a broad set of codes than current solutions. The engine is packed to run in its own virtual server and accessed via a simple API, so integration is easy. (2) Delivered through a cloud-based facility, Textician’s coder engine provides medical text coding speeds that are fast enough to be done on demand. Personal Health Information (PHI) security is ensured because Textician’s NoNLPTM technology can be configured so that the raw text is never sent to the cloud Textician specializes in machine learning with text, focusing on healthcare and financial applications. Healthcare applications include Computer Assisted Coding for ICD-10 medical codes (contract with leading CAC company) and using the Electronic Health Record to predict sepsis and other conditions based upon past cases. Financial applications include making classifications and predictions from news stories or other text. Textician uses machine learning from past examples, rather than manually generated rules, to build predictive models.

name: THE JESSARA GROUP Edit
elevator_pitch: With the proliferation of unmanned aerial vehicles (UAV) or drones for tasks such as package delivery, monitoring and surveillance, and information relay, automated deployment and operation have become essential. The success of this multi-billion dollar industry is heavily reliant on the drones being able to complete tasks without human interference or monitoring. Unfortunately, wear and tear, environmental conditions and accidental impacts limit the ability of the drones to perform as intended
description: De-Ice has a scalable platform technology that will first be launched in the aerospace industry. The beachhead market within this segment is comprised of air charterer companies in the United States. This market is a $400 million market and was selected based on the relatively lighter regulation, the emphasis placed on avoiding delays, and the flexibility of company budgets and purchasing decisions. The first follow-on market is commercial airliners, a $2.6 billion segment. Next, we plan to move on to European ($1.6 billion) and Asian ($1.3 billion) commercial airline markets. Finally, we will tackle other verticals including wind turbines, cars, and driveways. Every year, the airline industry devotes billions of dollars and considerable manpower to de-ice airplanes. To make matters worse, they employ a slow and harmful chemical treatment. De-Ice has created a novel technology that uses electric systems in lieu of these harmful chemicals. Our product will be manufactured directly onto airplanes, completely eliminating chemicals from the de-icing process. Additionally, our method entirely eliminates the manual labor associated with the process, and removes the ice in a fraction of the time and cost. The target business model consists of a one-time up-front installation fee, for retrofitting airplanes with our de-icing system. We will be responsible for developing and maintaining the technology, however we will outsource the actual manufacturing to a specialized third party. The beachhead market for our technology is comprised of U.S.-based private charterer companies which operate via a fractional ownership model, (i.e., individuals can purchase “time shares” in private jets from private charterer companies which own the jets). This market is a $400 million market and was selected based on the relatively lighter regulation, the emphasis placed on avoiding delays, and the flexibility of company budgets and purchasing decisions. The first follow-on market is U.S. corporate fleets ($120 million) where companies such as Microsoft own their own private jets. Finally, we will target U.S. commercial airliners, a $6.8 billion market.
technology_description: The Jessara Group’s technology is based on a sensor suite comprising several inertial, vibration, environmental, and other sensors. The output from the sensors serves to calibrate our fast-solving reduced-order finite element based digital-twin. Furthermore, our interpretable machine learning algorithms are able to simulate damage states of the drone and teach a classification system to identify and quantify the damage and operational capability of a drone. This allows mission controllers to automate task allocation to drones based on their capability. For instance, a drone might be tasked for a long-range package delivery in uncertain weather but has been classified as being inefficient and structurally fragile. It can therefore be tasked to take on a shorter, smoother mission while a healthier drone is re-tasked to complete the more strenuous mission. Furthermore, maintenance and repairs can be scheduled based on the predicted capabilities of each individual drone.

name: THRUWAVE Edit
elevator_pitch: ThruWave makes the invisible visible with human-safe millimeter waves. Our high-throughput sensors are an easy retrofit for existing conveyors and robotic material handling systems. Our sensors see through non-metallic packaging to make 3D images of the items inside. name: TIBA BIOTECH LLC Edit
elevator_pitch: Tiba Biotech is a preclinical biopharmaceutical company developing next-generation RNA vaccines and therapeutics based on a novel dendrimer nanoparticle delivery platform developed at MIT and the Whitehead Institute. Our biodegradable nanoparticles can encapsulate large and complex RNA payloads, with relaxed cold-chain requirements and superior safety compared to existing delivery technologies, to provide protection against a range of human and animal diseases. The team comprises the original ac
description: Current RNA vaccines and therapeutics reply upon a common lipid nanoparticle technology (LNP) delivery technology. This requires stringent cold-chain storage and has caused dose-limiting inflammatory side effects. The industry is looking for new delivery modalities that overcome these limitations.
technology_description: Today’s RNA vaccines reply upon a common lipid nanoparticle technology (LNP), limited by stringent cold-chain requirements and dose-limiting inflammatory side effects. Tiba’s next-generation dendrimer delivery molecules biodegrade into natural metabolites upon RNA release, avoiding the risk of bioaccumulation and adverse reactions. Using a standard manufacturing process, our dendrimer/RNA complexes form compact nanoparticles with a large RNA payload capacity and long term storage stability at 4°C. In collaboration with US Army researchers and support from the Gates Foundation, Tiba’s vaccines have demonstrated protective immunity in a variety of animal models against Ebola, Zika, and influenza (Chahal, 2016). Tiba has secured three US federal SBIR awards to develop vaccines against COVID-19, pandemic influenza, and a tick-borne virus. With NIH-funded collaborators, we demonstrated the potential for intranasal delivery (manuscript in press). This led to a five-year agreement with the government of New South Wales (Australia) to develop rapid-response vaccines against emergency animal diseases.

name: TINFOIL Edit

description: AI needs powerful hardware, making cloud deployments a default for large AI models. However, this means that AI services and cloud providers see everything we share with the AI. This raises privacy concerns at every level, from people using AI for medical purposes (e.g., AI therapists) to large corporations using AI over confidential documents and code.
technology_description: Tinfoil combines secure hardware enclaves, the latest NVIDIA GPUs with confidential computing capabilities, and other security tools to build our platform. For instance, we use transparency to enable on-the-fly client verification of our security guarantees, effectively replacing trust with provable security.

name: TNAX BIOPHARMA CORPORATION Edit
elevator_pitch: TNAX Biopharma Corporation is developing proprietary biologics for the treatment of intractable autoimmune/inflammatory diseases. The lead asset is TNAX101A (aka IMB1001), a humanized anti-DNAM-1 (CD226) antibody for the treatment of inflammatory bowel diseases. TNAX101A is licensed worldwide to IMIDomics. A second project is TNAX103, a humanized anti-CD300A antibody for the treatment of acute ischemia including stroke, acute kidney injury, spinal cord injury, etc.
description: TNAX Biopharma Corporation is a biotech startup based in Tsukuba City, Japan. The company is studying interaction between immunoreceptors and their ligands. TNAX has some proprietary research and development projects in immunology, inflammation, ischemia, etc. The company is seeking funds and licensees.
technology_description: TNAX Biopharma is studying interaction between immunoreceptors and their ligands. The lead drug candidate, TNAX101A (IMB1001), which is a humanized anti-DNAM-1 (aka CD226) monoclonal antibody. TNAX101A neutralizes interaction between DNAM-1 and its ligand, CD155, and suppresses inflammation. DNAM-1 is an activating immunoreceptor expressed on both adaptive and innate immunocytes. Expression of DNAM-1 and CD155 is negligible in healthy tissues. In inflammed tissues, however, the expression of both DNAM-1 and CD155 is significantly upregulated, and the binding of DNAM-1 and CD155 causes severe inflammation. Upon binding to CD155, DNAM-1 mediates an activating signal for cytokine production and/or cytotoxic activity in effector lymphocytes (T cells, NK cells, etc.). DNAM-1 is also expressed on the surface of regulatory T cells (Treg). TNAX101A suppresses pro-inflammatory cytokines, activates Treg and potently reverses inflammatory conditions by targeting multiple immune responses. TNAX101A has a low risk of serious infections because it normalizes inflammation without excessive immunosuppression. TNAX101A is believed to be a novel treatment option for inflammatory bowel diseae patients who do not respond to or cannot tolerate standard of care. In vivo and in vitro data show the pharmacological effects in colitis models. A second project is TNAX103, a humanized anti-CD300A monoclonal antibody for the treatment of acute ischemia including stroke and acute kidney injury. Endovascular thrombectomy and thrombolytic medication are approved for acute ischemic stroke. However, post-recanalization deterioration of prognosis has been a big clinical problem. Ischemic cell death induces inflammation, resulting in further cell death and tissue damage in the penumbra. The penumbra region can be rescued by controlling cell death-induced inflammation. Normally phosphatidylserine (PS) is confined in the inner membrane leaflet of viable cells. However, dead cell expose PS, which displays "Eat Me" signals, and macrophages induce efferocotis to clear dead cells. PS, a key ligand of CD300A, bound to CD300A expressed on macrophages induces resistance to efferocytosis. TNAX103 normalizes clearance of diseases tissue. Anti-CD300a antibody decreases neuronal damage and ameliorates neurological scores after middle cerebral artery occlusion and reperfusion in mice. Anti-CD300a antibody protes efferocytosis and attenuates acute kidney injury and kidney fibrosis in mice. It ameliorates locomotor ability and decreases areas of mouse spinal cord injury and demyelination.

name: TOP GRAIN TECHNOLOGIES INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: Top Grain Technologies is commercializing a scalable high-throughput heat treatment solution that imparts a directionally solidified grain structure to additively manufactured (AM) Ni-base superalloys, enabling their use in the most demanding high-temperature applications, from gas turbines to rocket engines. The cutting-edge Top Grain heat treatment technology will enable more efficient, higher performing turbomachinery empowered by metal AM.
description: Metal additive manufacturing processes can create intricate components that are difficult to form with conventional processing methods; however, the as-printed materials often have fine grain structures that result in poor high-temperature creep properties, especially compared to directionally solidified materials. The Top Grain innovation is a specialized heat treatment which converts the fine as-printed grain structure to a coarse columnar one, with corresponding dramatic improvements in creep behavior. The Top Grain advantage offers other key capabilities, including the ability to create functionally graded grain structures which allows selective enhancement of fatigue or creep properties in different regions of the component through control of process parameters. Another capability is preservation of the preferred <100> texture produced during printing, which serves to minimize thermal stresses that arise in service. Currently, the Top Grain heat treatment is the only feasible method to enable AM components to serve in turbine hot section applications where creep resistance is a determining factor: turbine vanes and blades. Using AM to create these components enables breakthroughs in performance not possible through traditional methods, including higher operating temperatures and lower CO2 emissions made possible through more efficient cooling strategies and novel, high temperature materials, uniquely enabled by AM.
technology_description: The Top Grain heat treatment works by converting the fine as-printed grain structure in additively manufactured materials to a coarse columnar structure, similar to that found in directionally solidified materials used in traditionally manufactured turbine components. This coarse columnar structure greatly enhances the high temperature performance of the AM material, opening up new opportunities for the advantages of AM. The Top Grain heat treatment also unlocks the potential of novel materials, such as additively manufactured oxide dispersion-strengthened superalloys, with creep resistance superior to that of cast single crystal components.
mit_connection: MIT-licensed technology | MIT faculty as founder | One of the co-founders and the chief scientific officer is Prof. Zachary Cordero from the Department of Aeronautics and Astronautics at MIT. The company is commercializing a technology from Prof. Cordero's lab and has licensed IP from the MIT TLO.

name: TRIANGULATE LABS, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: Skin cancer claims a life every five minutes. The United States spends $8.1B annually treating skin cancer. Nearly all of this terrible mortality and cost is preventible. Triangulate Labs has developed SkinMap™, a scalable system to transform skin cancer detection. Less than 10% of the at-risk population sees a dermatologist for skin cancer screening. Skinmap equips dermatologists to collaborate with the health system and the entire at-risk population to solve skin cancer. The technology be
description: Triangulate Labs, a computer vision and AI company, is the maker of SkinMap(TM), a patented system designed to give dermatologists better information so that they can catch skin cancers earlier and more easily. Triangulate was founded by Bill Hall (MIT SB and SM in Aero-Astro, PhD Operations Research) and John Schneider (MIT Sloan MBA) and is headquartered in Boca Raton, Florida.
technology_description: SkinMap collects high pixel-density, body-registered imagery from close range using a smartphone or tablet efficiently for use within the time-constrained clinical environment. Its patented algorithms track the human body’s pose and 3D form during the scan, combining collected close-up imagery with an individually tailored 3D model. This capability permits the user to conduct easy and repeatable free-form scans. The ability to body-register each pixel enables highly accurate detection of condition-relevant change, which has been shown in clinical studies to find cancers earlier and more accurately. The technology is backed by secure cloud storage and will enable Total Body Skin Examinations (TBSEs) by telemedicine, reaching the vast remote populations who lack access to dermatologists and are currently at double the risk of death from melanoma.

elevator_pitch: At Tristar AI, we keep track of manual operations in order to help reduce errors and downtime. These include ensuring preventative maintenance is happening routinely and correctly, keeping track of cycle times for palletization, monitoring the amount of production that workers place into scrap bins, safety when operating with robotics, and many more use cases. By putting cutting-edge AI in the hands of factory managers, we provide insight into worker actions, help them better train staff, and cr
description: 23% of manufacturing downtime is caused by human error. At the same time, it is common for 1st and 2nd line plant managers to spend >50% of their time on direct labor supervision. Tristar AI uses smart cameras to eliminate human error and free managers to focus on growing their business.
technology_description: Our key technology is computer-vision based human action recognition, that is, the ability to detect a pre-specified action performed by a human worker in view of a camera. The biggest roadblock for companies in this space is scalability. We solve this challenge through our proprietary action recognition engine which is significantly faster to train on new actions than traditional models. Our technique maintains accuracy similar to state-of-the-art while decreasing training time by over 50%. Data generated from our action recognition technology is presented to managers in an easily digestible manner which surfaces key issues and opportunities for process improvement.

name: UBICEPT Edit
elevator_pitch: Ubicept revolutionizes how machines perceive the world by combining next-generation image sensors with advanced computer vision algorithms.
description: Cameras often blur in challenging lighting environments when under motion, translating to poor visual data for computer vision algorithms. Scenarios like solar glare, low light, and wide dynamic range, often result in poor video quality for optical computer vision. Despite the advances in LiDAR to offset these shortcomings, visual imaging remains desirable for scenarios such as characterization of obstructions, optical character recognition, and quality control. Our technology overcomes these shortcomings. Ubicept leverages single photon perception. Single photon perception refers to utilizing individual, low-level photon data to achieve consistent and crisp imaging streams, particularly useful for computer vision applications.
technology_description: For both human and machine vision, Ubicept enables perception in traditionally challenging imaging scenarios, including objects under fast motion with challenging lighting. Important specs include the following: - Fast Motion and Tracking: The zero read noise of the sensor is well-suited for burst-mode exposure for optical flow and image formation, practically eliminating motion blur while simultaneously reducing noise. - High-Dynamic Range: 150 dB+ as sensor technology improves - Operation in All Lighting Conditions: 0.01 lux to direct sunlight - Low Latency: The effective framerate of the camera is 100k fps, and Ubicept’s embedded processing approach can provide sparse feature tracking at 10 kHz. - Color: Color imaging is possible and will be demonstrated in FY23. - No cooling requirements at standard temperatures. - Size and Weight: Sensors are of a comparable size as conventional CMOS sensors, thus can be packaged with similar size and weight requirements. - Reduced Calibration: The same imaging optics can be used for passive fast motion optical imaging, passive slow-motion imaging, and (optional) active LiDAR. - Cost, Scalability, and Manufacturability: Sensors can be produced similarly to traditional silicon CMOS fabrication. Thus, with scale, cost will be competitive with CMOS cameras.
mit_connection: MIT faculty as founder | MIT student as founder | One MIT faculty, one student CEO Sebastian Bauer Co-Founder Ramesh Raskar, MIT Associate Professor, Media Lab
contact: 55 Court Street, Floor 2, Boston, MA, 02108 • info@ubicept.com, startupexchange-admin@mit.edu, startupexchange@mit.edu
keywords: sensors, software, machine learning, computer vision, imaging

name: UBIQD Edit
elevator_pitch: UbiQD is a cleantech materials company that manufactures inexpensive low-hazard quantum dots (QDs) and nanocomposites in Los Alamos, New Mexico. QDs are particularly attractive due to their bright and strongly size-tunable color of photoluminescence. The “killer application” for this technology is using them as electricity-generating window tints for buildings. UbiQD’s vision is to power the smart cities of the future with the windows on buildings.
description: UbiQD is a cleantech materials company that manufactures inexpensive low-hazard quantum dots (QDs) and nanocomposites in Los Alamos, New Mexico. QDs are particularly attractive due to their bright and strongly size-tunable color of photoluminescence. The “killer application” for this technology is using them as electricity-generating window tints for buildings. UbiQD’s vision is to power the smart cities of the future with the windows on buildings. UbiQD is a materials manufacturing company and a technology source. Today the company sells materials for R&D, which enables validated learning, initiation of partnerships, and profitable marketing. The company’s goal is to partner with window manufacturers and supply them with QD composites for incorporation into glass windows. The company will maintain healthy profit margins by climbing the value chain (supplying a step beyond raw QDs) and/or IP licensing. What differentiates UbiQD from its competitors in the quantum dot (QD) industry (total 2015 industry sales of ~$300 million with 90% annual growth) is its focus on a specific class of low-hazard semiconductor QDs composed of CuInSeS and ZnSeS, which are synthesized by an extremely low-cost manufacturing process. Typically, QDs are composed of either cadmium selenide or indium phosphide, both of which are highly toxic and extremely expensive, which limits their application to displays. UbiQD’s goal is to enter new markets enabled by the dramatically lower costs and negligible toxicity of their materials. In a recent ranking by New Materials News, UbiQD was selected as the #7 QD company with the judges stating: “Despite its age, UbiQD has quickly established itself as one of the most interesting and innovative companies in the sector. The low price point of its low-toxicity QDs means that it is able to enter industries that have so far been off-limits.” The dry Los Alamos climate provides the perfect conditions for reproducible nanomaterial production while the close proximity to Los Alamos and Sandia National Laboratory allows for beneficial collaborations with leading scientists in the area. The company is licensing technology developed at Los Alamos National Laboratory (LANL) and MIT.
mit_connection: MIT-licensed technology | The first report of I-III-VI QDs was by MIT in 2008 (Allen P.M.; Bawendi M.G. Ternary I-III-VI QDs Luminescent in the Red to Near-Infrared. J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2008, 130, 9240.) and was the subject of a patent filing (“Semiconductor Nanocrystals” 12/864,488). UbiQD has an exclusive license to this IP.

name: ULTORG LLC Edit
elevator_pitch: Ultorg is a spreadsheet-like, general-purpose user interface for relational databases. With Ultorg, analysts, managers, and other users internal to an organization can work directly with company data in Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, or SQL Server databases, without having to wait for the IT department to build them a custom user interface.
description: The relational database is now 50 years old, yet remains primarily a tool for programmers. Its place is in the bottom of the software stack, serving as a general-purpose storage back-end for any kind of structured, domain-specific data: warehouse inventory, academic course catalogs, campaign finance reports, experimental results, and so on. On the front-end side, a relational database provides little help; for every new business domain, a programmer must be hired to write a specialized user interface. This is extremely expensive, and leaves relational database technology out of reach for many people, projects, and organizations. We propose a solution: A single, general-purpose user interface that non-programmers can use to interact with arbitrary relational databases. The system, originally developed as a PhD project at MIT CSAIL, is a hybrid spreadsheet/database interface designed to generalize the "boring" data displays that are seen in traditional tailor-made database applications ("CRUD" applications). Using a small set of spreadsheet-like operations, the user can quickly produce the visual equivalent of any SQL-92 query, visualizations such as crosstabs, calendars, bar charts, and Kanban boards, as well as non-tabular multi-query visualizations such as forms, dashboards, and hierarchical reports. Application areas can be found in all manner of organizations: corporations, non-profits, higher education, science, healthcare, journalism, disaster response, public administration, and so on.
technology_description: The Ultorg software is a general-purpose user interface for relational databases. The current prototype connects to any existing PostgreSQL, MySQL, Oracle or SQL Server database, and immediately provides an interactive user interface to the data, without the need to to dive into a code editor, form designer, or report generator.
mit_connection: MIT alumni as founder | Founded by Eirik Bakke (currently CEO), PhD from MIT CSAIL 2016
contact: contact@ultorg.com, startupexchange-admin@mit.edu, startupexchange@mit.edu
keywords: spreadsheet interfaces, relational databases, interactive visualization, direct manipulation, business data, project management, customer relationship management, CRUD applications

name: ULTRANAUTS Edit
elevator_pitch: Founded in 2013 by two MIT engineers, Ultranauts is on a mission to prove that neurodiversity, including autism, is a competitive advantage in business. To achieve our mission, we’re building a world-class software & data quality engineering firm that delivers superior value for enterprise customers, and designing a universal workplace that embraces diversity in all its forms and serves as a replicable blueprint for other employers.
description: Ultranauts is an onshore quality engineering startup powered by an exceptional neurodiverse team. We've been growing over 50% annually while maintaining a 100% Net Promoter Score. We work with a wide range of enterprise and startup clients including AIG, Berkshire Hathaway, BNY Mellon, Cigna, Comcast-NBU, WarnerMedia and Slack, and whenever an Ultranauts team has been benchmarked against global IT firms, we’ve delivered measurably superior results. Ultranauts has also built the world’s first fully remote workplace for neurodiverse talent, with colleagues working in 20 states across the U.S., 75% of whom are on the autism spectrum, and 100% of whom believe our differences as individuals make us better together. We are reimagining how a company hires, manages and develops talent to empower our team to perform at their best. From data-driven recruiting to objectively assess talent (reliant on aptitude assessments and job simulations vs resumes and work experience), to flexible business practices for harnessing unique strengths (e.g. remote workplace, desired-time-equivalent work week, Inclusive Agile practices), to a supportive culture that promotes continuous learning (via personalized learning pathways), we’re designing a Universal Workplace where everyone, no matter how we’re wired, has a fair shot at success.
technology_description: Ultranauts provides a full suite of quality engineering and assurance services spanning data, analytics, software and digital experiences. Our neurodiverse team combines exceptional abilities with automation and AI to efficiently and reliably improve quality for our clients. Data quality engineering engagements range from helping our clients understand data quality through rapid data quality assessments and scoring, to architecting end-to-end engineering solutions that ensure quality from the data layer to the UI, to partnering with data science teams to validate and maintain their ML models. Software quality engineering engagements include providing strategic consulting to help clients shift left, serving as the quality function for fast moving engineering teams, and augmenting internal teams with everything from functional manual testing to UI and API test automation.

name: VALFEE TECHNOLOGIES Edit
elevator_pitch: We have built an AI tool that helps students learn to speak exactly like their favorite public speakers and celebrities. Students respond to prompts, get scored, and receive feedback on how to speak better. We have run three successful pilots, and the app is developed and in testing.
description: Verbal communication is core to life and professional success. Learning to speak well requires (1) consistent practice and (2) personalized feedback. Schools do not have the staff and infrastructure to provide these two things to students. Other speech scoring platforms give personalized feedback, but do not create an experience that incentivizes engagement and consistent practice. Valfee is solving this problem!
technology_description: Unlike other AI speech coaches, Valfee has a number of questions in a number of topics so every student can find the things they like to talk about while practicing. We then use machine learning to understand what students are most interested in talking about, and what feedback is optimal for improvement. name: VASORX, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: VasoRx is developing first-in-class drugs that target a novel pathway regulating intravascular inflammation known to be associated with multiple blood vessel diseases.
description: VasoRx's lead indication is treatment for pulmonary hypertension (PH), a type of high blood pressure that affects the arteries in the lungs and the right side of the heart, as blood vessels in lungs are narrowed, blocked or destroyed. Early results demonstrate an improvement of hemodynamics in pulmonary hypertension. Results also demonstrate a regression of established plaques in atherosclerotic disease, and reduction of neointima formation in allograft failure, indicating the potential for developing therapies in these disease indications. Furthermore, with recent COVID-19 data suggesting that it is a vascular disease with potential widespread inflammation and thrombus formation, our therapeutics targeting vessel wall inflammation may have utility in treating the vascular aspects of COVID-19.
technology_description: VasoRX has created a platform combining RNAi technology targeting the transforming growth factor-β (TGF-β) pathway from Yale with 7C1 nanoparticle technology from M.I.T. Our technology indicate that TGF-β can transform endothelial cells into pro-inflammatory cells, and that inhibition of TGF-β-receptor signaling in the blood vessels can reverse inflammation driven diseases.

name: VEIR Edit
elevator_pitch: VEIR’s mission is to revolutionize the future of power and data infrastructure by delivering superconducting solutions that drive unparalleled performance in AI-driven data centers and empower utilities to deliver expanded, accessible, and resilient energy solutions.
description: Conventional technology cannot meet the complex power and infrastructure needs of data centers, renewable generation, and power grid expansion. VEIR’s advanced conductors & cooling systems eliminate the restrictions that delay new data center construction: increasing transmission capacity, removing power delivery bottlenecks, and enabling better performing solutions with simpler designs.
technology_description: VEIR started with a focus on solving critical problems in high voltage, overhead grid distribution and transmission applications. Previous generations of superconducting power lines use complex, closed loop, active nitrogen cooling systems that limit their use to short-distance underground applications. In outdoor applications, VEIR uses a simple, open loop, passive nitrogen cooling system where distributed evaporation delivers 20x the cooling power per kilogram of liquid nitrogen coolant. VEIR is now also developing products to solve critical bottlenecks in data center and industrial customer behind the meter applications at lower voltages (indoors and outside).

name: VENTI TECHNOLOGIES Edit
elevator_pitch: Venti is the world leader in autonomous logistics for global supply chains and industrial hubs – ports, airports, factories, warehouses, and depots. We are pioneering the future of transportation for moving goods. Venti's autonomous technology helps logistics and industrial hub customers alleviate common pain points: driver shortages, supply disruptions, safety concerns, and operational inefficiency. Our technology also helps the world move faster toward a zero-emissions future.
description: Each year, trillions of dollars of goods pass through global supply chains and industrial hubs – ports, airports, factories, warehouses, and depots. These hubs face key challenges such as driver shortages, supply disruptions, and safety concerns. Venti’s full-scope autonomy solutions require no change to existing infrastructure and work with any vehicle in any logistics or industrial hub. After three years of development in one of the world’s largest container ports, the company’s fleets can navigate complex environments and heavy traffic, with unmatched precision and the ability to park 45-foot tractor-trailers accurately down to one inch. Venti's technology is solving real-world problems for large customers in huge markets with technology that has proven safe, mature, and capable of near-term driverless deployment. The technology is more complete and rapidly able to provide value to end customers in the near term.
technology_description: Adaptable and Readily Deployable Technology Venti believes that customers shouldn't have to change everything to operationalize autonomy. Our full-scope autonomy solutions are easy to implement and/or enable rapid deployment--they require no change to existing infrastructure and work with any vehicle in any logistics or industrial hub. Our tech works with any map--indoor or outdoor--and is flexible to modify maps; has configurable operating rules to set and re-set operating conditions; and has fleet and operations management systems that are plug-in with existing systems, including automated loading/unloading via cranes. name: VERDOX, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: Verdox has found a new way of removing carbon dioxide from a stream of air could provide a significant tool in the battle against climate change. The new system can work on the gas at virtually any concentration level, even down to the roughly 400 parts per million currently found in the atmosphere.
description: Compared to other existing carbon capture technologies, the Verdox system is quite energy efficient, using about one gigajoule of energy per ton of carbon dioxide captured, consistently. Other existing methods have energy consumption which vary between 1 to 10 gigajoules per ton, depending on the inlet carbon dioxide concentration. The researchers have set up a company called Verdox to commercialize the process, and hope to develop a pilot-scale plant within the next few years.
technology_description: Traditional carbon capture systems function like sponges for CO₂. When CO₂ comes in contact with the capture material, it is soaked up and trapped inside of the structure. The CO₂ is then squeezed out in the release process by applying large amounts of heat, which breaks the bonds between the CO₂ and the capture material. This process uses vast amounts of energy and is therefore difficult to scale. Verdox, in contrast, has designed an electric system that makes it easier to both soak up the CO₂ and squeeze it back out. The design of our capture devices allows for gases to flow through with less resistance, making the soaking process more efficient. Instead of squeezing out the CO₂ with heat, we also only apply a specific voltage to the capture material to release the CO₂. This radically different approach allows for far more efficient capture and release of CO₂ using only electricity, and without the need for heat or water.
mit_connection: MIT-licensed technology | MIT faculty as founder | MIT staff as founder | MIT student as founder | MIT alumni as founder | Founder/CTO Sahag Voskian received M.Sc., PhD from MIT ChemE. He is currently a postdoc. Founder/CEO Brian Baynes received M.Sc., PhD from MIT ChemE. Founder/Advisor Prof. T. Alan Hatton is on the ChemE faculty.

name: VERSEAU THERAPEUTICS, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: Verseau is advancing a new class of cancer immunotherapies to stimulate the conversion of immuno-suppressive and pro-tumorigenic M2 macrophages into pro-inflammatory M1 macrophages. This transformation, called macrophage repolarization, induces a coordinated immune response to fight cancer.
description: Verseau Therapeutics was founded in 2017 by Bob Langer, Dan Anderson, Tatiana Novobrantseva and Igor Feldman to discover and develop a broad pipeline of novel macrophage targets that stimulate their repolarization. Today’s T-cell based immunotherapies are able to provide benefit to ~10% of cancer patients.1 They are limited by the number of relevant tumor types and the number of patients achieving strong and durable responses in each approved indication. Turning up anti-tumor immune responses in the tumor microenvironment through macrophage repolarization could allow for effective treatment across more tumor indications, as well as a more potent effect in patients within a given indication. This is possible since tumor associated macrophages are present in the tumor microenvironment of >75% of patients with solid tumors, unlike T-cells which are found in ~25% of cancer patients. In addition, Verseau has demonstrated in head-to-head ex vivo studies with fresh human tumors that our lead macrophage repolarizing antibodies can be much more effective than PD-1 checkpoint blockade at stimulating the tumor microenvironment into a pro-inflammatory state. As a result, Verseau believes its innovative programs can expand the potential clinical benefits of immunotherapy to a large, underserved patient population. The convergence of our patient-based discovery engine along with traditional biology validation tools led Verseau to the discovery of over 20 new macrophage targets. Two of those targets were prioritized and are now our lead programs, each offering unique biological advantages, targeted to distinct tumor types that are enriched with patients who are more likely to respond favorably to treatment.
technology_description: Verseau’s macrophage repolarization target discovery engine leverages human and disease biology, as well as computational approaches in a patient-focused discovery process. We are developing a robust pipeline of first-in-class monoclonal antibodies that bind to novel macrophage repolarization targets. Our lead candidates, VTX-0811 targeting PSGL-1 and VTX-1218 targeting VSIG4, are rapidly progressing toward clinical trials informed by state-of-the-art analytics and translational medicine.

name: VISOLIS Edit
elevator_pitch: Visolis is an industrial biotechnology company developing the next generation of biocatalysts that can convert renewable feedstocks into chemicals and fuels at a price point competitive with petroleum based processes.
description: Visolis has created a bio-based process that leads to the production of net-zero high-performing SAF molecules. This is achieved through the co-production of bio-based isoprene, which is used to make synthetic rubber. This process is fundamentally different from competitors that attempt building high value chemicals and polymers from ethanol, CO2, or vegetable oils. Instead, Visolis produces the energy-dense molecule mevalonolactone (MVL) that can be chemically upgraded to fuels and polymer feedstocks using common unit operations. At present, the aviation industry is aggressively searching for low-carbon alternatives that could achieve the scale and cost required for a complete transition to SAF. Even among SAF producers, Visolis is distinguished by producing both the valuable cycloalkane and aromatic components of jet fuel. Visolis blend component it complementary to most producers’ who envision using Hydrotreated Esters and Fatty Acids (HEFA) or Ethanol to Jet (ATJ) or Fischer-Tropschs (FT) processes leading to straight alkane components of jet fuels. In order to 100% replace petroleum-based jet fuel, any 100% SAF must contain 8-20% of aromatics and 10-20% of cycloalkanes to meet the standards of ASTM approved jet fuel. No current SAF production pathway offers the ability to produce both cycloalkanes and aromatics through one production process. Our process is also flexible and has the ability to co-produce the chemical isoprene, the precursor to synthetic rubber. Since isoprene is used in structural materials which harness the captured CO2, we are able to design our facility and process for the production of a net-zero or carbon-negative SAF molecule.
technology_description: Visolis’ technology combines synthetic biology and traditional chemical catalysis to produce a portfolio of high-performance aviation fuels and bio-based polymers. Our technology allows for the use of a variety of sustainable raw materials, including waste biomass and CO2, to be transformed into these high-performing fuel molecules and polymers. Our innovative production process allows for the production of cycloalkane and aromatic SAF molecules that are complimentary to the current commercial molecules which are limited to a 50% blend limit. Through the addition of Visolis' SAF molecules, we can enable a 100% SAF solution.

name: VITAKEY INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: A targeted delivery platform to enhance the full spectrum of the food supply chain For decades, the food industry has struggled to adequately deliver nutrients, vitamins, probiotics, proteins and flavors due to losses during cooking or storage. All that is about to change. VitaKey’s targeted and time-controlled release customized solution is a transformative technology that improves the full spectrum of the food supply chain - from seeds and agriculture to aquaculture, animal feed, pet foo
description: Food insecurity is a huge problem in America. Blockparty curates events to help foodies and their friends have amazing culinary experiences while also fighting food insecurity in their communities. Blockparty provides a unique experience, enjoying food and drink in the company of friends while working together to bring a recipe to life. Whether you’re an experienced chef or beginner, learn to cook (then eat!) new dishes with professional chefs. Instead of just cooking for yourself, you'll be cooking extra meals as well to be provided to food insecure individuals in your community. Giving back to your community has never been so fun (or tasty!).
technology_description: Building on 46 years of experience and achievements in pharmaceutical delivery systems, Dr. Robert Langer, Institute Professor and director of the Langer Lab at MIT, co-founded VitaKey to advance the delivery systems for precision nutrition. VitaKey’s targeted and time-controlled release technology platform can deliver micronutrients, vitamins, probiotics, nutraceuticals, antioxidants, proteins, flavors, and aromas – enhancing food and beverages and facilitating better nutritional value. VitaKey offers a single technique suitable for preserving all micronutrients — in combination with other foods — throughout the process of storage, cooking and consumption. VitaKey employs a microparticle-based technology — developed by scientists at Massachusetts Institute of Technology — that coats micronutrients with a protective coating that preserves them from heat, moisture and chemical interaction. The pH-sensitive coating only becomes soluble in the acid environment of the stomach, releasing the intact micronutrients for digestion. A different pH-sensitive coating can be formulated to release flavors in the mouth or intestines. VitaKey technology also offers new possibilities for improving the bacterial environment of the human digestive tract — the microbiome. Of the trillions of bacteria present in the human digestive tract, many serve positive functions in the digestion of food and in suppressing harmful bacteria. Imbalances in the microbiome not only play a role in gastrointestinal ailments such as colitis and Crohn’s disease, but in diabetes, heart, disease and cancer. Over-the-counter probiotic supplements — recommended for intestinal health — are also susceptible to deterioration in storage and may be neutralized by stomach acid before they ever reach the intestine. VitaKey’s targeted and time-controlled release technology protects desirable microbes from the acids and bile salts of the stomach until they reach the intestine, where they adhere to the mucosal lining and propagate. VitaKey introduces a layer by layer technology that completely protects beneficial bacteria until they reach their intended destination. Paired layers of the biodegradable polysaccharides chitosan and alginate shield the probiotics from acids in the stomach and from bile salts in the intestine. The layer by layer coating adheres to the mucosal lining of the intestine for hours, allowing useful bacteria to propagate in the intestine. Further work with the layer by layer technology offers the possibility of still more precise targeting and delivery of probiotics to specific areas of the body.

name: WALKWISE Edit
elevator_pitch: WalkWise is a remote monitoring IoT solution designed for seniors who use mobility aids, allowing for early detection of health status changes and a unique approach to fall prevention. The hardware can be described as “Apple Watch for Walkers”, and the data is proving effective in keeping seniors safe and healthy. Value-based health systems use our data to reduce total cost of care among some of their most vulnerable patients: walker users. WalkWise focuses on mobility aid adherence to reduce falls, which costs the healthcare system over $60B annually and is the leading cause of fatal injury for older adults. Numerous lives have been saved as a result of our “tip-over” notification feature. WalkWise is in-market, demonstrating fall reduction results of around 40% with early customers, and continuing to prove outcomes and grow revenue.
description: Falls among seniors cost the U.S. healthcare system over $60B, and people who use walkers tend to be at the highest risk of falling. An estimated $3,600 is spent annually on fall-related costs for people who use walkers, and falls are the leading cause of fatal injury for those over 65. Walkers prevent falls by enabling stability and allowing people to remain active and avoiding deconditioning. However, there is no tool available to caregivers and healthcare organizations to ensure adherence to this necessary medical equipment. What’s more, traditional wearable devices for activity tracking do not function for people using a mobility aid. Apart from falls, remote monitoring is an important part of the future of medicine. Early identification of health status changes or dangerous behavior has shown to be effective. However, wearables face compliance challenges and smart home solutions are often intrusive and costly.
technology_description: WalkWise is the only IoT device for use on walkers and rollators, and is the only solution focused on encouraging walker use compliance as a way to prevent falls. We are using Bluetooth Low Energy Long Range protocol and LTE CAT-M1 to communicate with the cloud. All data is hosted in a HIPAA-compliant database, and care providers access data through our API, mobile app, or web application. Our backend servers are constantly screening the data for statistic anomalies or pre-configured thresholds set by users. Care providers and families get emails, text messages, push notifications, and phone calls for time-sensitive notifications, as well as regular reporting via email. The Smart Mobility Aid Attachment itself has been engineered to last about 1 year on two AAA batteries, eliminating the “charging” problem faced by many other senior technologies.

name: WELLSITE NAVIGATOR LLC Edit
elevator_pitch: Wellsite Navigator (WN) is the most widely used mobile app in the US oil and gas industry, where over 2,000 companies use it to gather and share geospatial knowledge from more than 100,000 active users who drive heavy vehicles on thousands of miles of unmapped, ever-changing temporary roads. Dispatchers and experienced field personnel use WN to create safe and approved driving routes with location-triggered notes to off-road destinations. These custom routes accelerate training and knowledge-sharing for drivers and enable them to take the most efficient routes between ever-changing destinations while avoiding unsafe routes in unfamiliar terrain. WN serves as a geospatial knowledge base and training accelerator in a hazard-filled industry with high worker turnover -- oilfield truck driving is one of the most dangerous jobs in the US. The platform is also used to gather and share real-time field conditions such as road hazards, damaged facilities and secure access details. This is a geospatial knowledge platform built for logistics-intensive organizations operating in dangerous, irregular field conditions.
description: A need to direct large numbers of personnel, often driving large vehicles, to frequently changing, poorly mapped locations for which there are may not be definitive public road routes that are safe and efficient to the last mile; that many of these personnel do not always have prior knowledge of the energy facilities needing installation, repair and maintenance or private properties on which they are often located; and that there may be many route alternatives that are not safe or not efficient or are simply unknown and unmapped.
technology_description: The key scientific advances behind Wellsite Navigator are smartphones, high-cadence satellite imagery and GPS coverage.
