name: WORLDWIDE INCIDENT COMMAND SERVICES, INC. Edit
elevator_pitch: WICS is a California nonprofit public benefit corporation and DHS S&T Technology Transition Partner that provides technical and operational support to the NICS user community.
description: The idea is to use the available NICS web-based command & control application to rapidly equip and emplower responders at all levels with the preparation, planning, coordination, response and recovery to this epidemic. It is mostly visual and designed for simplicity and intuitive use. We believe that the Next-Generation Incident Command System (NICS), a currently available web-based command and control application, could immediately improve the preparedness, planning, coordination, response and recovery to this crisis. NICS is designed for use on small–scale to extreme-scale emergency incidents as well as planned events. It facilitates real time distributed collaboration and situational awareness across Federal, Military, State, Tribal, Local Government, Utilities, Elected Officials and NGOs. NICS, through funding from DHS S&T, has been in development since 2007 by MIT Lincoln Laboratory and used operationally in California and other locations since 2010, including 300+ actual emergency and pre-planned events (e.g., 60,000 person marathons). NICS has been uniquely designed for the TIRED-DIRTY-HUNGRY, the responder under great stress. It is simple to learn and simple to use. If you know how to turn on a computer, surf the web, and find the nearest Starbucks using Google maps, you can become a basic NICS user in 60 minutes or less. NICS is mostly visual, but also supports text based communication and the ability to integrate and display data and information from the front lines (point of the sword) to all levels of incident management and to other community members that have a “need to know” in a single and secure application. NICS is currently operational 24/7/365 and ready for immediate use or evaluation. NICS is serviced for technical and operational support by Worldwide Incident Command Services, Inc., (WICS), a California Nonprofit Public Benefit Corporation.

description: Zaiput Flow Technologies is an MIT spin-out company launched to bring innovative tools for continuous flow chemistry to the market. Devoted to excellence, integrity, innovation and outstanding customer service, the company offers devices focused on separation and extraction. Products include liquid-liquid and gas-liquid separators and back pressure regulators that are scalable, modular, and continuous. Whether you work in academia or industry, if you work in batch or continuous flow, we believe that our products will help to streamline your work, enable new approaches and allow you to harvest the power of chemistry. Zaiput Flow Technologies is a company specialized in creating cutting-edge, enabling products with a focus on separation. Zaiput is devoted to excellence and outstanding customer service. Zaiput has developed innovative and scalable liquid-liquid separators that have been designed to be independent of upstream and downstream flow conditions and are therefore very flexible in their deployment. They can be used in-line, allowing multistep syntheses and multistage separations. They can also be used to streamline separations typically performed in batch. Zaiput also offers back pressure regulators that feature a unique combination of high accuracy and precision, operate under a broad pressure range and have outstanding chemical compatibility. In addition, our pressure regulators have the special feature that the set point can be selected by the user.

name: ZAKIPOINT HEALTH Edit
elevator_pitch: zakipoint Health uses claims, biometric, and wellness data to identify chronic conditions and care services driving employers’ healthcare costs. Using predictive analytics, we develop a prioritized plan to reduce spend and improve member health. An action pathway provides guided steps, while zConnect outreach system sends personalized messages, engaging employees to improve health. Visual storytelling makes tracking impact easy, so employers can see clearly, take action, and save money.
description: Self-funded employers spend an average of $12,600 per employee per year on healthcare, yet most lack clarity on what is driving such expenses. Without transparency on what diseases are prevalent and what care services are being used, employers do not know what cost-saving actions can be taken, and they lack the tools to gather data, implement solutions, and track their impact. zakipoint Health uses predictive analytics and action pathways to help employers see clearly, take action, and save money by: (*) Identify- consolidating claims and biometric data to highlight expensive conditions and care services, predict risk, and identify cost-saving opportunities (*) Act- producing a prioritized action plan to reduce spend and improve health, supported by communication tools to engage employees (*) Track- creating visual stories to easily digest data and track the impact of actions.

name: ZCARBON Edit
elevator_pitch: ZCarbon is a Carbon Removal company that has developed a path-breaking technology that offers an ultra-low energy process for capturing & chemically storing CO2, providing a game-changing climate change solution.
description: Corporations have net zero commitments and are the largest buyers of Carbon Removal Credits. However, high quality carbon removal credits are unaffordable due to the high cost and permanence issues. This stems from the technical problem of conventional three-step Carbon Removal methods being expensive & energy intensive: 6-8 GJ/ton, $300-500 per ton, CAPEX >$1000/ton. Ideally, the energy should be <2GJ/ton, cost <$100/ton and CAPEX< $600 per ton. Further, physical CO2 storage faces permitting and potential leakage issues. Overall, climate change is a global problem and everyone faces it in the form of climate disasters. So low cost, low energy and high scale solutions are urgently needed.
technology_description: Our innovative solution involves single step direct air capture of CO2 and mineralization while eliminating the energy and cost intensive steps. As a result, our simpler approach achieves 90% lower energy, 75% lower cost and 70% lower CAPEX. Our solution provides for affordable yet high quality carbon credits enabled by the permanent chemical storage of CO2.
contact: No Street Listed, Boston, MA, 02108 • bdhar@zcarbon.us, startupexchange-admin@mit.edu, startupexchange@mit.edu
keywords: carbon removal, Carbon Capture and Storage

name: ZETA SURGICAL Edit
elevator_pitch: Zeta Surgical is a digital surgery company focused on improving the accuracy, safety, and accessibility of image guided procedures. Its FDA-cleared navigation and robotics platform leverages cutting-edge computer vision and artificial intelligence to enable surgical guidance directly at the point-of-care, democratizing care by creating new possibilities in fields such as emergency care, interventional medicine, and drug delivery.
description: When we think ‘neurosurgery’, we imagine cutting-edge image-guidance, robotics, and advanced technology. This is far from reality – common emergency neurosurgeries such as ventriculostomies are performed by surgeons ‘guessing’ where targets are in the brain, leading to over 50% misplacement rates. Simple cases that could be performed in 30 minutes, such as biopsies, require general anesthesia and clamps being screwed onto patient’s skulls, costing hospitals tens of thousands of dollars per case. Non-invasive cases, such as rTMS to treat drug-resistant depression, are performed with no guidance at all, despite studies showing that guidance can improve response rates by 2X. Our goal at Zeta was to build the ‘last’ guidance system for neurosurgery – one that can be used quickly, easily, and portably at the point-of-care, regardless of whether the patient is awake or asleep, in an emergency room or operating room, or at Stanford or a community hospital in the rural Midwest. We believe that such a tool would have a transformative impact across countless procedures, and allow providers, pharmaceutical companies and medical instrument manufacturers to develop new cutting-edge therapies requiring high-accuracy navigation.
technology_description: The Zeta Cranial Navigation System is a mixed-reality navigation system for neurosurgery, providing surgeons with 'GPS-like' guidance with millimetric accuracy in real-time. Zeta's computer vision engine ensures maintained accuracy by automatically registering multiple times a second, accounting for patient movement, and allowing for awake and non-immobilized use in both operative and extra-operative settings. The platform received its first 510(k) clearance from the U.S. FDA in September 2023.
mit_connection: MIT student as founder | Jose Amich (Founder and CEO) is a current MIT student (MBA '24)

keywords: Surgical robotics, surgical navigation, computer vision, mixed reality, focused ultrasound, Drug Delivery, neurosurgery, neuroscience, surgery

name: ZOLITRON TECHNOLOGY Edit
elevator_pitch: Zolitron Technology designs and produces micro power supplies that charge themselves.
description: As Zolitron Technology, the mission is to remove batteries from common, consumer devices. We want to replace batteries with circuitry that can store energy from the environment (e.g. solar, kinetic, heat) to provide devices with energy autonomy. Through this technology we would protect the environment by reducing the manufacture and consumption of batteries, promote safety for consumers by removing the need for laborious or ignored battery replacement, and provide a more enjoyable and convenient experience. As of yet, there has been few compelling examples of energy autonomy in our devices. These Energy Autonomous Devices will not only provide more safe and convenient products now, but enable new ubiquitous wireless devices for smart environments and the internet of things.

name: ZORION MEDICAL Edit
elevator_pitch: Developing a fully absorbable medical device platform targeting treatment of coronary and peripheral artery disease
description: Zorion Medical is developing a fully absorbable medical device platform targeting treatment of coronary and peripheral artery disease. Utilizing novel bio-materials, our unique design has the acute performance characteristics of bare metal and drug eluting stents with complete absorption following deployment. Established in 2010, the vision is to create a temporary device platform that will treat the vascular problem, deliver a drug if necessary, and go away as soon as the body has healed itself eliminating the challenges and potential complications associated with permanent implants. The ZMED device is a wire-form, magnesium-based alloy stent uniquely designed and engineered to deliver a drug and be absorbed within 6 to 12 months following deployment. The ZMED system is a low profile, balloon delivered device with advantages over first generation fully absorbable stents based exclusively on polymer technologies. The combined strength, flexibility, low profile, and design of the ZMED device enable performance characteristics for a wide range of potential clinical applications including small vessel and tortuous coronary and peripheral artery disease, AMI, long lesions, and dissections. Currently in pre-clinical development, the ZMED device has been tested in three animal studies to determine the strength, flexibility, and acute absorption profile of the device. All three studies were successfully completed and showed excellent results including little to no biological response associated with the bio-materials or performance of device. Planning is underway to finalize our next preclinical study that will determine the complete absorption profile of the device with and without drug. That study will begin in Q1, 2014. Based on these results, activities to begin final product optimization to initiate first-in-human studies will begin in early 2015.
